loans.name: Gregorio Lupercio

texts.es:
Gregorio de 53 años, tiene un pequeño Cyber, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada de un estero salado). 

El comenzó como taxista pero para dale mejor vida a su esposa y dos hijos decidió invertir sus ahorros y comprar computadoras para tener un cyber, como en el sector por donde vive era mucha la demanda, así poco a poco fue incrementando sus ganancias hasta que pudo tener su pequeño cyber. Ahora su esposa le ayuda en el Cyber mientras que el sale a trabajar como taxista. 

Una de los inconvenientes es que en ocasiones se le daña el carro, por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas y otra parte para arreglarlo, en el futuro quiere tener un Cyber mas grande y una cooperativa de carros.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 53 years old. He has a small internet cafe and lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil (near the urban zone, surrounded by a salt marsh). He started off as a taxi driver but in order to provide better for his wife and two children decided to invest his savings and buy computers so that he could have an internet cafe, because in the area where he lives there was high demand. Little by little his earnings increased until he was able to open his small internet cafe. Now his wife helps out at the internet cafe while he works as a taxi driver. One of the drawbacks is that sometimes the car gets damaged, which is why he wants to buy some tools with part of this loan and use the other part to fix the car. In the future he would like to have a larger internet cafe and a fleet of taxis.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools for repairing vehicle.

loans.name: Leselda

texts.en:
Leselda G. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 35 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Leselda owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Leselda has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Leselda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide services. This will be the first loan that Leselda has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide services

location.town: Dipolog-Gulayon, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Guljamal's Group

texts.en: Guljamal B. is the leader of the group. She is 52 and divorced. She has raised a son and now he is 32. Guljamal works as an assistant of the deputy. She also cultivates fruits, vegetables and breeds cattle. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future, she wants to increase the number of cattle she has and achieve good results at her job. Tursun S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 52 and married. She has raised five children. Most of them are married and live separately with their families. Five years ago, with the initial investment of 50,000 soms, Tursun opened s shop and began to sell convenience goods. In this way, she makes 10,000 soms per month. Her husband is a pensioner, so when he is free, he helps Tursun in the shop. With money received from the loan, Tursun wants to purchase a variety of goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she wants to open another store and start selling shoes. Aida T., 40, is married. She has a son and three daughters. The son is in the army, two daughters are at school, and the third daughter is preschool age (under 7). Four years ago, with the initial investment of 20,000 soms, Aida and her husband started to sell secondhand clothes. In this way, they make 10,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Aida wants to purchase more clothes in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she wants to expand her business and provide her children with a good education. Jenishbek B., 66, is married. He has four daughters and a son. All the children are married and live separately with their families. Jenishbek and his wife are pensioners. But the level of the pension is low, and they can’t cover their family expenses. So Jenishbek provides electrical services and also breeds cattle. He applied for the loan because he needs money to purchase more cattle for breeding. Medet A., 55, is married. He has two daughters and two sons. The first daughter is married and lives separately with her family and the other children are students. In order to make money, Medet and his wife breed cattle. With money received from the loan, Medet wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Magali  Asunción

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en Km 5 vía Manta  encontramos el Banco Comunal Loma De Los Vientos, que se reúnen cada quince días, lugar de gente dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.

La señora Magaly tiene 35 años de edad y está casada hace 13 años. Tiene dos hijos de 14 y 11 años que estudian en el colegio. Su esposo se dedica al trabajo en el campo de jornalero temporal.

Ella se dedica a la cría de aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja de pollos, nos cuenta que ella en temporadas compra de cien a doscientos pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, ella cuando ya están listos los pollos los pela y los entrega en  algunas tiendas en Portoviejo y también vende por libras en su casa. Trabaja de tres a cuatro horas al día en la alimentación y cuidado de sus animalitos y casi todo el día cuando tiene que entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar la mayor cantidad de pollos que pueda ya que se viene la época de Navidad y esa temporada es muy buena y es cuando más ganancias deja el negocio. Es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco y está muy contenta porque  le han ayudado mucho.

Sus sueños son poner una tienda y seguir adelante para darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of the city of Km 5 via Manta, you find the Loma De Los Vientos Community Bank.  The members meet every two weeks, in a place where people are mainly engaged in agriculture and in breeding animals.

Mrs. Magaly is 35 years of age and has been married for 13 years. She has two children (14 and 11 years of age), who are attending school. Her husband works as a temporary laborer. 

Magaly is a breeder of chickens and has a small poultry farm.  She tells us that during her buying season, she buys one to two hundred chickens which are bred for two to three months.  Then when the time for selling arrives, she prepares them and delivers them to some shops in Portoviejo and sells them by the pound.  She works three to four hours a day feeding and caring for her animals and then most of the day when she has to deliver her products.

This new loan is going to used to buy as many chickens as she can, because Christmas time is approaching and this particular season is very good for business. This is her fourth term with the bank and Magaly is happy because it has helped her a great deal.

Her dream is to open her own store and to continue to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: Comprar pollos. (To purchase chickens)

loans.name: Carlos Noel

texts.es: El Joven Carlos Noel B. R., esta adquiriendo  crédito por primera vez en nuestra institución este crédito lleva con fin el pago de tramitación de titulo y trabajo logístico para defensa, ese joven trabaja en el Restaurante TIp-Top en atención al cliente es un joven con mucho deseo de superación y optimismo para llegar a obtener grandes metas.
texts.en:
Carlos Noel B. R. is a young man who is accessing credit for the first time with our institution. He plans to use the loan to obtain his professional qualifications and defend his thesis.

Carlos works in the Tip-Top Restaurant looking after customers. He is very eager to overcome any obstacles and is optimistic about reaching his goals in life.

loans.use: university expenses

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Jose Luis D., es una persona sencilla y muy trabajadora , que con esfuerzos ha ido construyendo la casa donde vive, el es viudo y tiene una hijo que vive con el y seguido lo visitan sus familiares, hermanas y padres, es por eso que el ha pensado poder ampliar su casa, para poder recibirlos con comodidad, cuando lo visitan por varios dias, en ocasiones se siente mortificado porque no tiene en donde acostarlos, y piensa que con otro cuarto que agrege a la casa  el se sentira muy a gusto con su familia , por eso ha estado  construyendo poco a poco haciendole mejoras a la casa, porque piensa que asi el tambien podra dejarle una buena casa a su hijo, ya que cuando vivia su esposa, no lo pudo hacer.
texts.en: Jose Luis D. is a simple and very hard-working person who, with his hard work, has been building the house where he lives.  He is a widower and has one son who lives with him and his family frequently visit him, including his sisters and parents.  This is why he has thought about expanding his house: so that he can receive them comfortably when they visit for several days.  Sometimes he feels embarrassed because they don’t have anywhere to sleep and he thinks that with another room added onto the house he would feel much more comfortable with his family.  This is why he has been building, little by little, and making improvements to the house because this way he can also leave a good house for his son, as he was unable to do when his wife was alive.

loans.use: Expand his home

loans.name: Carmen Ester

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen; La socia tiene 39 años de edad, ella es soltera; y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica  a la elaboración de carteras y las vende, la socia se dedica a fabricar todo tipo de carteras, de todo color y de todo tamaño, en macramé, cuero, tejidas, bayetas, la socia realiza bellos trabajos manuales y los ofrece de manera independientemente, primero con sus contactos y después con las amistades de los mismos. La socia desea comprar materiales para seguir elaborando sus carteras, ella es nueva en el grupo y está muy feliz de que le hayan invitado a formar parte de este ameno grupo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar material para elaborar sus carteras y poder venderlas en navidad.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the “Los Líderes” (Leaders) community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Carmen is 39 years old.  She is single and has one child.  She works making and selling purses.  She makes all kinds of purses, in all colors and all sizes, in macramé, leather, wool and cloth..  Carmen does beautiful hand-made pieces and sells them independently, first to her contacts and then to their friends.  She would like to buy materials so that she can continue making her purses.  She is new to the group and is very happy that they have invited her to be a part of this pleasant group.  She is requesting this loan to buy material to make her purses so that she can sell them at Christmas.

She is grateful for this loan and appreciates it.  She pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy material for making purses which she can sell at Christmas

loans.name: Rubia Carolina

texts.es:
Rubia, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, tienen casa propia y residen en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, ella se dedica a la agricultura sembrando maíz y chile, su familia le ayuda con el trabajo ya que es bastante.
Ella en esta oportunidad está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono y fertilizantes, este es su segundo préstamo, con el primero realizo una siembra de manzana y media de terreno, con este préstamo quiere sembrar dos manzanas de terreno y además si le alcanza comprar dos terneros para comenzar a criarlos.
Su proyección con la agricultura es fortalecer más su trabajo, ser capaz de ir mejorando las siembras y la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rubia lives with her husband and children. They have their own house and live in El Transito, in the department of San Miguel. She works in agriculture, planting corn and chilies. Her family helps her on the farm because it is a lot of work. 

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as compost and fertilizers. This is her second loan, and with the first she planted a block and a half of land. With this loan, she would like to plant two blocks of land, and in addition, if the funds are sufficient, she would like to buy two calves to begin raising cows.

Her plan for her farm is to strengthen her work even more, so that she will be able to improve her crops and the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Buying compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more eggs and dried fish.

loans.name: Sayro Joel

texts.es:
Sayro Joel T. Z. tiene 19 años de edad, Es soltero, vive con los padres en  el  Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. No tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Sayro Joel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y una casa.

Le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Sayro Joel T. Z. is 19 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

The members of the JERUSALEN community bank are located in Caimito district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Sayro Joel is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He buys his products in the García and López shopping areas and sells his products in the Vaca shopping area.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a plot of land and a house.

Sayro Joel likes playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Boreje Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "Boreje" el grupo esta ubicado en la comunidad de Boreje 1a. Sección, la comunidad se distingue por estar llena de estanques de agua, por todos lados hay estanques, los integrantes del grupo comentan que la comunidad es muy grande en territorio y en gente por esa razon se dividio hace unos años en 3 localidades: Boreje 1a Sección que es donde pertenece el grupo, 2a. Sección de boreje y Barrio el salto, son las localidades que antes formaban una solsa, los integrantes del grupo son 7 mujeres se dedican al hogar y a sus negocios, algunas de ellas crian pollos, borregos y otras mas tienen una tienda de abarrotes. La gente de esta comunidad de Boreje es muy sencilla, respetuosa y a nadie le niegan el saludo aunque no se conoscan, los nombres de las 7 integrantes son las siguientes:
1.-Anatalia M. L., doña Anatlia tiene 53 años de edad, cria pollos y tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
2.-Angelica S. M., tiene 35 años y tiene una tienda de abarrotes
3.-Teresa F. Gonzalez, tiene 41 años y cria pollos
4.-Ma Julia S. S., tiene 40 años, y cria borregos
5.-Maria Catalina A. Marquuez, tiene 65 años y cria borregos
6.-Florentina C. C., tiene 31 años y tiene un negocio de celulares
7.-Maribel S. C., tiene 25 años y cria borregos.
Las 7 señoras se conocen desde hace tiempo, algunas de ellas son vecinas viven a lado y otras vievn un poco mas retirado pero se ven diario.
Las integrantes desidieron llamarse así debido a que habían escogido otros nombres pero todos los que nombraron ya estaban ocupados por otros grupos, entonces escogieron el nombre de su comuidad, fue asi como se quedo el nombre acentado. Doña Anatlia fue quien quedo como representante del grupo y ella nos cuenta su historia;

Doña Anatalia es casada, actualmente cria borregos y en su casa abrio una cortina para poder vender refrescos, sabritas, productos en lata en fin una tienda en general, sus hijos ya no viven con ella, tubo 5 hijos, 2 hijos ya se casaron, 1 hija se junto y dos mas trabajan en la ciudad de México, la visitan cada 8 o 15 dias dependiendo, en su casa solo vive ella con su esposo y lo que gana es para ellos dos, del negocio de que tiene comenta que los pollos no son alguna dificultad para ella puesto que tiene experiencia cuidando animales, lo que le preocupa es la tienda, hay habeces que se desanima poruqué no hay ventas, hay que no se vende y otros dias que vende mas o menos, como las ventas son bajas no hay ganancias y no hay mas dinero para invertir, lo mismo que se vende es lo mimo que se invierte, solicito el prestamo para poder invertir mas y se venda mas, por que la gente ve la tienda llena y ya puede escoger que comprar, el sueño de doña Anatalia es meter a vender fruta y verdura porqué no hay quien venda la verdura y la fruta y cree que le pueda ir bien en su negocio, el esposo de doña Anatalia es albañil y solo trabaja cuando lo puedan contratar y tambien en el campo.
texts.en:
The following group is called "Boreje." The group is located in the 1st neighbourhood of the community of Boreje. The community is distinguished for being full of ponds, there are ponds everywhere. The members of the group comment that the community is very big in territory and people, and for this reason it was divided into 3 localities a few years ago. Boreje 1st neighbourhood to which this group belongs, 2nd neighbourhood of Boreje, and Barrio el salto are the localities which were previously one. The members of the group are 7 women who work at home and at their businesses. Some of them raise chickens or sheep, and others have a grocery store. The people of this community of Boreje are very simple, respectful, and never refuse to greet anyone even if they don't know each other. The names of the 7 members are as follows:

1.-Anatalia M. L., Mrs. Anatalia is 53 years old, raises chickens and has a grocery store.
2.-Angelica S. M., is 35 years old and has a grocery store
3.-Teresa F. Gonzalez, is 41 years old and raises chickens
4.-Ma Julia S. S., is 40 years old and raises sheep
5.-Maria Catalina A. Marquuez, is 65 years old and raises sheep
6.-Florentina C. C., is 31 years old and has a mobile phone business
7.-Maribel S. C., is 25 years old and raises sheep

The 7 women have known each other for a long time. Some of them are next-door neighbours, and others live a little farther away but they see each other daily. The members decided to call themselves by this name because they had chosen other names but they were all taken by other groups. They therefore chose the name of their community, and that's how this name was settled on. Mrs. Anatalia became the representative of this group and she tells us her story.

Mrs. Anatalia is married, currently raises chickens, and in her house she has opened a curtain to be able to sell soft drinks, snacks, and canned goods - a general store, in fact. Her children no longer live with her. She had 5 children; 2 have already married, 1 daughter is in a relationship, and two more work in Mexico city. They visit her every 8 or 15 days, depending. In her house are only herself and her husband, and what she earns is for the two of them. About her business she says that the chickens are no difficulty for her since she has experience taking care of animals. What worries her is the store, there are times when she gets discouraged because there are no sales, there are things that don't sell, and other days sell more or less. As the sales are low, there are no earnings and no more money to invest. What you sell is what you invest. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest more and sell more, so that people see the store full and can choose what they want to buy. Mrs. Anatalia's dream is to start selling fruit and vegetables because no one sells fruit and vegetables and she believes that it could be good in her business. Mrs. Anatalia's husband is a builder and only works when he can be contracted as well as in the countryside.

loans.use: To buy chickens and invest in a grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 34 years old and married. She graduated from primary school. She will use this loan to purchase a sewing machine, cloth, and ribbon. The borrower has a great deal of experience in her field of work. She receives a reasonable fee for her work which is inexpensive and that makes her attracts lots of clients. The borrower has a good reputation among her friends in the market. She has a limitless ambition to further herself in her field of work.

loans.use: For purchasing sewing machine & cloth

loans.name: Akob

texts.ar: اكوب في عمر 60 سنة يعمل في الخياطة الالبسة له في عمله 26 سنة متزوج وله ولد يحب عائلته وعمله وهما كل اهتمامه يريد دائما تأمين العيش الجيد للعائلة وهو متجدد ودائم التطور في العمل له تاريخ جيد في المجموعة وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة وقد ساهم في دعم مصلحته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء ماكنة حبكة وخيوط وغيره من البضائع الخاصة بالعمل
texts.en: Akob is 60 years old and married with one child. He has been working as a sewing professional for the past 26 years. His only concern in life is his work and his family, for whom he strives to provide a decent life. Akob is very proactive in building his business. Given his good standing with Al Majmoua, Akob was interested in obtaining another loan to purchase a loom, yarn, and other materials.

loans.use: To purchase a loom, yarn and other materials

loans.name: Ivonne Veronica

texts.es:
Ivonne de 21 años, (en la foto aparece en su casa) es una joven emprendedora que le ha gustado trabajar para obtener su propio dinero. En la actualidad trabaja vendiendo ropa y artículos. 

El horario que tiene no está definido ya que trabaja vendiendo ropa como comerciante. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con sus ventas por eso trabaja todos los días. Vende pantalones, camisas, blusas etc. Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y así seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Ivonne, 21 years old, is a young entrepreneur who likes to work to earn her own money.  In the picture she appears in her house.  Currently she works selling clothes and other articles. 

She does not have a defined schedule since she works as a clothing salesperson.  She has many aspirations with her sales, and so she works every day.  She sells pants, shirts, blouses, etc.  In order to continue her business, she wants to buy clothing with the loan and thus be able to continue working.

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. is from the village of Maranding, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Ruth is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling variety of dried fish like bolinao & tamban in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra was born in 1980 and is married to Mr. Nat.  They have three children who are all still too small to work or study.  Mrs. Ra is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to sell as well as to feed her family.  She is also a pig breeder.  Her husband is a construction worker and a motorcycle taxi driver.   

Mrs. Ra wants to start a new business and needs some money for this venture. To achieve this purpose, she is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.  With the rest of the loan she will also buy one more piglet.

loans.use: buy a cow to start a new business

loans.name: Dolorita

texts.en:
Dolorita A. is from the village of Tayong, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Dolorita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Dolorita owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing wood-planing services to local community members. Dolorita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities. Her husband operates the wood planer.

In 2011, Dolorita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dolorita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for maintenance of the equipment. This will be the first loan taken out by Dolorita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for equipment maintenance

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub O. O. is a married man. His wife is a businesslady and they have six children aged between twenty-seven and thirteen years old. His business is located at the busy Nyalenda market in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya that harbors the Lake Victoria and is commonly referred to as the lake basin. 

Ayub runs a general store in which he sells items such as beverages, sugar, detergents, flour, cooking oil, etc. to the local people. He has been running this business for five years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are other people in the area doing the same business, and thus his customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well.  

Ayub is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to increase his stock of cooking oil, sugar, flour, milk and bread to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and be able to open another general store in a different area. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: buy cooking oil, sugar, flour, milk and bread to resell

loans.name: Jam Tam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Jam Tam est créé le 15 Novembre 2006. Il est composé de 09 femmes très solidaires. Elles font le petit commerce de denrées alimentaires.

Madame Awa (debout à l’extrême droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle  est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et  mère de cinq enfants.
 
 Elle vend des denrées alimentaires au marché de Kolda. Elle a plus de dix ans de pratique dans ce domaine d’activité.

Son nouveau  crédit lui permettra d’augmenter sa capacité d’approvisionnement en denrée alimentaire.

Les bénéfices serviront à aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la scolarité, de la santé et de la nourriture des enfants.
texts.en:
The Jam Tam group has been created on November 2006. It is composed of nine women  united by a  team spirit. They retail   foods products.

Mrs. Awa  (standing to the far right in the photo) is the group’s leader. She is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of five.
She sells food products at the Kolda market. She has over 10 years of experience in this work. 

The income will allow her to help her husband provide for the education, healthcare and food for their children.

loans.use: to stock up on food products for resale

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 34 years old, married to Veronicah, and has three children who go to school.

He has been selling charcoal in Naivasha town for the last three years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of his friends and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of KES 11,000 in a timely manner which he used to build his shed for selling charcoal. He plans to use the loan amount to buy five more sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Francis hopes to become a charcoal distributor in Naivasha town, selling charcoal as a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
El Señor Efrain, es una persona de 26 años de edad de estado civil soltero, pero vive en concubinato, es bachiller en humanidades, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos los cuales son sus dependientes económicos, la actividad principal a la que se dedica es la agricultura, producen anualmente papa, oca y haba en los terrenos agrícolas heredados de sus padres que se hallan situadas en la comunidad de C'aspi Cancha del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 75 Km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba. 
   
En la actividad agrícola intervienen el cliente y su esposa los cuales manifiestan tener ganas de superarse económicamente para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa certificada y de esta forma poder incrementar su producción en especial de la papa y atravez de ello obtener mayores ingresos económicos mejorando de esta manera las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Efrain is 26 years old and single.  However, he lives with his common-law wife.  He has a degree in humanities.  He lives in his parents’ house with his wife and their two children.  The children are economically dependent upon him.

His main business activity is farming.  He produces potatoes, “oca” (a small starchy tuber from the Andean highlands), and beans on the farmland that he inherited from his parents.  They are in the C'aspi Cancha community in the Tíraque municipality.  It is approximately 75 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.

Both the loan customer and his wife are involved in the farm activity and are intent on improving their economic situation.  In order to do so they see the need to request money to buy chicken manure and certified seed potatoes.  That is the way he will be able to increase his production, especially potato production.  Through this business activity he will get greater income, and he will be improving his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la sra. Vilma, quien invito y organizo a sus amigas del barrio para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, puesto que todas tenían un sueño en común que era sacar a sus familias adelante y también para que ellas puedan sentirse útiles a la sociedad y a sus familias. 
La sra. Vilma se dedica a la costura, esta casaD. hace 20 años con el sr. Francisco, quien trabaja como chofer de una linea de transporte, tienen tres hijos estudiantes uno en la primaria, uno en la secundaria  y uno en la universidad. La señora Vilma se dedica a la costura ya hace mucho tiempo en el barrio donde vive, y gracias a eso ya ha adquirido gran clientela, su sueño es poder abrir en su propia casa un taller de costura y poder equiparse con lo necesario para seguir su trabajo decorosamente.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder armar un pequeño taller en su domicilio, ademas de eso poder equiparse con los insumos que llegaría a necesitar. Ella además de las otras integrantes del comité tienen todas sus esperanzas puestas en dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Vilma set up this committee.  She invited friends from her neighborhood to join the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Commitee of Entrepreneurial Women) program and organized the group as they all share the same dream of getting their families ahead in life.  They all also want to be able to feel of use to society and their families.

Vilma has a sewing business.  She has been married to Francisco, who works as a driver on a transport route, for 20 years.  They have three children who are all studying: one is in elementary school, one is in high school and one is at university.  Vilma has been running a sewing business in her neighborhood for a long time.  As a result, she has a large customer base.  Her dream is to be able to open a sewing workshop in her home and equip it with everything she needs to continue to carry out her work.

Vilma is requesting this loan to set up a small workshop in her home which she will equip with the supplies that she needs.  She and her fellow committee members have all their hopes placed in this loan.

loans.use: to set up a small workshop in her home and to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 35 years old and lives in Bardnersville,Liberia. She is married and has two children ages 6 and 10.  For five years Catherine has been running a medicine store in her community since there are no health facilities in the community. She learned this business from a local medical school she attended. She is requesting a loan to purchase drugs( Paracetamol, Quinine, Amodaquine and Etc), Catherine plans to open a clinic in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase the drugs ( Paracetamol, Quinine, Amodaquine and Etc) for her medicine store.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María de 51 años, es viuda, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Callayuc que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesanía.

María se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra café, actividad que realiza desde hace varios, además de ser un producto muy consumido por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados y con los ingresos que adquiera puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

A observar que su negocio va creciendo a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para mantenimiento, cosecha y siembra de nuevos plantones de café, lo que le permitirá que su clientela aumente al igual que sus ganancias con la finalidad que con su trabajo y dedicación sus hijos tengas mejoras académicas y más comodidades en casa.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old, a widow, and lives with her children in their own home.  The house doesn't have basic services, and is located in the district of Callayuc belonging to the department of Cajamarca. This area is characterized by agriculture, livestock and crafts.

María works in agriculture; she has her own farmland where she plants coffee.  She has been growing coffee for many years.  Besides being a product widely consumed by people, once she harvests her crop, it is sold in different markets and she gains income to provide a better quality of life for her children.

Upon observing that if her business is going to continue growing, it is necessary to apply for a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles with Edpyme Alternativa.  María will use the loan for harvesting and planting new coffee seedlings, which will allow her to increase her customer base as well as her profits.  With her hard work and dedication, her children will have academic improvement and more home comforts.

loans.use: to maintain, harvest, and plant new coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Rosa Edilia

texts.es: Rosa vive con su cónyuge en Soledad, municipio de Colombia con el mayor crecimiento poblacional del país y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 24 a 32 años.Allí se dedica a la preparación de rollitos de bocadillo, los cuales prepara con relleno de arequipe y son repartidos por su cónyuge y sus hijos, en tiendas de los barrios aledaños a su vivienda y en la ciudad de Cartagena y  en el municipio de Bosconia en el departamento del Cesar y Sabanalarga en el departamento de magdalena, con un frecuencia semanal. Gradualmente gestiona nuevos clientes, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para abrir nuevos mercados y esto limita su crecimiento; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará materias primas como azúcar, bocadillo y empaques para conservar y proteger el alimento. Su meta más adelante es hacer adecuaciones a  su vivienda, y separar el área productiva del espacio familiar, para lograr descansar y lograr mayor sosiego.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her partner in Soledad, a town in Colombia with the largest population growth in the country. She has 5 children between the ages of 24 and 32. She makes guava paste rolls which she fills with caramel sauce and her sons and husband distribute them weekly to the stores in nearby neighborhoods and also in the city of Cartagena and town of Bosconia in the state of Cesar and Sabanalarga in the state of Magdalena. Gradually she develops new customers, but her business capital isn't sufficient to open up new markets and this limits her growth. 

For this reason she requests a Kiva loan, her first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy basic goods like sugar, guava paste squares and packaging to preserve and protect the food. Her goal for the future is to make improvements to her home and to separate the work space from the family space so that she can rest and have more peace.

loans.use: to buy basic goods like sugar, squares of guava paste and packaging to conserve and protect the food.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is 32 years old and married. He has 2 school-aged children living with him in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Leo is peddling fresh fish variants in the local community to make a living. He has been doing this job for 4 years already. The business has been able to provide approximately PHP 2,500 a month for the family.

Earlier this year, Leo joined GDMPC to have an access to financial services. This is the first loan ever taken by him from the cooperative. His loan application is worth PHP 10,000 which will be used to purchase fresh fish supplies and in return sell to the local community.

Leo hopes to obtain enough revolving funds for the business and acquire enough resources to vend. In so doing, he can gain more income and get the chance to build up a small fish stall operated in its own place in the mini-market lane.

loans.use: To obtain fresh fish supplies and sell to the local community.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 46 years of age and has been selling different kinds of groceries for three months. She is happy because through her retail shop business she is able to earn PHP1,500 monthly. She uses her income to pay for daily needs and savings for emergency purposes. She is thankful because she has been blessed with four children. According to her, she spends her income on her youngest child, a college student taking up criminology.

Virginia would like to buy her grocery inventory such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, ingredients and shampoo for her general store business but she doesn't have enough funds. For this reason, she is asking for an additional capital amount of PHP7,000. She is hoping that she can avail her requested loan amount in order to be able to buy greater volumes of varied groceries, at discount costs, so she can offer better prices to customers. This will help her gain a better profit within her sector. Virginia gives thanks each day for being alive and having a business that allows her to cover her household expenses. She also hopes that she can support her student until he can finished his course.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, assorted biscuit, canned goods, ingredients and shampoo for her general store business.

loans.name: Presela

texts.en:
Presela is 48 years old with six children, all of whom are educated and working now. She is married to a businessman. She has a business selling sewing baskets and tablecloths in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Presela requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan for building a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items for making sewing baskets for sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a widowed woman with no children. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for herself and electricity.

She has operated a business selling sundry products for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are her neighboring residents. She faces a major challenge of low stock turnover. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase more sundry products for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loans.

loans.use: To purchase more sundry products for her business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 54 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Emily runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. Emily has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her rice retailing business for eight years and also earns an income from a general store.
Emily aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa  is 48 years old and living in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children.  Luisa is cultivating 7500 square meters of coconut trees for the production of coco sugar known as The Organic Sweet Option.  Coco sugar is known to have health benefits and is good for people suffering from diabetes.  Findings state that coco sugar has more advantages compared to sugar coming from sugarcane even though it's more expensive. 

Luisa has 90 coconut trees and has 3 harvesters who are each collecting 8 gallons of toddy or tuba (coco sap) every day. Luisa can make 360 kilos of organic coco sugar per month, with 200 per kilo as the selling price.  Luisa was the first coco sugar maker who joined trade fairs and was able to show it to the market.  Coco sugar, an organic sugar, has high interest in the local and global market nowadays.

HSPFI is advocating organic farming and the production of organic products in the region.  Luisa is one of the privileged clients of HSPFI and KIVA, who makes available the individual loan.   Luisa is now requesting a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP. She is planning to purchase a new oven for coco sugar processing and additional cooking tools and equipment for a bigger production each month.  The loan will also be used for the development and sanitation of the cooking area or production area.  Luisa is hopeful of having more success in her coco sugar business in the local and global market.

loans.use: improve her coco sugar business

loans.name: Lutaso Inyakho B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Lutaso Inyokha B Group in Western Kenya! Simon is the facilitator of the Lutaso Inyokha B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Simon takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Simon had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Simon was only able to harvest four bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Simon and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from the maize sales, Simon will educate his children and ensure that the family has enough food.

In 2012, the members of Lutaso Inyokha B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Rebecca is 17 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala North region of Uganda. For the past 5 years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy charcoal for resale, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and pay her school fees. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to become a lawyer. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rebecca's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Irenea is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and vegetables for the growth of her rice farm.
Irenea has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to save for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and vegetables.

loans.name: Phylice

texts.en:
Phylice is a 44 year-old modest lady from Mugen area of Vihiga county, Western Kenya. She is married to Jackson, a livestock trader, and they have five children.

Phylice is a farmer and has specialized in small scale maize farming, a business she has done for the last one year. She joined KADET LTD and has been awarded a first loan of KES 30,000 which she will use to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs.  

She intends to use the profits to repay the loan and also improve her family living standards. Her dream is to continue sustaining her business so that she has stable income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Carmen Ignacia

texts.es:
Carmen Ignacia tiene 21 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la mamá y con el esposo y los hijos de 3 años y 11 meses de edad en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.
Es integrante de la VRC LAS BRISAS, se encuentra ubicada en las calles 6 de Octubre y Asad Bucaran Sector el hospital, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Se dedican a labores comerciales en general.
Carmen tiene una mini tienda de víveres vende fideos, galletas, atún, azúcar, sal, aceites. Las compras las hace en Ventanas y las vende en la tienda. Solicita el crédito para comprar más víveres cómo arroz, manteca, condimentos, colas, agua, gelatina . Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar más víveres y aumentar el inventario.
 El sueño es seuir adelante y le baya bien en el negocio. Los desafíos que se le ha presentado es en la salud. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con los niños.
texts.en:
Carmen Ignacia is 21 years old, is in a live in relationship and has two children.  She lives in Ventanas, within the Los Ríos province, with her mother, her husband, and children, ages 3 and 11.

She’s a member of the “VRC LAS BRISAS” communal bank, located on the corner of “6 de Octubre” street and “Asad Bucanran Sector el Hospital,” within the Ventanas settlement. The members are general merchants.

Carmen has a small grocery store where she sells noodles, cookies, tuna sugar, salt, and cooking oils.  She buys her items in Ventanas and sells them in her store.  She is asking for this loan to buy more foodstuffs, like rice, lard, condiments, colas, water, and gelatin.  This loan will help her buy more foodstuffs to increase her inventory.

Her dream is to continue forward and that things continue going well for her.  Her challenge is her health.  She likes to spend time with her children in her spare time.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Lentoyian

texts.en:
Lentoyian, aged 57, is a single mother of three children between 18 and 26 years old.  She rears livestock and also runs a retail shop that has been in operation for eight years. The businesses earn her a monthly income of KES 5,000.  This is her third loan with KADET and she has a good credit history. 

Lentoyian will use the funds to buy two goats, pay school fees and buy stock for her shop. She hopes to start a dairy farm in the future.

loans.use: buy 2 goats, pay school fees, and stock her shop

loans.name: 030814-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future. Liên has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Liên is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with two dependents and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. 

She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 030814-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Solidarity Group. 

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid two loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: Sabah Osman

texts.en:
Sabah Osman is 30 years old. She is a university student. 

She faces a big problem in her learning, as she has no laptop to prepare her assignments and to read soft copies of her lessons. Kaaba Microfinance Institution provided a laptop, which Sabah can pay for in monthly installments. 

After university, Sabah hopes to work as a primary teacher.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Avec-Mali

texts.en:
AVEC-Mali is a women’s association based in Mopti, Mali with 74 members. The association engages in a variety of activities, such as selling clean cookstoves, teaching women to read and write and educating women about family planning.  

In July, nine women from the association starting selling solar lamps (seven of them are featured in the photo).  As of the end of September they sold 1,200 lamps and they have ambitious plans to grow the sales. 

Korotoumou (fourth from the left) is one of nine members of AVEC-Mali who sell solar lamps. She is 47 years old and has six children. In addition to her work with the women’s association, Korotoumou is the matron at a health center in Mopti, and she sells grains.  In July, she started selling solar lamps to fisherman, students and farmers, who are reliant on kerosene and flashlights for light.  With a solar lamp, her customers can save money.  Kerosene and mobile phone charging currently cost about $110 per year; whereas, a solar lamp costs $25 and has a lifetime of about five years.  These solar lamps provide 8 hours of light and can charge a mobile phone.

On top of being less expensive, solar lamps are more durable and reliable and keep people from stealing mobile phones. “With a solar lamp, you don’t have to go to a mobile phone charging station and give your phone to someone who may steal your phone or use the call credit you have on your phone,” says Korotoumou.

Selling solar lamps provides income for the women and for the association. The women earn $2 for every lamp they sell and the association earns $3.  The money the association earns is invested in a warehouse to store solar lamp inventory and motorcycles to distribute the products.

The solar saleswomen are well organized – each responsible for her own sales territory. They educate their communities about the benefits of solar lights and generate lamp sales through group meetings and demonstrations at night.

Since customers cannot afford to pay for the lamps up front, the women need working capital. A Kiva loan will allow the solar saleswomen to obtain solar lamp inventory from NOTS Lampe Solaire on credit and then extend credit to their customers.

loans.use: to buy solar lamp inventory that they will sell in their communities.

loans.name: Igimbi Agahikaine Group

texts.en:
Matia is a Ugandan aged 64 years married with twelve children and living with four of his grandchildren that he is taking care of in Kagadi.

Matia deals in cattle and goat trade as his stable source of income and also from sale of produce. He works hard to satisfy the growing family needs and educate all his children but suffers limited capital in his business. He hopes to buy more land in future for his children’s establishment. He wants a loan to buy cattle and goats to sell.

He is a member of a group where each member guarantees the other to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy cattle and goats to sell.

loans.name: N2 Quảng Hưng - Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Hà is 49 years old and she is married. Hà lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables for eight years, but this job is unstable.

In 2014, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. Hà has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.
 
The main hardship that Hà faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to resell.

Hà hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Stefka

texts.en: Stefka G. is 50 years old. She is a deserted mother of two children. Long years Stefka has worked as a seller in many quarter grocery stores in Bourgas but it was hard for her to support her children. Seven years ago a friend offered her to start to sell baked chestnuts on the street. First she was not enthusiastic with the idea but soon she found that she can earn good money and it is her seventh winter on the street selling baked chestnuts. Now she has the opportunity to open another stall for baked nuts and need $ 1 800.

loans.use: To open another stall for baked nuts

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Mrs. Maclovia has 4 years experience on her small school. She worked for 12 years on a seamstress workshop that closed. With her liquidation money and with her sister who is a teacher they decided to establish a school. They work from Mondays to Fridays from 6.50am to 2pm. Maclovia wants the Kiva loan to invest in uniforms that would be sold to their students, as well as school materials. Maclovia is separated from her husband for 2 years already. She has a kid who studies on the same school, which is of Christian formation. With the revenue her business provides she wants to save to buy the land were it is, as she is renting now.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Make uniforms for students

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Mr. Jesús G. V. used to live in his brother’s house. Little by little he was able to save some money to build a room in order to move there with his family. Now, after 2 years he has 2 small rooms.

Mr. G. tells us: "It’s urgent that I set up a full bathroom since the one we have it’s on a well and it is quite unhygienic for me and my family ". I request for $1,000.00 for the bathroom installation.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Jesús G. V. tenía su domicilio en casa de un hermano y poco a poco fue juntando dinero para poder construir unos cuartos, para irse con su familia ahora después de 2 años ya tiene 2 cuartitos.

El Sr. G. nos comenta “Me urge poner un baño completo ya que el que tenemos es de pozo y resulta muy antihigiénico para mi y mi familia”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la instalación de un baño.

loans.use: Installation of a full bathroom

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina comes from the locality of Linares in the state of Nuevo Leon. She is a widow with three children. They were the motivation for her when she started eight years ago with the sale of cosmetics. Her children were studying outside the locality and without a husband, she had to continue covering those costs. Fortunately the good quality of the products that she sells and her taste for sales has permitted her business to grow.

To be able to cover the orders of her clients, Alejandrina is requesting a credit for $250 that she will employ in the purchase of merchandise. She offers to repay this amount in three months. In your hands is the well-being of this family, contributing to the growth of this business; think no more and decide to support them.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina es originaria de la localidad de Linares en el estado de Nuevo León, es viuda y tiene tres hijos, ellos fueron el motivo por el cual hace ocho años inició con la venta de cosméticos, sus hijos estaban estudiando fuera de la localidad y al faltar su esposo ella tenía que seguir cubriendo estos costos, afortunadamente la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa y su gusto por las ventas le ha permitido hacer crecer su negocio.

Para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes Alejandrina está solicitando un crédito por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en tres meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de este negocio, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics merchandise - Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Fanny Yamileth

texts.es:
My name is Fanny R.. I dedicate myself to selling sausages, different types of pig and chicken meats, and milk-derived products. I've had this business for two years and my clients are great because they really like my products. The products are very sanitary and taste good because they come from the Olancho department, where great meats and milk-derived products are produced. My aim is to attain more products because the demand is high and all that I manage to procure sells very fast. With the funds I obtain I will be able to buy a bigger refrigerator to not only preserve more products, but more importantly, to maintain my family.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Fanny R. me dedico a la venta de carnes de res, cerdo, pollo, chorizos, y lacteos en general, tengo mi negocio hace un par de años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusta mucho mi producto, ya que es muy higienico y de muy buen sabor porque es producido en el departamento de Olancho en donde porducen muy buenos lacteos y las carnes son muy buenas, mi proposito es tener mas producto porque la demanda es muy grande y lo que ajusto a comprar se me vende rapido, con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar un refrigerador mas grande para mantener mas producto y lo mas importante mantener mi familia.

loans.use: The purchase of chicken and pig meats, sausages, tripe, cheese, and butter

loans.name: Aam

texts.en: Aam is 45 years old and married with two children, aged 22 and 20. She runs a business selling medicinal herbs. Occassionally, she assists as a midwife with a neighbour's childbirth, and also earns some income from rendering this service. As a widow, Aam is the only person left to fight and provide for her and her children's lives. She is requesting a loan  to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Adelphina

texts.en:
This is Mama Rich, so named not because she is rich but in reference to her youngest son Richard, 13, who is preceded by Fadhili, 16, and Peter, 14. However, I’m sure the nickname is prophetic. Since 2003, Mama Rich has run a grocery store in the rural town of Mailimoja, where she sells fruit and vegetables, rice, oil, and countless other food and non-food items. She requires a loan of $875 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions, as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional food stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
Blanca Sanchez has been dedicating herself to the sales of stationary products and photocopy services at the market of Del Israel Lewites in Managua. Before dedicating herself to this business, she sold water in different places. As soon as she knew that the business didn’t support her financially, she decided she had to do something about it, so she began saving her money to finally start her own business and buy stationary products. Blanca Sanchez is a single mother with three children to support. This is why she needs a loan to help her buy the right equipment for her business. She has already received 3 microloans through Ceprodel. With these loans she was able to improve her business with the purchase two glass cases to display her products in and also a small photocopier. She needs enough money to buy a new photocopy machine. Her goal is to keep restocking her business with great selections of products and acquire a new photocopy machine since the one she has now needs to be replaced.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Blanca S. desde hace 27 largos años se dedica a la venta de productos de librería y servicios de fotocopiado en el mercado del Israel Lewites en Managua.

Antes de dedicarse a este negocio, vendía agua en diferentes lugares, pero al darse cuenta de que este negocio no le beneficiaba en lo absoluto decidió realizar ahorros por mucho tiempo hasta realizar compras de los productos de librería.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Blanca S. es madre soltera y con tres hijos que mantener. Por este motivo es que ella decide realizar prestamos en Ceprodel (3 prestamos actualmente) el cual le han beneficiado para la compra de dos vitrinas para colocar sus productos y a la vez, para la adquisición de una pequeña fotocopiadora. Su meta es seguir surtiendo su negocio con mayores cantidades de productos y a la vez adquirir una nueva fotocopiadora ya que la que posee actualmente necesita ser cambiada.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables for sale and establish a business location

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
José David is a young man whose business is the transport of people throughout the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. He has been doing this for a living for 4 years, starting with a small investment of his own with which he purchased a used bicycle, and over time he has continued to fix and refurbish it.

He is father to a newborn girl and thus now bears the responsibility to provide for all of her expenses. It must be emphasized that this young man works very hard at this business, transporting people from morning until dusk. The improvement to his bicycle taxi has been carried out with support obtained through Ceprodel, loans which he has invested in the repair of the bicycle in order to offer improved service to his clients. Now his need is the acquisition of resources to provide for corrective maintenance to his taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio del joven José David es la transportación de personas en todo el municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica a esta labor desde hace 4 años iniciando con un pequeño capital propio con el que compró una bicicleta usada y a través del tiempo la ha venido remodelando.

Es padre de una pequeña niña con el deber de brindarle apoyo en todos los gastos ya que es recién nacida. Es necesario destacar que este joven trabaja arduamente en este negocio, transportando personas desde la mañana hasta el atardecer. La mejora de sui medio de transporte loa ha realizado con el apoyo obtenido por Ceprodel el cual ha invertido estos créditos en la reparación de la bicicleta para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Hoy en día su necesidad es la adquisición de recursos para darle el mantenimiento correctivo a su medio de transporte.

loans.use: Repair of his bicycle taxi

loans.name: Rahma's Tusichukiane Group

texts.en:
Rahma is 30 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, aged 9-17 years old. Rahma is a bites and coconut oil seller, who started the business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Perseverancia Group

texts.es:
The Perseverancia Microfinance Institute is a bank that is just starting out with 20 members.

The members partake in different businesses, such as food, firewood, grains, clothing, provisions, small animals, maize beverages, flowers, and bread.

The members need varying loan amounts, from 300 to 600 Peruvian Soles, totaling 9,000 soles in loans from this bank.

They will invest the loan money in the purchase of pants, polo shirts, blouses, wheat, barley, pigs, firewood, rice, sugar, cooking oil, fruits, and vegetables.

The members’ dreams are for their businesses to grow, their children to become professionals, and have their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Perseverancia es un banco que recién inicia con 20 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comida, leña, cereales, ropa, abarrotes, animales Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. pantalones, polos, blusas, trigo, cebada, cerdo, leña, arroz, azúcar, aceite, verduras y frutas. menores, chicha, F. y panes.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 9,000 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. pantalones, polos, blusas, trigo, cebada, cerdo, leña, arroz, azúcar, aceite, verduras y frutas.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus negocios sean grandes, sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase of pants, polo shirts, blouses, wheat, barley, pigs, firewood, rice, sugar, cooking oil, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. B. Thi Ngo, 51 years old, joined the Fund in 2002 with the goal of expanding her business. In previous funding rounds, her family invested in raising pigs and chicken. She is an empathic and hard working person who is always willing to learn. Her family is very successful at raising livestock, the family’s finances have improved steadily and they have been able to afford more necessities like a vehicle, refrigerator, etc. Besides the income from raising livestock, the family also has a steady income from her husband’s herbal medicine business; having this reliable income encouraged the family to go with the weekly payment borrowing method, since it fit their needs well. In this round of funding the family is requesting 15,000,000 VND to continue investing in raising pigs and chicken. The family’s average income is 2,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngọ Thị Bốn, năm nay 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2002, với mục đích vay vốn phát triển kinh tế, các vòng vốn trước gia đình chị đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Với bản chất chịu thương chịu khó ham học hỏi, gia đình chị chăn nuôi rất thuận lợi, từ đó kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển và đã mua sắm được các trang thiết bị cần thiết cho gia đình như xe máy, tủ lạnh .......Ngoài việc thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, gia đình chị còn có nguồn thu đều đặn chồng chị làm nghề bốc thuốc bắc, chính từ nguồn thu đều đặn này mà gia đình chị thấy việc hoàn trả theo tuần là rất phù hợp. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư tiếp vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình 2.000.000đ/tháng.

loans.use: feed pigs

loans.name: Idania

texts.es:
Mrs. Idania C. is a mother of four (three of her children are still studying).That is why she puts a great effort in her tortilla business, which she runs from her home in the Ciudad Sandino county in Managua.

She has come to Ceprodel in order to request a loan so that she can buy all the ingredients needed to make her delicious tortillas so that she can sell them from her home. She is a loyal customer of Ceprodel and has obtained 3 loans with them which she has timely repaid.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Idania C. es madre de cuatro pequeños hijos de los cuales tres de ellos se encuentran estudiando y por dicho motivo ella se esfuerza en su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas las cuales las comercializa en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con el cual comprar la material prima para elaborar las deliciosas tortillas y así venderlas en su casa de habitación. Actualmente es fiel cliente de Ceprodel por lo que ha obtenido tres créditos habiéndolos cancelado de acuerdo a lo establecido con la institución.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Esperanza Imelda

texts.es:
Esperanza works as a cleaning lady in a business of the city of Managua. She lives in the North laurels neighborhood, characterized by its high poverty rate. Esperanza is a single mother that has dedicated herself most of her life to trying to do well for herself and her children. According to her account, Doña Esperanza's plans for her family are: "To give a home to my children, to educate them, to give them good examples, to try to prepare them so that their life is not as hard as mine". The loan will be used to buy zinc and to put it in ¼ part of its dwelling. She will also try to begin the construction of a front wall in her dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Esperanza se desempeña como afanadora en una empresa de la ciudad de Managua, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte caracterizado por su alto índice de pobreza. Esperanza es una madre soltera que la mayor parte de su vida la ha dedicado a tratar de salir adelante ella y sus hijos. Los planes de Doña Esperanza para su familia según ella cuenta son: “Hacerle la casa a mis hijos, educarlos, darles buenos ejemplos, tratar de que ellos se preparen para que la vida no sea tan dura como la mía”. El crédito lo usará para comprar zinc y ponerlo en ¼ parte de su vivienda. También tratará de empezar la construcción de un muro delantero en su vivienda.

loans.use: To put a ceiling on 1/4 part of her house.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 32 años, es soltera, vive con su hija Susan de 12 años.
Es una mujer independiente, que pese a los maltratos de la vida, ha sabido superar con fortaleza cada golpe, ella tiene una carpintería en su casa, en la cual trabaja fabricando muebles.Este pequeño negocio viene funcionando desde hace 20 años y Maruja le pone mucho empeño en que siga produciendo y creciendo cada vez más, usualmente trabaja por las mañanas y parte de las tardes, lo cual se le hace difícil, ya que también tiene que velar por su hija Susan que está estudiando. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que es muy concurrido y la venta es muy buena.
Maruja quiere ver a su hija profesional y que no dependa de nadie para salir adelante.
Con el dinero que obtendrá comprará material (madera y otros) para producir más muebles y en el futuro tener un gran taller de fabricación de muebles con sucursales en toda la región.
texts.en:
Maruja, 32, is single. She lives with her 12-year old daughter, Susan. She is an independent woman who, despite many hardships, has overcome every blow with great fortitude. She has a carpentry shop in her house where she works making furniture. Maruja has operated the business for 20 years and she makes great efforts to maintain the business and grow it bit by bit. She usually works mornings and parts of afternoons, something that's difficult for her because she also has to care for her daughter, Susan, who is still in school.

What Maruja most wants for her business is many customers and big revenues. She wants to see her daughter settled in a professional career so that she doesn't have to depend on anyone else to get ahead. With the money that she will borrow, she will buy materials (wood and other materials) to make more furniture. In the future, she'd like to have a large furniture workshop with outlets around the area.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for furniture making business.

loans.name: Lise

texts.en:
Lise F., 52, is married with 4 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells taro, taamu, and bananas to the village people and the public 2 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be Tala (~300 USD). Lise's husband helps her operate the business.

Lise has 3 previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy things she needs for her business, including knives, fertilizers, pesticides, and taro tubers.

loans.use: Purchase taro tubers, knives, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 34-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his parents. He owns a taxi and also works as a tile polisher. He has requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to help purchase a school bus. Fadi has been an Al Majmoua client since 2004 and he paid back all his previous loans on time.

loans.use: Fadi wants a loan to help purchase a school bus

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda tiene 32 años, vive con sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 10 años tiene su propio negocio, una tienda, la cual administra de manera independiente, con ella, cada día logra el sustento para sus hijos, la atención que ofrece es diaria, incluso los domingos, realiza sus pedidos de mercadería a las casas distribuidoras para abarrotarla de productos de pan llevar, para ella es una ventaja, porque dispone de su propio tiempo, además abrió su tienda cercana a un centro de estudios y tiene buena clientela. Uno de los riesgos es el robo, por lo cual atiende con todas las medidas de seguridad. Está satisfecha, y sigue adelante porque sus hijos son lo más importante para ella.
