En el caso de Olinda, es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo, con el cual se compromete a devolverlo porque es una persona responsable. Solicita este dinero con el que podrá adquirir más mercadería para su tienda como bebidas y otros víveres.
texts.en:
Olinda is 32 years old and lives with her 3 children. She has owned her own business for the past 10 years, a store which she runs independently. Thanks to her business, she is able to take care of her children's basic needs. Her store is open every day, even on Sundays, which allows her to place orders with distributors of agricultural products. This gives her an advantage as she can manage her own time. In addition, her store is near a school zone and she has a good client base. One of the risks of her business is robbery, so she must be very vigilant. She is satisfied, and continues forging ahead because her children are her highest priority. This will be Olinda's first loan, which she will repay because she is a responsible person. She is requesting this loan so that she can acquire more merchandise for her store, such as beverages and other supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her store

loans.name: Koffi Marius

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur de 39 ans réside dans le quartier d’Agoè cacavéli au nord de la ville de Lomé (Togo). Ce monsieur travaille dur pour satisfaire sa famille, il est chaudronnier à une boutique qu’il a appelé FONDATION MARIUS. il  travaille ce métier depuis 1993. il a déjà obtenu 03 prêt de WAGES qu’il a bien remboursé, il demande ce quatrième prêt pour acheter 200 pièces de cordes, 30 tuyaux et 20 coffrets.
Il  est marié avec une dame qui est revendeuse et ont ensemble 01 enfant.
texts.en:
Koffi Marius A. is 39 years old. He lives in the "Cacavéli" neighborhood of Agoe located to the north of the city of Togo. He works in order to provide for his family. He is a boilermaker and has a store called "Fondation Marius" (Marius Foundation). He has been in this business since 1993. He has already obtained 3 loans previously that he was able to successfully pay back. He is looking to obtain a 4th loan in order to purchase 200 pieces of rope, 30 pieces of pipe and 20 boxes. He is married and has 1 child. His wife is a sales woman.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rope, piping and boxes

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia Nyarkwaa is a 48-year-old trader. She is married and the mother of nine children. Currently, four attend school in the village. She trades in onions, tomatoes and peppers, etc. on a table-top in a village market at Nkawkaw where she lives. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods in bulk and retails them in the surrounding towns during their market days. She says that through this business she has endeavored to support two of her kids to finish junior high school. She requests the loan to enable her to buy an increased stock of tomatoes, onions, and peppers to grow her business to boost profit. She hopes to increase her savings to support the children's education, to give them future and hope.

Afia is convinced that with her 25 years trade experience, when the loan is given to her she will have more resources to expand her business growth. Afia belongs to a village bank called ‘Kristo nti’ which means 'Christ Sake'. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: For the purchase of increased stock of vegetables like onions, tomatoes, and peppers, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Mrs. Evelyn T. a hardworking 45 years old woman is married and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Mis. Occ. She has 7 children, and her husband is a carpenter. She desires to help her husband by opening a small grocery store to support her family’s needs. The store began as a snack vender for her neighbors & friends, but eventually grew into a prosperous business. In order to expand her business, Mrs. T. joined Paglaum Cooperative last July 2004. She was then able to begin and return her 1st loan. From then on, she had returned her loans as early as the 13th cycle. She was able to renovate her house because of the prosperity that Paglaum brought her.  Now, she is applying for a loan in order to buy basic commodities for her grocery store. In the future, she wants to expand her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities  for sari-sari store

loans.name: Syeda Shoqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Syeda baji, the wife of S. A., runs a tea stall in Vehari, Pakistan. Syeda baji owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 15 years. Syeda baji is the mother of two sons. Her eldest son is an electrician and the younger son works in a factory on a monthly wage. Syeda baji is applying for a loan to buy tea, sugar and milk for her husband’s tea stall. 

She is the leader of a group of women in her locality. Afzal baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Sheema baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Ghafooran baji wants a loan to buy masonry tools. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy goats for her livestock business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a tea stall

loans.name: Ayishatu

texts.en: Ayishatu A. sells clothing for babies and ladies wear at the sea shore in Elmina.  Ayishatu has a senior high education.  She is married and has one child.  Her husband is a teacher.  Ayishatu has been selling since 2008.  She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses.  Her loan will be used to meet the increasing demand of her customers.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her trade.

loans.use: Increase the sale of clothing for babies and ladies wear, to meet the increasing demand of customers.

loans.name: Hamamata

texts.en:
Hamamata L. is 36 years old. She is divorced and the mother of two children; one has completed senior high and is awaiting his results whilst her last born is still in school.

Hamamata is resourceful and enterprising. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like "diewuo". Diewuo is prepared from powdered maize mixed with dried cassava powder taken with soup. It is enjoyed as breakfast and lunch and normally it is prepared by the Muslims who live in the Zongo communities in Ghana.

She has a strategic business location, giving her favorable sales. She needs the loan to enable her to inject additional working capital into the business to scale up production and increase her income level. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like maize powder, cassava powder, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to facilitate her food production. Hamamata belongs to a village bank called Jeremiah. She would grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like maize powder, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth  es socia del bancomunal Grandioso  Milagro.
Elizabet es casada tiene 45 años, seis hijos de 28, 26, 21, 19, 12 y 10 años, estos dos últimos están estudiando  en la escuela estatal.  
Elizabeth  trabajaba cocinando pero la despidieron, se quedo sin trabajo, tenía que aportar a su casa, entonces tuvo la idea de vender en su casa cerveza y gaseosa, ella vende a puerta cerrada, su esposo es albañil, y no siempre tiene trabajo, solo por temporadas.    
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de 20 cajas de cerveza y 10 cajas de  gaseosa. 
Desde que esta en Finca, su economía ha mejorado, puede invertir en su negocio y sus hijos pueden estudiar en un instituto superior.  
El sueño de Elizabeth es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Grandioso Milagro community bank. Elizabeth is married, is 45 years old and has six children ages 28, 26, 21, 19, 12 and 10. The latter two are studying at public school. Elizabeth worked as a cook but was left without work. She had to support her household so she had the idea of selling beer and soft drinks from her home. She sells behind a closed door. Elizabeth's husband is a mason and doesn't always have work, only seasonally. Elizabeth needs a loan of 800 soles to buy 20 boxes of beer and 10 boxes of soft drinks. Since she has been with FINCA, her income has improved, she can invest in her business and her children can study at a better school. Elizabeth's dream is that her children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 20 boxes of beer and 10 boxes of soft drinks.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Мирзоев Абдулло житель района Пяндж.  Женат и имеет одного ребенка . Работает в сфере бизнеса. Торгует одеждой и парфюмерией.Местность в которой он живет находиться далеко от центра, поэтому товар быстро расходится.В связи с этим Абдулло решил получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот.Это поможет обеспечить рынок необходимыми товарами, что поможет населению приобретать товар , не выезжая за приделы района.
texts.en:
M. Abdullo is a resident of the Pyandj region. He is married and has one child. He works in the business sphere. He sells clothing and perfume. The area where he lives is located far from the center and because of this his products sell quickly. Because of this, Abdullo decided to get a loan and increase his turnover. This will help to provide the market with necessary products, which will help the population to get products without having to leave the borders of the area.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: A livestock breeder for eight years, S. Salim was born in 1968 in Khujand, Tajikistan. He is married and responsible for three people including his wife and two children. Very dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial, he is proposing to expand his flock and repair his enclosure. This will enable him to meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and its neighborhood, some of whom buy animals from more than 20 km from his village. With this goal in mind, Salim is requesting a loan that will serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve living conditions for his household and also make some investments. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more small cattle for his developing business

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en: Anastasie M. has requested a 500,000 Rwandan franc (FRW) loan to help her expand her business. She is 42 years old, and the married mother of three children. She sells non-alcoholic beverages in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, and has been in the business for four years. She currently makes a monthly profit of 200,000 FRW. This is her first loan, with which she hopes to expand her product offering.

loans.use: To expand her product offering

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is forty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, a boy and a girl. Both of her children are still in school. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. 

Mary trades in smoked fish. She buys from the northern part of the country and sells at the local market square. She says she supplies to food vendors, to people in her community and treks to other communities to sell on their market days. Mary has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en:
Purevjav D. is 52 years old and lives with her 54-year-old husband in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She grows various vegetable on a small piece of land that she owns in the town. She mostly grows potatoes, carrots, cabbage, onions, and tomatoes. After seasonal harvests, she retails her vegetable at the local food market.

She has been growing and retailing vegetable since 2006 and she has done quite well with her agribusiness. She started with little capital, just 150,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) and now her business capital has increased to 800,000 MNT. She says that she would like to open a small wholesale market for various vegetables in the town. In that way it would be easier to sell her products and cheaper for locals to buy them. She requests a loan to grow more vegetables.

loans.use: To grow more vegetables

loans.name: Akouélé

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier Agoè Atsanvé à Lomé et a ouvert depuis 2003 dans sa maison une boutique de produits alimentaires  et congelés qui alimente tout le quartier et ses environs. Elle est mariée et ce commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ses 02 enfants. Pour avoir un nouveau stock, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 bidons d’huile, 05 sacs de riz, des produits congelés, des pâtes alimentaires et divers autres produits.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Agoé Atsanvé area of Lomé and, in 2003, she opened a store in her house selling food and frozen products that feed the entire area and its surroundings. She is married, and this business allows her to provide for her 2 children. To replenish her stock, she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 3 cans of oil, 5 bags of rice, frozen products, food pastes, and various other products.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell food products

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is 38 years old and married with 3 children. He sell plank.He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria and has been business for long. He hopes for the amount of N100,000 to purchase more plank to sell. He say thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more plank to sell

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
Solidad C. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 55 years old. Solidad is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Solidad owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Solidad has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Solidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Solidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Solidad is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Solidad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
“Patience is the key to success” said Carol. She is patiently maintaining a food vending business in their village and sometimes also offers catering service for additional source of income.  For her to expand her business, she is now requesting to avail a loan amount of PHP7,000 from the KIVA lenders. This amount will be of great help in assisting her to purchase more commodities she needed in cooking foods. 

Carol is 38 years old, married to Armando who is sacrificing to work in another country to provide a better life for his family.  Their two children are: Jhun Karl - 6 years old and Edrick James - 4 years old. Their children are about to study next school year.

loans.use: Additionla capital for her food vending business

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: B. Antoinette est née en 1963 et vit depuis cinq ans à Louho, un quartier de Porto-Novo, capitale politique du Bénin. Antoinette est mariée à HOUNNOU Casimir, un enseignant, et est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre sont à sa charge. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Antoinette  a abandonné l’école au cours primaire et s’est mise depuis vingt cinq ans à vendre des divers (conserves, savons, lait, sucre, insecticides, galette d’arachide, etc.) ainsi que de l’huile végétale à son domicile. Antoinette s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Antoinette  est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a antérieurement bénéficié de deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés à ALIDé. En vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Antoinette sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Antoinette B. was born in 1963 and has lived for five years in Louho, a neighborhood of Porto Novo, political capital of Benin. Antoinette is married to Casimir Hounnou, a teacher, and is the mother of five children who all attend school, four of whom are in her care. The couple share the family expenses. Antoinette left primary school and has dedicated herself for twenty-five years to selling various provisions (canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, insecticides, groundnut cookies, etc.) as well as vegetable oil from her residence. Antoinette purchases her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Antoinette is a former customer of ALIDé that earlier benefitted from two loans, which she repaid well to ALIDé. In order to increase her working capital and better satisfy her clientele, Antoinette requests a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various provisions (soap, sardines, tomato in cans, milk, sugar packages) and alcohol.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M. is single and has three children. She has received junior high school education. Agnes sells smoked fish at Elmina near Bantama, which she has been doing since 2000. She uses her income to pay school fees, utility bills and apartment rent.

Agnes will use the loan to buy fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Amicollé

texts.fr: Amicollé D. est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAYOUF depuis 7 ans. Elle développe un petit commerce de fruits de saison (mangues, pastèques, oranges etc.) cette activité lui procure des bénéfice qui lui permet de participer aux différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Amicollé D. is 51 years old, and she is married with nine children. She has been a member of the Village Loan Group of Bayouf for 7 years. She has developed a small business selling seasonal fruit (mangoes, watermelons, oranges, etc.). This business generates profits for her, which allow her to participate in providing for her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge her fruit-selling business

loans.name: Sona

texts.fr: Madame TITUS T. 39 ans est marié mère de deux enfants et un autre à sa charge elle est membre à la caisse de liberté 6 et habite à dieupeul non loin de la caisse. Son activité principale est l'aviculture elle achete des poussins qu'elle éleve  pour les revendre  sur le marché. Son expérience dans ce domaine lui vaut un deuxième crédit de 500 000 F CFA sur une durée de 12 mois elle compte sur ce crédit pour accroitre ses activités et aider son mari sur les depenses familialles.
texts.en:
Mrs. Titus T. is a 39-year-old, married woman. She has two children of her own and takes care of a third child. She is a member of the Liberté 6 bank branch and lives in Dieupeul, not far from the bank. She is primarily a poultry farmer. She buys chicks, raises them, and resells them at the market. With her experience, she is asking for a second loan of 500,000 FCFA over a period of 12 months. She is counting on this loan to increase her business and help her husband with the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in a New Hen House

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine L. is 38 years old and lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area. She is married and has a school-aged daughter. Karine and her husband have their own business, which they run in their own carriage-shop, where they sell a variety of products: food, household goods and clothes. Karine also helps her husband with farm work. Thus, thanks to their shop and farm, they support their family. Karine asks 1,000,000 AMD to buy confectionery, cleaners and children's clothes for her shop.

loans.use: To buy confectionery, cleaners and children's clothes for her shop

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
K. Charles is a businessman, thirty-five years old. He has a cosmetics shop located four kilometers away from Zanna. He started his business six years ago.

Charles is using the loan to purchase cosmetics such as jelly, crème, lotions, etc., to expand his business. His future dream is to buy another plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Juana Amanda

texts.es:
En el mercado El Bisne del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Juana Amanda L.  a sus 75 años de edad se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa comercializada por ella misma en su establecimiento donde a diario oferta la ropa a sus clientes que le visitan y siempre está en busca de mantenerse ya que ella es soltera y los ingresos percibidos del negocio son para su sustento.
Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa y es por este motivo que espera que dicho crédito sea otorgado y así continuar mejorando las condiciones de su negocio que ella tiene en buen dirigir.
texts.en:
In the El Bisne market of Chinandega department, the 75 year old Juana Amanda Lopez works at the sale of clothing which she markets herself in her establishment, where she offers the clothes daily to her customers who visit. She is always seeking to support herself, as she is single and the income of the business is her livelihood. She is requesting this credit to invest in purchasing the clothing. For this reason she hopes that said credit will be granted in order to enable her to continue improving the condition of her business, which she has well in hand.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Susana's Group

texts.en:
Susana B. is from the village of Olango. She is 46 years old. Susana is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Susana is married and has 2 adult children. Susana owns & operates a livestock business raising pigs for sale. Susana has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Susana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Susana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Susana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: German

texts.es: El German vive en la localidad de El Torno distante a 40 Km. de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, Esta casado el es carpintero de profesión, su esposa la Sra. Epifania , se dedica a la venta de comida, en el mercado central, tiene tres hijo de los cuales dos de ellos están a su cargo, y pasando estudios superiores, el Sr. German es una persona responsable y trabajadora, uno de sus deseos es de ver a sus hijos profesionales,el destino del crédito solicitado es para aumentar su capital  de trabajo que fue reducido, cuando su madre enfermo y al final falleció esto fue un golpe muy duro para el, pero supo salir adelante por su familia; el se siente contento por la confianza que emprender y Kiva le ha dado en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
German lives in El Torno, 40 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. He is married and is a carpenter by profession. His wife Epifania sells food in the central market. They have three children, two of which they still support and who are completing their higher education. German is a hard working responsible person and he hopes to someday see his children become professionals. He will use the money from this loan to increase his working capital, which was reduced when his mother became ill and passed away. This was a difficult time for him, but he knew how to move his family ahead. He appreciates the trust that Kiva has placed in him by helping him obtain this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 53 años de edad es madre soltera de 2 hijas mayores de edad, trabaja como docente en la Escuela Cèsar Augusto Salinas Pinell de Nueva Guinea desde hace 32 años, se caraceteriza por ser una mujer responsable honesta y muy trabajadora, su hija mayor vive con ella, y como se encuentra desempleada le ayuda hacer los quehaceres del hogar,  con este prestamo pretende construir una habitaciòn, para tener mejor comodidad en el hogar y privacidad ya que solamente tiene una habitaciòn en la casa, el sueño es poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda con los crèditos y ayudar a su familia en lo que mas pueda ya que son de escasos recursos econòmicos.
texts.en:
Julia is a 53 years old single mother of two adult daughters. She has worked as a teacher in the Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell de Nueva Guinea School for 32 years. She is known as a responsible and very hardworking woman. Her older daughter lives with her because she finds herself unemployed, and her daughter helps her with housework. With this loan she intends to construct a room that will improve the comfort and privacy in her home. The house only has one room right now. The dream is to improve her house little by little with her credit and help her family as much as possible with the little economic resources she has.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Las reuniones del Banco Comunal San Andrés las vienen realizando en la parroquia Picoaza a 10 minutos de la capital manabita, la María Natividad Gloria pertenece a este Banco como socia fundadora.

María es soltera de 42 años se dedica a la guardería en la misma parroquia donde vive, ella es la encargada de preparar los alimentos para los niños de la guardería, pero nuestra socia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y por ello tiene una tienda en su casa donde vende colas, cervezas, galletas golosinas a encargada de atender la tienda es la mamá, mientras la señora María Natividad en la guardería trabaja desde las 8 am hasta las 4pm una vez que sale de ahí se dedica a vender Avon con este negocio inicio hace 10 años y con la tienda 1 año.

Con este nuevo préstamo que va a recibir nuestra socia, invertirá en productos de Avon y en cervezas que es lo que más se vende.

El  mayor anhelo de la señora María Natividad es seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
The meetings of the San Andrés Communal Bank are held in Picoaza Parish, which is ten minutes away from the capital of Manabita. María Natividad is one of the founding members of this Communal Bank.

She is 42 years old, single, and manages a nursery school in the same parish where she lives. María is in charge of preparing the meals for the children. She is also a woman who enjoys working, so she set up a store in her home where she sells soft drinks, beer, cookies, and candy. Her mother looks after the store while she works at the nursery school from 8am until 4pm. In addition, Maria sells Avon products, which she started ten years ago after she opened her store the previous year.

With this new loan, she will invest in Avon cosmetics and beer, the product that sells the most. Her greatest wish is to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Avon products and beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Reyna Isabel C. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 16 años su negocio es de venta de refrescos, gaseosas, pan, tajadas  etc, esta ubicado de la farmacia santa lucia 1c al norte 1/2c al oeste.
Es madre de dos hijos solo uno de ellos depende de ella la otra hija de ya es mayor de edad pero le ayuda a vender en su negocio, tiene  3 años de trabajar con ceprodel con 17 créditos siempre nos ha demostrado ser una mujer luchadora y que se esfuerza por el bienestar de su hijo manifestándonos que gracias a ceprodel a mejorado su casa y su negocio.
texts.en:
La señora Reyna Isabel C. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 16 años su negocio es de venta de refrescos, gaseosas, pan, tajadas etc, esta ubicado de la farmacia santa lucia 1c al norte 1/2c al oeste. Es madre de dos hijos solo uno de ellos depende de ella la otra hija de ya es mayor de edad pero le ayuda a vender en su negocio, tiene 3 años de trabajar con ceprodel con 17 créditos siempre nos ha demostrado ser una mujer luchadora y que se esfuerza por el bienestar de su hijo manifestándonos que gracias a ceprodel a mejorado su casa y su negocio.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para compra de gaseosas, plátano, bisutería

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Mahamudu is 25 years old and single.  He has been running a small stand selling second-hand clothes and shoes since 2008.  He works from 7:30 am until 7 pm six days a week and earns about $200 a month in profits. Mahamudu dreams of expanding his business, and he will use this loan to increase his stock by purchasing additional styles and sizes of clothes and shoes.  

This will be Mahamudu’s first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Mahamudu is a member of the Saranga Group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.  Mahamudu is the only man in the group and can be seen in the back row wearing a hat.

loans.use: To increase his second hand clothes and shoes

loans.name: Shanta

texts.en:
Shanta T. is the mother of two sons. Both of her sons are studying in higher secondary school.  Her husband is a farmer.

Mrs. T. is engaged in the cow-raising business. She already owns one cow and she has been selling milk in her area. In Nepal pure and fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for human nutrition. Shanta T. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati and in that area the demand for milk is constantly increasing.

She carries her milk containers and sells door-to-door daily in the morning and in the evening.  Because of the rising demand for milk, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production.  Shanta plans to use her loan to purchase a jersey cow which produces more milk than normal cows.

loans.use: to buy another young  cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married man from Lebanon who lives with his wife and two children. Fourteen years ago he opened his own aluminum molding factory.

He is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase new tools for the business.

loans.use: to purchase new tools

loans.name: Jurynda

texts.en:
Jurynda R. is from the village of Libertad, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jurynda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jurynda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Mao Nol Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Sdok Prei village in Takeo province consists of sixteen people who has been selected Mrs. Mao N. is a village bank president who was born in 1953. All the members are made up a village bank loan and they will use portion of their loan for different purposes. Mrs. Mao N. is a grass seller at her home where she is able to earn some money to support her family. She is widow with four children, one of whom is a sugar palm seller, another is a seamstress in garment factory, while the other one is helping her to sell grass, and the other is attending in local public school. Her problem is that she did not have a motorbike to support all her family members’ businesses. So to solve this problem, Mrs. Mao N. is seeking for a loan to make more money to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
Oscar reside en el municipio EL Transito departamento de San Miguel, es casado vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de las edades de ocho y seis años respectivamente, solo tres de ellos dependen de los ingreso que el obtiene del taller. El taller lo instaló gracias a la ayuda de un amigo quien le enseño hacer el trabajo, hace trabajos en la casa y a domicilio trabaja de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde actualmente, el necesita el crédito para comprar materiales como hierro, pintura y herramientas, esto le permitirá contar con los materiales necesarios para desempeñar mejor su trabajo, uno de los riesgos seria que el precio de los materiales suban. 
las aspiraciones de Oscar son ampliar su taller y así poder apoyar a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar lives in the El Transito municipality in the San Miguel department. He is married, and he lives with his wife and their two children. The children are eight and six years old. All of them are dependent upon the income from his shop. He set up his shop thanks to help from a friend who taught him how to do the work. He works at home and at houses. He works from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon. He currently needs a loan to buy materials like iron, paint, and tools. This will allow him to have the materials he needs to do his work better. One of his risks is that the price of materials will rise. Oscar’s aspirations are to expand his shop and to be able to help his family have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like iron, paint, and tools

loans.name: Magalis Maria

texts.es:
Magalis María M. es una mujer joven y abnegada madre, de un pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad, que vive en el barrio Olaya de la ciudad de Cartagena, cuna de la música caribeña y donde florecen en sus calles, de manera silvestre  bailarines y cantantes  de champeta y reguetón de todas las edades que cada día agregan nuevos ritmos a la música Colombiana;  ella  es propietaria de la comercializadora M. donde vende pescado, carnes blancas y por otro lado vende  mercancías como cremas dentales, cremas para manos y cuerpo y cosméticos en general.

Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará pollo, pescado, atún, enlatados y productos de higiene personal como cremas dentales, y jabones. Magaly está entusiasmada con su credikiva, su  segundo crédito porque el anterior que le hizo la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, le generó un gran impuso para su negocio y con ellos sus utilidades le ayudaron a  mejorar  aspectos de su vida y la de su familia. Su mayor desafío es lograr tener un local con buenos esquemas de refrigeración y también convertirse en una gran mayorista de estas delicias proteinicas, para ver convertido en el futuro a su unigénito  en una persona  de bien y muy exitosa.
texts.en:
Magalis María M. is a young woman and the self-sacrificing mother of a small five year old son. She lives in the Olaya neighborhood in the city of Cartagena. This city is the cradle of Caribbean music. Everyday dancers and reggaeton and champeta singers of all ages wildly flourish in the city streets. Each day they add new rhythms to Columbian music. She is the proprietor of the Comercializadora M. business, where she sells fish and white meats. She also sells toothpaste, hand and body creams, and general cosmetics. This is her second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy chicken, fish, tuna, canned goods, and personal hygiene products like toothpaste and soap. Magaly is enthusiastic about her Kiva loan, her second loan, because the last one was from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. It generated a great boost for her business. Her profits helped her to improve aspects of her life and those of her family. Her greatest challenge is managing to have a place with a good refrigeration set up. She also wants to become a large wholesale seller of these protein delicacies. In the future she wants to see her only child become a good and very successful person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken, fish, tuna, canned goods, and personal hygiene products like toothpaste and soap

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina R., from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte, is 52 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Avelina owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for fattening and sale. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Avelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future, she is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 13000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Avelina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena D. is from the village of Brgy. Payawan, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 33 years old, is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rowena owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling personal products such as glasses and watches in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rowena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rowena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie P. is from the village of Madalag. She is 43 years old and married with four children. To make a living, Lenie runs a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lenie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,539 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 2500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lenie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy-Madalag, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Máximo Israel

texts.es:
El  Sr. M. tiene más de 27 año de laborar como técnico de enfermedades vectoriales en el MINSA de esta localidad.
Cuenta con su propia casa de habitación  la que piensa mejorar con el financiamiento otorgado por la institución. 
Esto le permitirá al cliente y su familia  tener  mejores condicione de vida.
texts.en: Senor M. has worked more than 27 years as a vector disease transmission technician with the MINSA in his locality.  He has his own home that he is planning on improving with the financing provided by this institution.  This will provide his clients and his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es: Ulises, de 32 años, un hombre bueno y alegre; está casado con Julia, de 34 años, ambos tienen dos hijos, Hildebrant, de 10 y Anali, de 2 meses de edad, con los cuales vive en una casa alquila, ubicada en la localidad de Huaricolca. El trabajo primordial de él, se centra en el arado diario de diferentes terrenos de cultivo, cuya herramienta importante es un toro que tiene. Además son muy pocos los que ofrece este tipo de trabajo, por ello no tiene mucha competencia, generándole así muchas ganancias. Pero la actividad que más le gusta a Ulises, es la agricultura, ya tiene 5 años dedicándose a ello, sus principales productos se centran en la siembra de papa y arveja; las que cuida con mucha dedicación y ahínco. En cada campaña agrícola, el apoyo de su banco comunal es muy importante, ya que cada día tiene una producción de calidad. Por ello más adelante desea sembrar en mayores cantidades, para abastecer la demanda que genera sus productos. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y asegura que cada cosecha, gracias a su banco comunal, le genera mayores ganancias. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará 8 sacos de abono que esparcirá en sus cultivos de papa, que muy pronto comenzará a sembrar.
texts.en: Ulises, who is 32 years old, is a good and happy man. He is marred to Julia, who is 34 years old. Together they have two sons, Hildebrant, who is 10 years and Anali, who is 2 months old. They live together in a rented house located in Huaricolca. His primary job is focused on the daily plowing of different fields. His important tool is a bull that he owns. There are very few people who offer this work, so he doesn't have a lot of competition and generates a lot of income. But the activity that Ulises enjoys the most is agriculture. He already has 5 years of experience with it and his primary products are potatoes and peas, which he cares for with a lot of dedication and determination. For every season, the help from his communal bank is very important so that every day he has a quality production. In the future he wants to plant in greater quantities to satisfy the demand that his products generate. This is his third loan with MFP and he is sure that every harvest, thanks to his communal bank, he will generate more income. With this loan he will buy 8 sacks of fertilizer which he will spread on the potato plants that he will plant very soon.

loans.use: To buy 8 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María V. P. cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 4 años para apoyar a su esposo con el gasto familiar. Rosa vende ropa, juguetes para niño y más a un precio cómodo para el público de acuerdo a su economía. La señora desea invertir en su negocio para que sus ventas sean incrementadas.
texts.en: Rosa María V. P. has had a business selling used clothes for 4 years.  Her business helps support her husband with their family expenses.  Rosa sells clothes, children's toys and other products to the public for a comfortable price, according to their means.  She would like to invest in her business to increase her sales.

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Valientes 1, 2 & 3 (Brave Women). She lives in a modest home with her long term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is not having her own house and she wants to build one. She enjoys doing business and is excited to receive her first loan with Esperanza. She started her business when she realized she needed extra income and save US$90; she has now had her business for a year. Santa plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying chicken, beef and pork for her butcher shop. She will use the profits to buy a washing machine and to save to buy a vehicle.

This Esperanza associate joined us because she wanted to improve her business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy chicken, beef and pork.

loans.name: Babken

texts.en:
Babken H. is 23 years old. He lives in the village of Ddmashen, near the town of Sevan, with his parents and his two sisters. Babken’s mother teaches biology in a Ddmashen school.  His father helps him in the business.  One of Babken's sister is school-aged, and the other is a teacher like their mother. 

Babken is taking the Correspondence Courses at the Teachers Training College in Yerevan.  Parallel to his studies, he has his own business, which consists of lavash (Armenian bread) production and sale. The bakery is in the family’s private house. Babken and his father have been running this business for 6 years. 

Thanks to his first Kiva loan, Babken was able to purchase flour wholesale, as well as buy a mini lorry which he uses to deliver his products to Sevan area shops.

Babken needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to purchase more flour at wholesale and to construct a new stove for his bread production.

loans.use: To purchase flour, and construct new stove

loans.name: Ederson

texts.es: Ederson, de 23 años, vive en casa de su hermana, en compañía de ella; y cada día, juntos se esfuerzan por salir adelante. Desde muy pequeño empezó ha trabajar, y en la actualidad es comerciante ambulante en un gran mercado de su zona. Él vende por temporadas verduras y cuando es época veraniega, estos productos comestibles se descomponen con facilidad,  es por ello que empezó a comercializar ropa, tanto para hombre como para mujer. Este muy satisfecho con las ganancias que obtiene pues son regulares, trabaja durante todo el día y ya tiene algunos clientes fijos que le hacen pedidos. Para él, le desagrada de ser ambulante, ya que así ha perdido varios clientes. Para el futuro quiere instalar un puesto en el mismo mercado, así espera consolidar su negocio y aumentar sus gananciasEs el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca D. progreso. Ederson tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en ropa, pues necesita abastecerse para el año entrante.
texts.en: Ederson, age 23, lives with his sister in her home. Every day they work together to get ahead. He started to work at a very young age. He currently works as a street merchant in a large market in the area. He sells seasonal vegetables. In the summer, these products go bad easily. For this reason, he started to sell clothing for men and women. He is very satisfied with the earnings that he makes, as they are regular. He works all day and already has a customer base who make orders. For him, it is disagreeable to sell on the street, as he has lost some customers. In the future he wants to open a stall in the same market. This way, he hopes to solidify his business and increase his earnings. This is his first loan with MFP, and he promises to pay his quotas punctually as he does not want to disappoint the people who have made this loan possible. This loan will allow him to continue working in the search of progress. Ederson plans to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise: clothing. He needs to stock up for the new year.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to stock his business.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
la señora Maria B. tiene 26 años de edad, vive desde hace 8 años en la colonia Morazan de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, vive en union libre y tiene un hijo.
actualmente tiene un negocio de pulperia en donde vende abarroteria en general como ser: arroz, carnes, pollo, lacteos, jabon, churros y todo lo relacinado con la canasta basica familiar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia ya que desea surtir un poco mas la pulperia y asi lograr mejores ganancias.
 
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y para mantener a su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria B. is 26 years old and she has lived in the colony of Morazan in the city of San Lorenzo for the past 8years. She lives with her common-law partner and their son.

She has a convenience store from where she sells grocery store items in general, such as: rice, meats, chicken, milk products, soaps, snacks, and all the basic things for the family.

She will use the loan to purchase merchandise to improve her supply of inventory for her store and to improve her earnings. 

She needs her earnings to cover the household expenses and to support her son.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan H. de 52 años, nacido en San Francisco, departamento de Ayacucho, de estado civil casado con Fortunita de 60 años; cuentan con casa propia construida en la avenida Santa Rosa del distrito de San Francisco; por circunstancias de la vida no pueden tener hijos. Juan, es bien centrado en sus responsabilidades como esposo, sus padres a temprana edad le enseñaron la actividad del comercio y creció con esas dotes; hoy compra productos a los campesinos como: cacao, café y frutas de la zona, actividad que viene ejerciendo desde hace 30 años de manera independiente. Una vez comprado dichos productos de cacao y café, son  almacenados hasta obtener una buena cantidad para luego transferirlos a las empresas acopiadoras en donde obtiene un buen porcentaje por cada kilogramo que vende. Esta actividad le resulta rentable, gracias a ello pudo comprarse muchos bienes. Actualmente cuenta con su propia movilidad lo cual le facilita el traslado de los productos hasta el centro del almacenamiento. Los meses de enero, febrero y marzo son épocas de lluvia y derrumbes en las carreteras, eso obstruye el pase del producto, por el cual lo perjudica en el trabajo. Su plan próximo y por el bien de su negocio es comprar otro carro, porque el que tiene es muy antiguo y ya no esta en perfectas condiciones por lo cual necesita uno nuevo para continuar con su trabajo. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos; sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, para así acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. Con mil nuevo soles renovará la fachada de su casa, para ofrecer el servicio de alquiler de habitaciones, ya que lo considera muy rentable.
texts.en: Juan H. is 52 years old and was born in San Francisco, in the department of Ayacucho. He is married to Fortunita, who is 60 years old. They have their own house on Santa Rosa Avenue in the district of San Francisco. Due to circumstances beyond their control, they are not able to have children. Juan is focused on his responsibilities as a husband. At an early age, his parents taught him sales and he grew up with this gift. Today he buys produce like local cocoa, coffee and fruit, which he has done independently for 30 years. Once he has bought cocoa and coffee, they are stored until he obtains a good quantity and later he transfers them to gathering companies and gets a good percentage for each kilo he sells. This activity is profitable because he is able to buy many goods. Now he has his own vehicle, which makes it easy to transport the produce to the storage center. The months of January, February and March are the season of rain and landslides on the highways, which blocks the passage of the produce and hurts his business. His new plan for the well being of his business is to buy another car, as the one he has is very old and not in perfect condition, thus he needs a new one to continue his work. This is his third loan from MFP, and he has been very punctual in his previous loans. He knows that he must make his payments punctually in order to get more loans in the future. With 1,000 soles, he will renovate the front of his house so he can rent rooms, which he considers very profitable.

loans.use: Restore front of house and be able to rent rooms

loans.name: Boboto Plus Group

texts.en:
Régine is the leader of a community bank named “Boboto Plus”, made up of eleven members firmly united to receive loans from the micro-finance institution, HOPE DRC, in order to develop their businesses.

Régine sells shikwanges (a kind of bread made of manioc flour), which are Kinshasa’s main food. She also sells onions and miscellaneous other foods.  She sells at a market located in the northeastern part of Kinshasa.  She has been in business since 1982. She has taken out 12 loans from HOPE DRC for business expansion and fully repaid them. 

With her next loan, Régine will be able to meet the customers' demands and generate additional profits. Her business makes approximately $50 of profit per week. One of Régine’s strategies to keep her clients is that she tells them in advance about any change that can occur in her business. 

Her ambition is to diversify her business by opening a beverage facility in her area. Régine is 45 years old, married, and has seven children between the ages of 10 and 26. Three of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Miss Group

texts.es:
El grupo Miss está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellos son Alcira R., Erika  S. y Luvis Enrique C.. La coordinadora es la señora R. quien desde hace cinco años vende frutas, verduras y pollo.
Ella con el crédito comprar pollo (piernas, alas, pechuga, etc.) 
S. se dedica al comercio de ropa usada y C. vende frutas y verduras desde hace 7 años.
texts.en:
The Miss Group consists of three hardworking, determined, and enterprising individuals: Alcira R., Erika S., and Luvis Enrique C.. The group coordinator is Sra. R., who has been selling fruits, vegetables, and chicken for five years.

She will use her loan to buy chicken (legs, wings, breasts, and other parts).

Sra. S. sells used clothing. Sr. C. has been selling fruits and vegetables for seven years.

loans.use: Purchase chicken to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena L. is from the village of Kidahon, Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Elena is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, instant noodles and detergents in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately $141 a month for these activities.

In 2003, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Elena is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods to sell. This will be her 10th loan  from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods to sell

loans.name: Norovsuren

texts.en:
Mr. Norovsuren is 41 years old and a farmer. He lives with his wife and three children in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All three children study in secondary school. Mr. Norovsuren has grown up in a herder family and he likes animals. He is a plumber by profession but three years ago he decided to run a farming business. 

He has nine cows at the moment and sells milk to local shops and in the neighbourhood. His wife helps in his business. Last year Norovsuren built a barn for his cows and this year he is planning to buy two more cows to increase his milk output. Norovsuren is a very hard-working, enthusiastic person. He and his family live in a 'ger', a traditional Monoglian nomadic tent.

loans.use: To buy two more cows to increase milk output.

loans.name: Darisuren

texts.en:
Darisuren is 40-year-old widow who lives with her three children in her brother's backyard in Uvs province, Mongolia. They live in a 'ger', a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent. Her older two children are students and the youngest one is a pupil. She manages a grocery trading business in her town. 

She started her business in June 2010 out of a rented container at a local market. At first her working capital was 1,500,000 MNT which has increased to 2,000,000 MNT. Her business is quite profitable and allows her to pay the education costs of her children. She is planning to continue and expand her business in the future. She is a polite woman who says, "I would like to have my own plot of land where I can build my own house." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items.

loans.name: Leidy Diana

texts.es:
Leidy Diana A. trabaja hace un año como propietaria de una peluquería la cual montó con el fin de convertirse en microempresaria y además para poner en práctica todos los conocimientos adquiridos en una institución para el aprendizaje de técnicas de belleza, en la ciudad de Medellín.
 
Para Leidy es muy satisfactorio haber pasado de empleada a convertirse en su propio jefe y manejar sus horarios de acuerdo a sus necesidades. Esta mujer emprendedora sueña con poder vincular a 2 personas más a su negocio y requiere capital para comprar mejores insumos y pagar algunas deudas que la peluquería le ha generado, así podrá tener mejor manejo de su economía y abrirles las oportunidades de empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Leidy Diana A. has owned a hairdressing salon for one year.  She set up the business so that she could become a small businesswoman and put into practice all the skills that she learned in an institute where they teach beauty techniques, in the city of Medellín.

It has been very satisfying for Leidy to go from being an employee to becoming her own boss and managing her hours according to her needs.  This enterprising woman dreams of being able to hire two more people to work in her business and she needs capital to buy better supplies and pay off some debts that her hairdressing salon has created.  In this way, she will be able to better manage her finances and create job opportunities for other people.

loans.use: to buy a display case and beauty products

loans.name: Stephany Amparo

texts.es: La Señorita Stephany, vive por la zona del cementerio de sacaba en anticrético, es soltera joven emprendedora, tiene una tienda muy surtida se encuentra en una zona  céntrica, tiene mucha habilidad para realizar piñatas para todo tipo de acontecimiento, es un apersona muy hábil y creativa, el préstamo invertirá para incrementar su mercadería y  la compra de material de trabajo para las piñatas y compra de regalos para cumpleaños, ya que los días cuando hay fiestas y matrimonios tiene mucha venta y ella desea surtir su tienda, es una persona con ganas de superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Stephany rents a house near the cemetery in Sacaba. She is a young, single entrepreneur and has a well-stocked store in the downtown area. She is skilled at making piñatas for all sorts of occasions, and is very capable and creative. The loan will be used to increase her merchandise and buy work materials for the piñatas and to buy birthday gifts, since on the days when there are parties and weddings she has a lot of sales and she wants to stock her store. She has a great desire to succeed and is grateful to the bank for the support it gives her.

loans.use: to buy party supplies in bulk

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang, 60, resides in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. She and her husband have given birth to eight children. Three are married and five are single, and two of them work. 

She sells fresh fish in the local market and makes around $3.75 per day. She sells fish that she gets from her husband, who fishes in the lake around his community, and she buys more fish from the other fishermen for resale also. 

Heang will use her loan to purchase nets for fishing and also to buy more fish for resale.

loans.use: to purchase nets for fishing and also buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La sr. Lidia vive por la zona de Tamborada, cuenta con su ganado vacuno propio, y se encarga de producir de forma diaria leche cruda y este su producto lo entrega a un tanque de enfriamiento que hay en la zona para luego la empresa de la Planta Industrializadora de leche se encarga de su recojo dos veces al dia a las 8 de la mañana y a las 7 de la tarde.

La señora Lidia se ha dedicado desde siempre a la cria de vacas, con este negocio ha podido dar una educacion a sus hijos, ha podido generar mejores ingresos dia a dia.
Pero aun debe seguir trabajando porque desea mejorar un poco las condiciones de vida ya que su casa esta construida con adobes de barro.

La sr. Lidia vio la oportunidad de comprar forraje de vendedores ambulantes, de ese modo solicito un credito para poder comprar el forraje para su ganado, aprovechando el precio al quele venderan, asi podra ahorar en la alimentacin de sus vacas y tambien las vacas podran producir mas leche.
texts.en:
Lidia lives in the Tamborada zone. She has her own cattle, and she daily produces raw milk which she sends to a refrigerated tank that is in the area. Later, the industrial plant picks up the milk twice a day - at 8 am and 7 pm.

Lidia has always raised cattle. Through this business, she has been able to giver her children an education, and she has been able to generate better revenue day by day. Now, she still has to work because she wants to improve her quality of life a little bit since her house is made of adobe bricks.

Lidia saw the opportunity to purchase some feed from traveling salesmen, so she is requesting a loan to purchase feed for her cattle and take advantage of the price while the feed is being sold. This way, she will be able to save on feeding her cattle, and the cows will be able to produce more milk.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité la Sra Celestina, de Ciudad del Este, tuvo mucha influencia, ya que ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas, y las motivo para formar el comité en la Zona donde viven.
El comité se Denomina “Tajy Poty”  están en el Noveno  Ciclo   con  18   integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas, las mismas realizan labores de incentivos y ayudan en su comunidad con las tareas sociales.
La Sra. Celestina, se dedica a la venta de perfumes desde hace ya varios años, por lo que ya ha conseguido una clientela bien definida, pero piensa que si tiene un poco mas de dinero podrá comprar mas perfumes con lo que lograra tener mas variedad de productos, con lo que atraerá a mas clientes.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de nuevos tipos de perfumes, con lo cual podrá renovar y sumar a los que ya tiene para poder aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
For the formation of the committee, Celestina, from the city of Este, had a lot of influence since she contacted her neighbors and friends and motivated them to form the committee in the area where they live.

The committee named "Tajy Poty" is in its ninth cycle with 18 members. It is a group that is distinguished in the neighborhood for being very united and responsible. They perform incentive work and help their community with social work. Celestina has been dedicated to selling perfume for many years for which she has already acquired a well-defined customer base. However, she thinks that if she had a little more money she would be able to buy more perfumes with which she could have a greater variety of products which would attract more customers. She is requesting the loan to buy new types of perfumes with which she will be able to renew and add to what she already has to be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes to renew the stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Jose Patricio

texts.es:
Jose Patricio tiene 37 años, Es soltero vive con solo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Jose se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener dinero para construir la casa.

Le gusta jugar futbool.
texts.en:
37-year old Jose Patricio is single and lives alone in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

The V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA Community Bank is located in La Primavera Recinto, in Ventanas canton. Its members work in agriculture and grow corn and rice.

Jose too is a farmer and grows corn, rice, and beans. He buys his supplies in the Peña store and sells them in the wholesale market in Ventanas. He is seeking a loan to buy corn and rice seeds as well as supplies and fertilizer for his fields. The money will help him buy daily necessities. 

Jose’s dream is to have enough money to build a house. He enjoys playing football.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Alberto Larraguibel Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Alberto Larraguibel”, está conformado por 22 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa, venta de joyas, venta de ropa interior, venta de gorros, servicios de reparaciones de bicicletas, peluquería, confección de cortinaje, bisutería y preparación de ensaladas. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
María presidenta del banco comunal, quien en la foto aparece sentada y viste una chaqueta color naranjo, se dedica a la confección de manteles, cortinas y cenefas, desde hace 2 años. Comenzó éste rubro cuando se ganó un proyecto, el cual constaba con un aporte de una máquina de coser y telas. Desde sus inicios le ha ido muy bien. 
Ella trabaja en el comedor de su casa y su horario es relativo, dependiendo de los pedidos que tenga para realizar, por lo demás María también trabaja de manera dependiente como asesora de hogar en una casa particular.
Su mercadería la compra en la misma ciudad, ya que los precios son igualmente convenientes que en otras ciudades. 
Con el crédito comprará telas, hilos y blondas.
María vive junto a su hija de 21 años, quien estudia en la universidad, de ahí sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, ya que anhela costear sus estudios y uno de sus sueños es que termine su carrera y pueda contar con el título profesional. 
Ella se siente muy cómoda y agradecida de los servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, debido a la confianza y facilidad que brinda la institución. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is named “Alberto Larraguibel” and consists of 22 entrepreneurs who engage in different businesses such as selling clothes, selling jewelry, selling undergarments, selling caps, repairing bicycles, operating a beauty salon, making curtains, selling trinkets, and preparing salads. All of them are from the city of Temuco.

María, the Communal Bank President, is the woman in the photograph who is seated and wearing an orange jacket. She has been making tablecloths, curtains, and valances for the past two years. María started her business after being awarded a sewing job, which meant that she had to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics. Since starting her business, she has done very well.

María works from the dining room in her home and her schedule varies based on the orders that she has to fulfill. She also works as an interior design consultant for a private firm. María buys her supplies in the same city since the prices are comparable to those of other cities. With this loan, she will buy fabrics, thread, and lace.

María lives with her 21-year-old daughter, who is a university student. She is motivated to continue with her business so that she can fund her education. One of her dreams is to see her daughter finish her degree and pursue a professional career. María says she feels comfortable with and appreciates the services offered by Fondo Esperanza, as well as the trust and conveniences provided by the organization.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago, the Chilean capital. In the surrounding areas there are a series of lakeside spas (such as Pucón and Villarrica). The nearby nature parks are concentrated with striking plants and animal life. It should be mentioned that half of the residents of the region are of Mapuche descent, an indigenous people that live throughout Chile.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, and lace.

loans.name: Duo Esperanza De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
DUO ESPERANZA  DE VISTA HERMOSA
Integra  por doña Marta Lidia,   doña Marta hace dos años  inicio con la venta de comida en una de las fabricas de calzado cercano de su domicilio inicio  su negocio con la ayuda de su hermano quien era el encargado de vender dentro de las instalaciones, poco a poco fue creciendo la demanda de porciones  de comida,  ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de granos basicos para la elavoracion de comida y asi seguir vendiendo, su hija es la seguiente socia inicio con un poco de capital en la venta de joyas  esta actividad le  ha ido bien  por lo que ella se encuentra motivada a seguir invirtiendo  por lo que necesita de capital y surtir sus productos, doña Marta  se siente satisfecha  por su hija y por su negocio pero su obstáculo es la inversión que se necesita, por lo que acuden a solicitar capital a través de un préstamo y así poder luchar como madre e hija.
texts.en:
DUO ESPERANZA  DE VISTA HERMOSA is made up of Marta Lidia and her daughter. Two years ago, Marta began selling food in one of the shoe factories near her home. She began her business with the help of her brother who was in charge of selling in the premises. Little by little the demand for 
food servings grew. 

She is requesting this loan to buy food products to produce the meals and thus continue her sales. Her daughter, as noted, is the other member of the duo.

Marta began the business with a little capital from the sale of jewelry. The business has done well and she is motivated to continue investing in it. Thus she needs capital to stock up on groceries. Marta feels satisfied because of her daughter and her business, however her need for investment is an obstacle. Therefore she has come to solicit capital through a loan so that mother and daughter can fight to get ahead together.

loans.use: to buy food products to prepare meals.

loans.name: Servando

texts.en:
Servando is 46 years old and married. He has a 9-year-old child. Servando and his family live in the town of Banga, South Cotabato.

Servando is a farmer. He owns the land that he tills to grow rice, corn and vegetables. Servando sells his harvest to rice traders. He plans to use his loan to purchase 4 sacks of rice seeds, 5 sacks of fertilizers, and 1 liter of pesticides. Servando hopes to achieve an abundant quality harvest.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various vegetables such as broccoli, carrots, cauliflower, cabbage, cucumber, string beans, etc.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia lives together with her family in a peaceful village planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 44 years old and has two school-age children. She aims to improve their standard of living and to give her children a bright future. To earn additional income, she runs a dress-making business which is needed in their village. She has been in this business for almost 10 years earning a profits of P6,000 a month.
