She is trying to acquire new materials for her sewing machines but she does not have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of P11,000 to buy threads, needles, and fabric for her dress-making business to produce more finished products. She believes that this loan will help her grow her business and make it viable in the future.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles, and fabric for dress making

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a married woman with five school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six months, Patience has been operating a charcoal selling business. She sells at the market to market dwellers and retailers. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation from the rural areas to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a vast market share in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo cuenta con 31 años de edad es  separado tiene hijos pero no están con él.
El es chofer de su propio servicio urbano es transportista tiene una camioneta pasajera la cual trabaja el mismo, el invirtió su préstamo en mantenimiento del carro el ahora dice estar contento ya que ha sabido salir adelante a Gustavo le gustaría poner otra camioneta ya que pues en el pueblo no hay mucho transporte y a él le gustaría meter otra camioneta a trabajar.
texts.en: Gustavo is 31 years old and separated.  He has children but they do not live with him.  He’s a driver of his own vehicle.  He has a passenger van that provides urban transportation services that he drives himself.  He used the loan to service the vehicle.  He says that he’s happy now because he’s known how to get ahead.  Gustavo would like to put a second van into operation because there isn’t much transportation available in his town and he’d like to put another van to work.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 30-years-old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is married with 2 children. 

Jocelyn has a barbeque vending business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000  to purchase raw ingredients for her barbeque business. 

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her barbeque business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La Señora Andrea, tiene 55 años de edad y vive en una zona marginal de la Ciudad de Choloma, es soltera por viudez, vive con su único hijo.
Su actividad económica actual, es la elaboración de alimentos como ser baleadas, helados (topogigios) y dulces.
Anteriormente poseía una pulpería donde se dedicaba a la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, refresco, productos de higiene del hogar). 
Dicho negocio fue cerrado ya que Doña Andrea destino todos sus ingresos para ayudar  con la obtención de las medicinas, de su madre la cual estaba muy enferma. 
En la actualidad ella ha iniciado nuevamente otro negocio vendiendo alimentos preparados en su hogar, para lo cual ha solicitado un préstamo con el que piensa adquirir los insumos necesarios para  preparar dichos alimentos.
Ella planea invertir sus ingresos en establecer nuevamente su pulpería ya que cuenta con la experiencia en el negocio y es optimista en que lo va lograr.
texts.en:
Adrea, age 55, lives in a poor area of the city of Choloma.  She is single because she is a widow, and she lives with her only child.

Her business activity is making food like “baleadas” (the basic baleada is a thick flour tortilla folded in half containing refried beans and grated cheese with a white sauce), ice cream (popsicles), and sweets.

She previously had a grocery store where she sold basic needs products (rice, beans, sugar, shortening, soft drinks, and home hygiene products).  That business was closed because Andrea used all of the income to help get medicine for her mother who was very ill.

She has currently started another business selling prepared food at her house.  She has requested a loan, which she plans to use to get the supplies needed to prepare food.  She plans to use her income to reestablish her grocery store.  She has the experience in the business, and she is optimistic that she will succeed.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare food.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 46-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s unfortunately divorced and living with her three children.  In 2007, she opened a clothing store and started to sell stylish clothes in addition to selling scarves. Because of her friendly and welcoming nature, she is able to have a big clientele. Today, she is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to diversify her merchandise selection and buy the new winter clothes collection. In the future, she hopes to sell shoes and bags from her shop in addition to clothes.

loans.use: To diversify her merchandise selection and buy the new winter clothes collection

loans.name: Kankeletigui Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe  KANKELETIGUI  sont des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 30 ans, 3 enfants et qui vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames au quartier Babemba un des nouveaux quartiers de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame  Haby en jaune se tenant au milieu fait le commerce de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne généralement auprès des producteurs de Sikasso. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 300 Kg de pomme de terre qu’elle revendra en détail au marché de Médine à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the KANKELETIGUI group are married women who are on average 30 years old, have three children and live mostly in monogamous families in Babemba, one of the new districts in the city of Sikasso.

This is their eighth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, seeking to meet the needs of their customers.

Mrs. Haby, who is standing in the middle dressed in yellow, trades in potatoes. She usually lays in supplies from farmers in Sikasso.

She intends to buy about 300 kg of potatoes with her ​​loan. She will then sell them retail at the Medina market in Sikasso and through home delivery, to both men and women customers, often for cash and also on credit.

She plans to make average monthly profits of 30 000 FCFA, part of which will be used to pay off the loan and its interests, and the rest put into savings.

loans.use: Buy potatoes

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 36 years old and married to Aggrey. They have been blessed with three children: 14, 11, and 6 years old. She has run a chemist outlet for the last nine years. 

Her monthly income is 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), and she is servicing a first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. She intends to acquire more drugs for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to improve and expand the business

loans.name: Elza

texts.es:
La Sra. Elza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 36 años, es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo de once años que está estudiando el nivel primario.
Siempre vivió en el campo ayudando a sus padres junto a su esposo, cuando su hijo creció y tenía que ir al escuela salieron a vivir a la ciudad, es cuando se ve en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la educación de sus hijo lavando ropa de sus vecinos , hace tres años que viene trabajando con su Banquito comunal, con su primer préstamo compró una parrilla para vender asados a la parrilla por las noches, y por las mañanas realizaba la compra y venta de productos agrícolas en el mercado de la ciudad como, plátano, granos( frijol, cacao, maíz, café) para seguir generando ingresos para contribuir con la economía de su hogar y la educación de su hijo.   .
Con este préstamo de S/.1,300.00, comprará  productos agrícolas (plátano, cacao, maíz, frijol) para su venta de las mañanas e insumos para preparar juanes asados a la parrilla y juanes para la venta de las noches.
Elza,  es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda ofrecer diversidad de productos para mantener contentos a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para su familia, y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de seguir generando sus propios ingresos y además de apoyarlas con los diferentes temas de capacitación que reciben.
texts.en:
Elza belongs to the Mujeres de la Colinia II communal bank.  It is in the La Banda de Silcayo district, San Martin province, San Martin Department.  She is 36 years old and in a common-law marriage.  She has an 11 year old son who attends elementary school.

She always lived in the countryside helping her parents along with her husband.  When her son got older and had to go to school they left to live in the city.  That is when she found herself needing to generate her own income by washing her neighbors’ clothes.  She does this to support her husband with her son's education

She has been working with her communal bank for three years.  With her first loan she bought a grill to sell food that is roasted on the grill in the evenings.  In the mornings she buys and sells farming products at a market in the city.  She buys things like bananas and grains (bean, cacao, corn, and coffee) in order to continue generating income to contribute financially to her household and her son’s education.

She will use the 1,300 soles from this loan to buy farming products (bananas, cacao, corn, and beans) in order to sell them in the mornings.  She will also use them as ingredients to prepare “juanes” (seasoned rice wrapped in a green bijao leaf. Seasoning typically includes turmeric and cumin, giving the rice a warm flavor and a yellowish color. Most juanes also contain a small piece of chicken, a slice of egg and an olive or two), roasted on the grill  to sell at night.

Elza is a tenacious and enterprising woman.  Her dream is to have a grocery store where she could offer diverse products to keep her customers happy and to generate income for her family.  She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to continue generating her own income.  She is also grateful for the support the members receive through various trainings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Chematia

texts.en:
Chematia is a mother of four adult children and lives with her family in Eldoret, where she has been active in farming for over 10 years through intensive production of maize for the local market.

Chematia has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into poultry farming. She says she will be able to have an all-season production of poultry, unlike maize farming, which takes place only twice a year and is highly influenced by weather conditions. She adds that the increased income will improve her standard of living.

Chematia notes, additionally, that their small parcels of land are a limitation on the production of crops like maize.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Yuri Antonio

texts.es: Yuri Antonio se dedica a brindar el servicio de tricitaxi, ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, en cual ha sido un excelente cliente y a demostrado la responsabilidad que tiene con un crédito. Este negocio que tiene Yuri es muy utilizado por la comunidad donde él vive, ya  que tiene los clientes fijos y eventuales que utilizan sus  servicios. Yuri está muy agradecido con el financiamiento que se le ha brindado por que ha mejorado poco a poco su herramienta de trabajo como es tricitax. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para comprar lo son pedales, cadenas, entre otros arreglos que quiere realizarle a su tricitaxi.
texts.en:
Yuri Antonio earns a living running a tricycle taxi service.  He already received financing through the Fundación León 2000 and has been an excellent client, demonstrating that he is responsible with a loan.  Yuri's business is very popular in the community where he lives, so he has s fixed customer base as well as spontaneous customers who require his services.  

Yuri is very grateful for the financing he has received and has been able to make improvements to his tricycle taxi, which is his work tool.  The loan he is currently requesting is to buy pedals, chains and other spare parts to fix up his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy pedals, chains and other spare parts.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is 42 years old, married, and has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have supported their family by running a mechanical shop at their house for 12 years. They make screws. 

Ngan is requesting a loan, which she will use to expand her business by buying equipment and materials to better satisfy her customers.  She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and materials for her metal shop.

loans.name: Gricelda Beatriz

texts.es: La cliente reside en Quevedo.  Empezó esta actividad cuando tuvo la posibilidad de invertir su capital propio en el comercio.  Labora todos los días sola, vendiendo su mercadería.  Al momento se encuentra en trámite de divorcio, tiene 3 hijos de 15, 13 y 7 años quienes asisten a la escuela fiscal del sector.  Le gustaría incrementar su negocio a futuro y brindarle bienestar a sus hijos.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de zapatos, jeans y blusas para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de jeans, blusas y zapatos

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
The hair salon « FASHION HAIR » started its activities 10 years ago, and since then Madam Sarah G. made all effort to improve her services. Single with two daughters, she manages her dressing parlor with rigor and honesty, what makes her renown in her area. Because of her hard, her salon is attracts regular clients. Madam G. has shown the proof of a trusty woman through her first credits granted and promptly repaid without incident. At the request of her customers, Madam Sarah G. has added to her salon braiding and other hair accessories. These upgrades require finances beyond her present means. For that purpose, Madam sarah G. requests a credit of $850 which she will use to purchase the hair drier, and others accessories in order to face an increasing demand of her customary at these end years festivities. The implementation of this project will increase the incomes of Madam Sarah G. and allow her to improve the lives of her two children.

Translated by Farron BLANC

La coiffure « FASHION HAIR » a ouvert ses portes il y a 10 ans et dès lors, Madame G. Sarah s’évertue à améliorer ses prestations. Célibataire avec deux (02) filles, elle gère bien son salon de coiffure avec rigueur et honnêteté, ce qui fait sa réputation dans son quartier. Par son travail bien fait, son atelier est de plus en plus fréquenté par les clients. Madame G. a fait preuve d’une femme de confiance à travers ses premiers crédits obtenus et promptement remboursés sans incident. A la demande de sa clientèle, Madame G. a adjoint à la coiffure et à la tresse, la vente de mèches et d’accessoires de coiffure. Ce qui nécessite des moyens financiers plus consistant qu’elle ne dispose pas actuellement. Pour ce faire, G. Sarah sollicite un crédit de $ 850 qui servira évidemment à l’achat d’un séchoir, des mèches et autres accessoires afin de faire face à une demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle à cette période des fêtes de fin d’année. La réalisation de ce projet augmentera à coup sûr les revenus de G. Sarah et lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses deux enfants.

loans.use: to purchase hair drier, millers and others accessories

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: I am a married man, father of 4. I sell cheap electronics to earn a living for my family. I am the main breadwinner. The loan will help me expand my business and be able to cater for my family’s needs with ease.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Mr. M. needs to expand his house. He says, "I would like to build a room in the front of my house. It has been a lot of work to build the house little by little, but my children are growing and so I need to build another room." He is asking for $1200 to build a room.

Translated from Spanish by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Martín M. necesita ampliar su vivienda. “Me gustaría hacer un cuarto al frente de mi casa, me ha costado muchos trabajo ir construyendo poco a poco pero mis hijos están creciendo por lo tanto me veo en la necesidad de construir un cuarto más”. Solicita $ 1,200.00 dlls Para la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en:
Akif is an IDP originally from Khojali, an occupied district of Azerbaijan. In 1993, he fled Khojali to start a new life in Baku. He is a husband and a father of one child.

In 1998, he started his auto repair business. However, after several years, his business began to face a lot of tough competition from other businesses in the same industry. Thus, he applied and has received an initial loan from the Normicro Baku branch. He has invested this money in varying the number of paint colors for his shop.

Akif hopes to receive another loan amount of $1,100 so that he can further purchase equipment and other raw materials for his auto business.

loans.use: To buy equipment and raw materials for his business

texts.id:
T. (23) is an active client of Yamida. She owns a kiosk that sells snacks and soft drinks. T. has been running her business since 6 years ago. Now she lives with her only child and husband who is a goat trader who earns $90 per month. T.'s kiosk earns about $30 to $40 per day. However, she wants to grow her business by getting a $150 loan to expand her kiosk's offering.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

T. (23) adalah client aktif dari Yamida yang memiliki usaha warung yang menjual makanan, minuman ringan dan beberapa kebutuhan pokok, T. menjalankan usahanya sejak 6 tahun yang lalu, sekarang dia tinggal bersama satu orang anak dan suaminya yang juga memiliki usaha jual beli kambing dengan keuntungan setiap bulan $ 90, dari bisnis warungnya tersebut T. mendapat keuntungan sebesar $30 - $ 40 per hari namun dia ingin usahanya itu meningkat dengan pinjaman sebesar $150 untuk memenuhi stok warungnya.

loans.use: Purchase food and drink items to be sold

loans.name: Djeyhun

texts.en: Djeyhun is 28 years old, divorced, and lives in Khachmaz town. This young man repairs radiators of cars. He has been in this business for 2 years. He needs a loan of  $825 to buy needed materials for repairing radiators.

loans.use: To buy needed materials for repairing  radiators of cars

loans.name: Thi Ha

texts.vi:
Ms Hà is married and has a young child. They live in the town of Chờ, Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. Before she used to be a garment contractor making blankets, pillows ...etc. Then she opened a store to sell those herself. Her husband is a woodworker and the main breadwinner in the family. Ms Hà wishes to obtain a loan to invest in her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hà đã có chồng và 1 con nhỏ. Chị sống ở Thị trấn Chờ, Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. Trước đây, chj nhận may thuê chăn, gối... cho các cửa hàng. Sau này, chi đã tích cóp và mở được một cửa hàng bán chăn, ga, gối, đệm cho riêng mình. Chồng chị làm thợ mộc và là người tạo thu nhập chính cho gia đình. Chị rất mong có thêm vốn để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của mình.

loans.use: To purchase pillow, blanket for sale

loans.name: Talaia

texts.en: Talaia is  fifty years old and has three children.  She’s one of the oldest member of the program. This is  because she always makes her weekly payments on time and honors the program's rules. She’s got a big plantation now and sells her products at the market  three days per week and makes a profit of $200ST ($80USD) per day. Her current loan of $1750ST was used to buy chemicals to grow her business and the rest was used to repair their bathroom in a European style. She has said, her next loan will used to build a small house for them!  She believes that this is the only financial help she can get and is very thankful. She wants to stay with the program and continue to be an excellent borrower.

loans.use: Buy chemicals for her farming business and home improvement

loans.name: Nina Widawati

texts.en: Nina, 37,  is married to M. J. who has lost his job. To support her family she sells flavoured ice and fruits at her food stall near her house, earning $10 a week with a very small profit. She has joined MBK and now is requesting a loan of $150 to buy more supplies for her food stall. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Buy more supplies

loans.name: Felix Francisco

texts.es:
Felix C. is a young man well respected in his community of San Caralampio. He grew up in the country, and even at his young age is already a businessman and farmer. He is married and has a young son. His mother has been a good example to him, passing on her good business sense. She has a fruit stand in one of the main markets in the capital which generates good income. Now he needs a loan to be able to purchase materials needed for a successful harvest. Thanks to the unconditional help of his mother, this young man has been able to move forward with his dream of building his business and giving back some of the love and support he has always received from her.

Félix C., un joven ejemplar de su comunidad San Caralampio, creció en el campo y a su corta edad, es un agricultor y comerciante, es casado y tiene un hijo pequeño con ayuda de su madre que es su ejemplo a seguir y de quien heredó la habilidad del comercio y que tiene un puesto de frutas en uno de los principales mercados de la capital llamado Mercado Huembes, esto le dá buenas ganancias, ahora necesita su préstamo para comprar insumos de mantenimiento de la cosecha y tenerla lista a tiempo. Es gracias al apoyo incondicional de su señora madre que este joven a logrado salir adelante su sueño es un día con su trabajo y cuido retribuir a su madre al amor y apoyo que siempre ha recibido de ella.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS NECESSARY FOR A SUCCESSFUL HARVEST.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy merchandise at wholesales prices.

loans.name: Efigenio

texts.es:
Efigenio has always been tied to the textile business. His family has been working in clothing manufacture and sales for several years. One of his brothers holds a sales position in a large commercial center. It is for this reason that, after leaving behind his business of selling groceries for one and one half years, Efigenio contented himself with the manufacture of hats and pouches. He has spent three years already in this line of work. It is not his first foray into the textile industry; before he worked selling groceries, he bought and sold ready-to-wear clothing. Efigenio lives with his wife, who is employed as a domestic worker, and with his twenty-year-old son. In the future he plans to continue with his clothing manufacture business, making it grow and contracting personnel when he installs more machines in his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Efigenio siempre ha estado vinculado al negocio de textiles. Su familia ha estado dedicada al negocio de la confección y venta de ropa durante varios años. Uno de sus hermanos tiene un puesto de venta en un gran centro comercial. Es por esto que, luego de dejar su negocio de abarrotes en el que duro año y medio, se animo a invertir en la confección de gorras y canguros. Hoy ya lleva tres años dedicándose a esto. Aunque no es la primera vez que esta dentro del negocio textil, antes de haber trabajado vendiendo abarrotes el compraba y vendía ropa ya confeccionada. El vive con su esposa quien trabaja brindando servicios domésticos y con su hijo de veinte años. Más adelante tiene planeado seguir con su negocio de confección, hacerlo crecer y contratar a un personal de trabajo cuando implemente su taller con más máquinas.

loans.use: Purchase of machinery for manufacture of clothing

loans.name: Sua

texts.en: Sua A., 44, is married with 3 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells to the village people  4 days per week. She has had 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $250 USD.  SPBD loans are Sua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for her children's educational needs. Her husband does all the farming.

loans.use: To finance equipment needed for her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia is 37 years old, completed high school, speaks Castilian and Aymara, is married and has a son in college. She lives in Barrio 24 of Junio, Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Peru. She makes and sells bread (French bread, "tres esquinas," sarnita, and wheat bread), selling it in Llave and Pilcuyo. She has been baking bread since she was 15 years old.

She belongs to the Blue Lake Common Bank, and started with a $115 loan, with which she bought three bags flour. With this loan of $725, which will be repaid in 3 months, she will buy 10 bags of flour, 2 sacks of sugar, and 10 bags of salt. She says these credits have permitted her to increase her production and improve her income. She longs for her son to finish his studies and become a professional.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Cecilia tiene 37 años D. edad, logro estudiar secundaria completa, habla castellano y aymará, es casada, tiene un hijo que estudia en el Colegio, ella vive en el Barrio 24 D. Junio, del Distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao. La actividad a la que se dedica es elaboración y venta D. pan (marraqueta, tres esquinas, sarnita, D. trigo) vendiéndolo en Ilave y Pilcuyo actividad a la que se dedica desD. hace 15 años. Pertenece al banco Comunal “Lago Azul” inicio con un crédito D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que compro tres sacos D. harina. Con este crédito D. S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 3 meses comprará 10 sacos D. harina, 2 sacos D. azúcar, 10 bolsitas D. sal. Dice que estos créditos le han permitido incrementar su producción y mejorar su ingreso económico. El gran anhelo que ella tiene es que su hijo siga estudiando, sea profesional.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S. R., 35, lives in Sa Ang with her husband, Nghean Chhum, and their three children. She sells coffee and soft drinks out of her home, making US$5 each day. Her husband is a construction foreman while two of their children are employed as a driver and a garment factoR. worker.

Keo S. R. has asked for a loan of US$1200 to purchase a motortaxi for her son. Her son would like to start his own motortaxi service and needs the money to purchase a reliable motorbike. The family sees this as a good investment that will increase their income and allow them to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motortaxi

loans.name: Eleodoro

texts.es:
Eleodoro tiene 45 años, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de 18,12, 9 y 6 años, los cuales son estudiantes. Se dedica a la crianza de animales, sus carneros son los que mayor rentabilidad le proporcionan, dicha actividad la viene realizando hace 30 años y desde entonces, sale desde muy temprano por la mañana a los diversos pastorales del lugar para alimentar a su ganado  y llevarlos a los ríos o lagunas cercanas para que puedan beber el agua necesaria. Esta actividad le toma todo el día, hasta el atardecer, regresa muy cansado por el implacable sol del día y el terrible frío de la tarde.Pero le agrada su trabajo, sabe que tiene que alimentar y cuidar muy bien a sus animales, lo complicado es transportar la carne que obtiene hacia los mercados más cercanos.
Eleodoro tiene en su hogar el mejor motivador que todo padre y esposo pueda tener para  salir adelante, su esposa y sus hijos.
Él desea invertir en la compra de dos carneros de raza, para el incremento de su ganado, con ello, incrementará la cantidad de carne que llevará a los mercados para vender.
texts.en:
Eleodoro is 45 years old; he lives with his wife and four children who are 18, 12, 9 and 6 years old and are students. He raises animals, his sheep are what are the most profitable. He has been doing this activity for 30 years and since that time, early every morning he goes to the various grazing fields where he lives to feed his stock and takes them to rivers or nearby lagoons so they can drink water. This takes him all day to do, until sunset, and he returns home tired from the constant daytime sun and the terrible cold during the afternoon. But he likes his work. He knows he must feed and care for his animals very well. What is complicated is transporting their meat to the nearby markets.

Eleodoro's home, his wife and his children are the greatest inspiration he has a father to get ahead.

He would like to invest in the purchase of two rams, so he can increase his stock and increase the quantity of meat that he takes to market to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two rams to improve the quality and quantity of his herd.

loans.name: Mrs. Prak Sok Art's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan in Krang Leav Village in Kampong Chhnang Province consists of eighteen people. They plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Prak S. A. is the village bank president, and she is a fruit seller in the local market. Aside from this business, she is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, S. she decided to ask for a loan to buy two more pigs for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Thon Thuren, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support his family. Mrs. Prak S. A. is 50 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom sells firewood and another, the youngest, attends the local school. Mrs. Hem Chantha is a group guarantor and is alS. presented in the picture. All of the members are shown in the picture but two of them are blocked.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Seventeen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. The EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients stA. to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy two more pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson N. is a proud member of Kiwamirembe Women’s group and has a retail shop that has been basically running with the help of loans. His first loan was used to buy more products for his shop, and now as a result, he has been able to cater to his family’s needs as well as paying the children’s school fees. He has so far started up a fresh fruits and vegetables business for his wife, and his dream is to open up another shop for his wife to manage. He is so grateful for the loans because his well-being depends on them.

loans.use: Wilson Ntulume needs a loan to help with restocking his shop.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 37 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Se dedica a administrar las ganancias del servicio de transporte en el motocarro que posee y que con gran esfuerzo logró adquirir, esta nueva actividad de administradora la realiza recientemente, hace algunos meses, es algo que siempre quiso hacer, para poder llevar la cuenta de sus negocios, que es lo que más le agrada y gracias a que en la zona en que reside es muy  rentable, ya que la gente  tiene que como medio de trasporte a los motocarros para poder movilizarse, pero sin duda los problemas de la competencia afecta el alquiler de su moto. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Nelly desea invertir el dinero en el mantenimiento de su motocarro, el cual es muy costoso, por las diversas reparaciones que tiene.
texts.en:
Nelly is 37, is married, and lives with her husband and 3 children. She manages the earnings of a motorcycle rickshaw transportation service that she owns, which she acquired with a lot of effort. She recently started being the manager several months ago. She has always wanted to keep track of her business. This is what she likes to do most. The area she lives in is very profitable since the people there use motorcycle rickshaws to move around. Without a doubt, though, the problems from her competition affect how she is able to rent out her motorcycle. This is her first loan with MFP. Nelly hopes to invest the money in maintenance of her motorcycle, which is very expensive because of the different repairs that it needs.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of her motorcycle rickshaw

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison T. produces soap and sells it at Abrobeano near Elmina. Harrison has received junior high education. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a businesswoman.

Harrison has been producing soap for sale since 2003. He is responsible for meeting the family's financial needs. His loan will be used as additional capital to buy more raw materials like soda, red oil, and others to enable him to increase production to meet increasing demand. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest back into the business to enable him increase his income.

On the table are some of the soaps he has already made.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more raw materials to produce soap

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es: Mauricia tiene 52 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y con el menor D. sus hijos en su propia casa. Trabaja cada día en sus tierras D. cultivo, cortando el pasto para venderlo a sus vecinos que se dedican principalmente a la ganadería, venD. en grandes cantidades, lo que le permite tener ingresos diarios para su familia, es por ello que Mauricia sale temprano D. su casa a preparar todo para sus ventas, también por las mañanas se va a la plaza D. su localidad con todo lo que ha cortado, D. esa manera no solo son sus vecinos quienes le compran, sino también otras personas D. zonas más lejanas. La meta D. Mauricia es expandir su mercado, por ello, llevara sus pastos a la ciudad para venderlos en el mercado mayorista y D. esa manera convertirse en una gran comerciante D. pastos para animales. Adicionalmente, cría sus propios animales, además D. también dedicarse a la fabricación D. ladrillos en lo que apoya a su esposo durante algunas horas al día. Es la quinta vez que Mauricia tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta del servicio que recibe en cuanto a los préstamos, además D. haber aprendido el hábito del ahorro, por lo que recomienda a otras personas trabajar D. esta manera, con bancos comunales. La cantidad solicitada es para adquirir mejores herramientas D. cortado D. pasto, asimismo invertirá en el pago D. transporte que utilizará para trasladar sus paquetes D. pasto, también comprará una vaca lechera. Las herramientas están valorizadas en 50 soles, el pago D. transporte por toda una temporada será D. aproximadamente 300 y con el resto comprará una vaca D. raza.
texts.en:
Mauricia is 52 year old and lives with her husband and the youngest of her children in their own house. She works each day in their fields of crops, cutting the grass to sell to their neighbors who raise cattle. They sell great quantities which allow them to have daily income for the family. Because of this, Mauricia leaves her house early to prepare for her sales. Each morning she goes to the town plaza with all the grass she has cut. Therefore, it's not just her neighbors that buy from her, but also other people from areas farther away. Mauricia's goal is to expand her reach by taking her grass to the city to sell it in a bigger market, allowing her to become a bigger trader of grass for animals. Additionally, she would raise her own animals and spend more time helping her husband make bricks for a few hours each day. This is the fifth time that Mauricia has taken a loan with MFP and she is very content with the service she has received so far. Also, she has learned the habit of saving through the recommendation of other people that work like she does in a communal bank. The amount she is requesting will be used to buy better grass cutting tools, to invest more in the transportation fee that she pays to move her packets of grass and to buy a milking cow. The tools are valued at 50 soles, the transportation fee for one season will be approximately 300 soles and with the rest she will buy a cow.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and better tools for cutting grass

loans.name: Ma. Elna

texts.en:
Ma. Elna Gato is a "calamay" maker. She sells them for PHP 35.00 each in their barrio to have additional income for the family. "Calamay" is a special delicacy in Bohol. Everybody buys this kind of food because of its distinct taste. Coconut meat, sugar, and rice flour are the main ingredients of her "calamay." Due to its popularity, it's easy to market her products. She started her business in 2008 with PHP 4,000 capital. Since then, she has maintained the growth of her business and is doing well.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more ingredients for her calamay business. She believes she has a future in this kind of endeavor. Her loan will also enable her to help her husband support their children. 

CEVI helps "calamay" makers sustain their businesses. By joining in the CEVI credit program, each has the chance to avail CEVI credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage that it offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making "calamay"

loans.name: Lina Júlio

texts.pt:
Lina nasceu em chibuto tem 46 anos de idade, vive maritalmente estudou ate a 7 classe Mae de 4 filhos com idades conpriendidas entre os 26 aos 11anos de idade 3 dos fihos e que vao a escola.

Lina sai de chubuto a namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilandia quando tinha 14 anos de idade com o seu irmao mais velho este que era trabalhador dos registos civil e foi transferido para trabalhar naquele distrito. Chegado a namaacha lina ingressa a escola, ano seguinte ela fica gravida do seu esposo e teve que interroper os estudos porque na altura era proibido estudar emquanto gravida. junta se com o seu marido, 2 anos depois casam se e ele a abandona 5 dias depois do casamento emigra para a africa do sul deixando uma carta que so foi descoberta 6 meses depois alegando que ia a procura de emprego ate entao. A vida fica dificil e sem saber o que fazer ela pede ajuda ao irmao e este aranja um enprego para ela no registo civil como servente onde trabalha durante 5 anos. Com o fundo colectado ela inicia o seu proprio negocio de venda de capulanas adquiria em maputo e revendia na swazilandia, o seu negocio foi crescendo e já não conseguia satisfazer a necessidades dos clientes, entao aproxima se aos nossos servicos solicitando um emprestimo no valor de 20.000.mt para aumentar o seu stock de mercadoria. Hoje tem como melhor produto lencois, mantas, duvetes e cortinas  que adquiri a 400.00mt, a 500.00mt, a 350.00mt e revende a 1000.00mt, a 1250.00mt, e a 600mt concecutivamente. Tem tido um lucro mensal de 8.000.00mt por mês e consegue poupar 3.000.00mt pois não responsabiliza se por niguem. 

Este e o terceiro emprestimo de lina na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva.os primeiros dois usou para comprar mercadorias (roupas, lencois, duvetes e mantas), desta vez lina pretende usar os 20.000.00mt para o mesmo fim e esta confiante que vai desembolsar antes do prazo determinado e pedir um novo emprestimo para concluir a obra da sua cozinha.
texts.en:
Lina was born in Chibuto. She is 46 years old and married. She went to school until the 7th grade. She is the mother of 4 children with ages between 26 and 11, and the youngest 3 are in school. Lina left Chibuto for Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, when she was 14 years old with her oldest brother who was working for the registry office and was transferred to work in that district. When she arrived in Namaacha Lina enrolled in school. The following year she became pregnant with her boyfriend and had to interrupt her studies because at that time it was prohibited to go to school while pregnant. She moved in with her boyfriend. Two years later they married, and he abandoned her 5 days after the wedding emigrating to South Africa and leaving a letter that only was discovered 6 months after alleging that he went to search for work. Life became difficult and without knowing what to do she asked for help from her brother who arranged a job for her in the registry office as a servant where she worked for 5 years. With the money collected she began her own business of selling capulanas [a kind of robe/dress]. She buys them in Maputo and resells them in Swaziland. Her business was growing, and she was unable to satisfy the demand of her customers. She discovered our services [Hluvuku] and solicited a loan in the amount of 20,000MT to increase her inventory. Today her best products are sheets, blankets, duvets, and curtains that she buys for 400MT, 500MT and 350MT, and resells at 1,000MT, 1,250MT, and 3,000MT respectively. She has had a monthly income of 8,000MT per month and is able to save 3,000MT since she isn't responsible for anyone else. This is her third loan through Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first two loans were used to purchase products (clothing, sheets, duvets, and blankets). This time Lina intends to use 20,000MT to the same end and is confident that she will be able to pay it off before maturity so she can request another loan to finish the work on her kitchen.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various clothing and bedding

loans.name: Jamaima

texts.en:
Jamaima E. has a small boat that she and her husband, Erlando, use to fish for a living. Besides catching fish, they grow seaweed. She is 24 years old and has two children in school. Jamaima worked previously as a saleslady in one of the biggest malls in Bohol. She was not happy about her job and decided to get married instead and go back to her old barrio and manage a seaweed farm.

Jamaima is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 ($220 USD) from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy a new pump boat engine. The loan will truly help the couple continue fishing and farming seaweed, and help them support their children and provide them a better future. CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. They provide not only credit but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy a pump boat engine for their fishing business and seaweed farm.

loans.name: Diaraye

texts.fr: Diaraye S. est une femme mariée de 36 ans, mère de 5 enfants. Elle s’active au commerce de pâte d’arachide et aimerait renforcer son activité. Ceci pour assurer à ses enfants des conditions de vie meilleure.
texts.en:
Diaraye S. is a married woman of 36, the mother of 5 children. She sells peanut butter and would like to bolster her business. This is in order to ensure that her children have better living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel D. is a 44-year-old man married with three kids who are currently in school. He trades in cassava, maize and plantain. He treks to Techiman in the northern part of the country to buy his stock in bulk and supplies his customers on a credit basis. Apart from petty trading, he is also a shoemaker who manufactures ladies' and men’s footwear, a profession he learnt about 10 years ago.

With the loan Daniel wants to buy more maize, cassava, and plantain and also buy more leather to enable him to manufacture different kinds of shoes to meet his customers’ demand. He believes the loan will enable him to save more income to pay for his children in school. He is member of the group called Aminkyi which literally means ‘unity’ Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a means of collateral.

loans.use: To purchase cassava, maize and plantains in bulk.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde resides in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes. She is married with a child. She is 31 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Wiñay Muju Group

texts.es: El grupo Wiñay Maju" esta representado por su presidente el señor Walter y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como a la venta D. zapatos, comida, venta D. jugos y al servicio D. transporte público D. pasajeros. En general la competencia para los socios D. este grupo es llevadera ya que son únicos en sus mercados D. barrio y en sus pequeños negocios. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. materiales e insumos que ayuden a mejorar sus herramientas D. trabajo y al incremento D. su mercadería para un mejor ingreso que brinD. a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Los miembros D. este grupo han demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus antecedentes crediticios por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo en grupos solidarios y en la fuerza D. un grupo unido.
texts.en:
Walter is president of and represents the Wiñay Maju group. The group is comprised of twelve members who have businesses like selling shoes, selling meals, selling juices, and public transportation service. In general, the competition for the group’s members is tolerable because they are the only ones in their small businesses in the neighborhood markets. The loan is to buy materials and supplies to help improve their working tools and to increase merchandise. This will bring a better income and offer their families a better quality of life. The members of this group have demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with their previous loans. They know how to work in supportive groups; they know the power of a united group.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Beng

texts.en:
Beng L., 53, and her husband, Mr. Yang Torng (shown in the picture), 54, live with their four children in the Province of Pursat. Beng and Yang are local farmers, growing rice, vegetables and fruit in the village. Their children are students and they also work on the farm when they are free from studying.

To make plowing the farmland during this coming growing-crop season easier, Beng L. would like a loan to buy a water buffalo. In the future, she can raise its offspring and make plowing even easier.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo

loans.name: Norith

texts.es: La señora Norith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Jerusalén II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus 02 únicos hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Las ganancias que genera a diario, la ayuda al ingreso económico  en su familia. Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Norith, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y prepararse para hacer frente a las adversidades de la vida  y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Ms. Norith R. is a member of the Jerusalen II Microfinance Institute, located in the Tarapoto district of the province and department of San Martín. She is a 34-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 2 dependent children. Her strength and her desire to help her children get ahead motivated her to set up her own general store, which is located in her own house in an area that is well-suited to attend to her customers. Her daily revenues contribute to the household income. Ever since she got started, she has been gaining customers. She now has a fixed clientele that visit her store daily to shop, and she personally attends to them with the charm for which she is noted. With this 800.00 PEN loan, she will purchase sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, crates of milk, boxes of canned fish (in a variety of brands), eggs, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue to give the best customer satisfaction. Norith feels strong enough to continue working and to prepare herself for life’s difficulties. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have the opportunity to grow in their line of work.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia D. is 47 years old, the same age as her husband, Felix. The couple have three children, ages 21 to 26. Their eldest child is a computer programming graduate and the other two are college undergraduates who are working as laborers.

Lydia, her husband, and their children had been living in Manila. Lydia's husband worked in a manufacturing shop that made household furniture from native materials, such as ratan. She sold relief goods, such as clothing, shoes, and bags, to people in their village. Felix received only a small profit from his output despite the hard work it entailed. Lydia's business was unstable because she did not have sufficient business capital. Because Lydia and Felix felt that they could not afford to live in Manila with its high standard of living and still send all of their children to college, they decided to return to their own province in Antique.

Because Felix had experience in furniture-making, enhanced by years of working in Manila, he and Lydia thought of opening their own furniture shop in the Province. Lydia agreed to her husband's idea and she was delighted once again, because she can have still her own business buying and selling relief goods while partnering with her husband in the furniture business. A small amount of savings and a loan from ASHI enabled Lydia and her husband open a shop in their house in Patria, Pandan. They hired one of Felix coworkers from Manila to work with them. 

Lydia believes that, someday, her loan from ASHI will make their business successful because she maintains an excellent record of repayment and attendance at center meetings. Her attitude is as fine as their manufactured furniture, which attracts potential customers. Some day, she wishes that their business will grow and, more importantly, that it will generate employment in the community.

loans.use: Majority will be for buying materials for furniture making and small amount will support her buying and selling of relief goods.

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en: L. Aisha is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 35 years old and married with 4 children aged 18 – 3 years as she takes care of her old parents and 3 orphans. She is a tailor and at the same time is involved into the sale of cloth materials for 10 years and her major challenge is the limited capital she has hence not having enough stock all the time. At the moment, she makes 80,000/= as weekly profits due to her quality materials and the fashionable designs for her customers. Her goal is to own business premises so as to stop renting plus own a house and improve the quality of life of her family. Aisha needs a loan to help increase cloth stock for the profits derived out of the business will help to meet the ever growing demand for the clothes that she sells hence more income.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for sale and for the tailoring business.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal A., age 45, and her husband, Mr. ThA. Leang, age 50, were married in 1983 and have six sons and two daughters. Two of their sons are married and live outside the family home, one daughter is a garment factory worker, one son is a blacksmith and another son is a fisherman. The family lives along National Road Number Five about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sophal and her husband have been growing rice since they were married. Besides farming, Sophal also has been selling groceries and cosmetics (lotions) since 2006. Her husband is a mason as well and operates his business in his village.

Sophal is a applying for a loan of $350 to purchase fishing nets for her son’s fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets for her son’s fishing business

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela D., 27 years old, is a married woman and mother to 3 children. Her rice field needs additional farm inputs. In order to obtain what she needs, she joined CEVI for its financial service. She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 to buy additional farm inputs. This loan will help Estela and her family cope with life’s difficulties.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: V. is a newly married man age 31, and he and his wife have one lovely young child. V. currently uses his own motorcycle to run a taxi service, picking up passer-by who need to go to anywhere in Phnom Penh town. He usually generates an income of $4 each day to contribute his family's financial crisis. At the same time, he also goes to buy vegetable in bulk for his wife to sell at the market for additional profits. V.'s income is decreasing frequently due to his motor is not attractive to the customer. Because of this, he would like a loan of $700 to replace his old one. V. was not available for photographing, so his wife is shown instead.

loans.use: To replace his old motorbike

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 37 years old, married and blessed with six children. His business is located on the outskirts of Kipchamo in Eldoret Town.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend. With the loan he is requesting from KADET, he intends to raise his chickens by buying chick mash and layers mash. Layers are chickens bred as egg layers. Mash is a type of chicken feed. 

In the future, Peter intends to be a farmer.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy mash for raising chickens

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent M. is 37 years old and married. For the past six years, he has run a retail shop selling household items, foodstuffs, kerosene and other products. 

He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase more kerosene from the depot. He describes himself as valiant and ambitious. He hopes to expand his business so that, in the future, he can own his own house.  

About Faulu Kenya
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to his stock of kerosene.

loans.name: Mariétou

texts.fr: MAriétou D. est femme de 61 ans, est veuve et mère de 7 enfants dont les plus jeunes sont à sa charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAYOUF depuis 2 ans et demi. Son prêt lui permet de développer un petit commerce en vendant des fruits de saison tels que des mangues, des fruit d'agrume, des pastèques etc. Ses revenus lui servent à prendre en charges ses enfants et à subvenir à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Mariétou D. is a woman aged 61, and she is widowed with 7 children, of whom the youngest are in her care. She has been a member of the Village Loan Group of Bayouf for two and a half years. Her loan allows her to develop a small business selling seasonal fruit such as mangoes, citrus fruit, watermelon, etc. Her income helps her take care of her children and provide for herself.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her fruit-selling business

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Cette femme habite dans le quartier d’apédokoè qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, elle exerce comme  activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois. Elle s’approvisionne au marché local d’assiyéyé. Son stock de charbons de bois a connu une baisse, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 30 sacs de charbons de bois, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Sokodé, ainsi elle arrive à réaliser un grosse marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes.
texts.en:
This woman lives in Apédokoè, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. Her revenue-generating business involves commerce in charcoal. She stocks up at the local marketplace in Assiyéyé. Her stock of charcoal experience a drop. She would like to stock up again. This is why she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 30 sacks of charcoal. She stocks up from the country's interior in the city of Sokodé, and so she manages to realize a large profit margin on her sales.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying charcoal

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia B., 44, is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is widowed and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sonia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Sonia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI, and is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Sonia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 29, married, and a mother of two. Both her children are currently in school. She lives with her family in a community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works tirelessly in supporting her husband in taking care of the children. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood.

She is a very skillful and a talented hair dresser, and for that reason many people visit her salon. She has two years experience and also has three apprentices. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like wigs, pomade, shampoo, activators, hair dryer machines, etc. to serve her customers well. She would be grateful for your assistance and support.

loans.use: To buy hair products and supplies

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  FORTUNATA, pertenecen al banco comunal “PRO DESARROLLO”, la socia vive en Pisac situado en la provincia de Calca departamento de Cusco, está a 40 minutos de la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero de unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado de paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años de edad, ella es soltera y trabaja desde hace 5 años en el mercado de Pisac vendiendo verduras, negocio que le permite crecer y seguir adelante con su desarrollo económico, nuestra socia vende todos los días verduras en el mercado, ella compra al por mayor en la misma ciudad del Cusco y otros en las comunidades cercanas y los vende en el mercado principal de Pisac, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su negocio y así poder abastecerse de mayor mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, FORTUNATA, belongs to the "PRO DESARROLLO" community bank. She lives in Pisac, 40 minutes from the Peruvian city of Cusco. Pisac is a small town, a heritage site of lovely Inca-era buildings that is an obligatory stop for tourists on the way to Cusco.

Fortunata is 32 years old and single. She has operated a business selling vegetables in the local market for 5 years, a business that has contributed greatly to her economic well-being. She works in the Pisac market every day, selling vegatables that she buys at a wholesale market in Cusco and other markets in nearby towns. Our member is applying for a loan that she will invest in the business by buying larger stocks of products to resell.

Fortunata is grateful for the opportunity that micro-lending offers and she is committed to repaying the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: You

texts.en: Mrs. You O. is 55 years old and she lives with her spouse in Pou Khvet village, Takeo province. She sells dried fish. Her husband, Mr. Orl Chantha, is a house builder who can make a little income to support his family. In order to support the business of selling dried fish, Mrs. You O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more dried fish to resell in the local market. The couple has three children. One of the children is a mechanic and the other two are students in the local school and help their mother in the business.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to resell

loans.name: José Emilio

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo, sector l guasaule el señor José Emilio O. C., se dedica al desarrollo de diversas actividades como son la venta de comida, soldadura y como maestro de obras, el empezó su negocio cuando estableció su vivienda en el guasaule quien en este momento no vendía grandes cantidades, sin embargo al ser reconocido y al pasar el tiempo este fue creciendo y mejorando para ellos ya que es administrado también por su esposa, ellos trabajan de 10 am a 8 pm todos los días de la semana.
El crédito solicitado será empleado para la reparación de la cocina de su casa puesto que esta en mal estado y es una parte fundamental para su actividad la cual le genera la mayor parte de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
In the city of Somotillo in sector I of the Guasaule region, José Emilio O. C. is involved in the development of diverse activities such as the sale of food and flooring. He is also a master builder. He began his business when he established his home in Guasaule. At first he didn’t sell much, but with the passage of time his business increased and improved for him and his wife, who also helps administer it. They work from 10:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. every day of the week.

The loan applied for will be used for the repair of the kitchen in his house, which is in a bad state and which is vital for the business which generates the greatest portion of his earnings. .

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement, concrete blocks, sand, steel, etc.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa de 42 años de edad es soltera  tiene una una hija mayor de edad de 24 años de edad la cual es casada y tiene 2 niños. Maria Teresa  trabaja en INATEC desde hace 17 años en el area de la bibilioteca,  a pesar que solamente tuvo solamente una hija ella ha criado a  tres sobrinos con la ayuda de su mamà ya que ella trabaja en la colonia Yolaina, todos los dìas tiene que viajar a las 7:00 a.m. y regresa a las  6:00 p.m., ella es una mujer responsable honesta y muy trabajadora.  Este seria su 7mo financiamiento en AFODENIC, con el cual ella pretende construir una habitaciòn, para tener privacidad y comodidad en el hogar ya que lo necesita. Teresa sueña un porvenir mejor para su hija y  sus tres sobrinos y tener estabilidad laboral para ayudarlos en lo que mas pueda.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 42 years old. She is single and has an older daughter, 24, who is married with 2 children. Maria Teresa has worked in INATEC for 17 years in the library. Apart from having only one daughter she has raised 3 nephews and nieces with the help of her mother. She works in the Yolaina district and has to travel every day at 7am and returns at 6pm. Maria Teresa is a responsible, honest and very hard-working woman. This will be her 7th loan with AFODENIC, and she plans to construct a bedroom to have privacy and comfort in her home, which is what she needs. Teresa dreams of providing more for her daughter and three nieces and nephews and to have stable work to help them as much as she can.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a bedroom

loans.name: Doudou

texts.fr: Monsieur Doudou D. est un sculpteur de 42 ans qui habite à Bagdad Guediawaye. Il est sociétaire de la caisse depuis juin 2009. Il est marie et père de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 17 ans. Sa spécialité  est la fabrication d’objets d’art, secteur dans lequel il capitalise une expérience de 12 ans. Auparavant il se procurait des objets d’art qu’il revendait sur le marche. C’est par la suite qu’il s’est rendu compte que la fabrication était plus bénéfique  d’autant plus que la rentabilité  augmente pendant la saison touristique. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs destine a l’achat de bois pour la sculpture. En même  temps Monsieur D.  est gardien dans une société  de la place. Mais son salaire ne lui permet pas de couvrir l’intégralité des dépenses familiales. Par conséquent  le prêt lui permettra d’améliorer la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Mr. Doudou D. is a 42-year-old sculptor who lives in Bagdad Guediawaye.  He has been a member of the credit association since June 2009.  He is married and the father of five children, who range from 2 to 17 years of age.  His specialty is making art objects, a sector in which he capitalizes on twelve years of experience.  In the past, he used to acquire art objects that he resold.  He later realized that making art was more worthwhile, particularly since profitability increases during tourist season. Doudou is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs for buying wood for sculptures.  Meanwhile, he is a security guard at a local company.  But his salary doesn't allow him to cover all of the family expenses.  Consequently, the loan will enable him to do better managing his day-to-day costs. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering his working capital

loans.name: Leph

texts.en:
Mrs. Leph F. is forty-nine years old and a married mother of six teenage children. Two of her children are employed selling toys for a small firm, while the remaining four are going to school and also help her business when they are free. 

Leph F. is a clothes seller who owns a rental kiosk inside the market for selling her clothes. Also, she gets some money from her husband's fishing business. Leph F. has sold nearly all her clothes to buyers and she wants to resupply her stock. She is applying for a loan to order and purchase clothes for her kiosk.

loans.use: To order and purchase clothes for her kiosk.

loans.name: Josefa Betty

texts.es:
Betty es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Betty  es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Betty vende frutas, gaseosas de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad, actividad que realiza los días domingos. Además Betty se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en su casa.
Betty necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuy, gallina.
Betty sueña con tener una pastelería y tener un recreo.
texts.en:
Betty is a member of the LLamkasum Communal Bank, which means “We clothe” in Quechua. Betty is 28, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Betty sells fruit and soft drinks as a street vendor in the city’s wholesale market. She does this every Sunday. Also, Betty raises small animals at her house. Betty needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy guinea pigs and chickens. Betty dreams of having a pastry shop and of having fun.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: complete the purchase of a plot of land

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.en:
Kossiwa was born in 1970. She is married to an electrician and has two children. She is an experienced business woman. 

Since 2003, she has been running a business selling pagnes (traditional Togolese cloth) and other fabrics and dress-making supplies. In addition, she has several employees at her business. She has requested her third loan from WAGES to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and other items for resale

loans.name: Agar

texts.en:
Agar A. is from the village of Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Agar is single. To make a living, Agar owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cows for sale. Agar has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Agar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Agar is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Agar from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, feed & other supplies

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline B. is from the village of Sicayab. She is 45 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Evangeline owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 38 years old. Resty is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Resty owns & operates a business venture in a traditional mining activity called Pamiling . While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling gold dust in the local community. Resty has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Resty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Resty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating their house. Resty is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Resty from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Omar Isidro

texts.es: Omar Isidro tiene 37 años y tiene 2 hijos. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de pintura. Hace más de 12 años, que inicio por su Papa ya que en algunas circunstancias le ayudaba y además lo adquirió como medio de trabajo. Por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con fundación, ya que los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda. El crédito es para la compra de materia prima como pintura, brochas, diluyente entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Omar Isidro is 37 years old and has two children. He works as a painter and decorator. He started this work 12 years ago when he occasionally helped his father and then began to do it as a job. He has been working with Fundación for a long time, as their loans have been a great help to him. The loan is to buy raw materials such as paint, paintbrushes, thinner and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “KUSIKOYLLOR ”,   El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena;   ella tiene 41años de edad, es  conviviente y ella tiene 4 hijos ; La socia se dedica al cuidado de bebes en un wawawasi que traducido al español quiere decir cuna de bebes o casa para bebes;  La socia es natural de Ica y  viene radicando en la ciudad del Cusco desde hace más de 18 años y alternando sus actividades del hogar ella también trabaja cuidando a bebes y niños menores de 4 años de edad.  La socia desea el préstamo para poder ayudar a su conyugue, él es soldador mecánico, él comprara algunas herramientas pequeñas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de algunas herramientas para su conyugue.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elena, 41, is a member of the “KUSIKOYLLOR” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She has a live-in partner and four children. She provides child care in a Wawawasi (government-funded pre-school child care institutions). She is originally from Ica and has been living in Cusco for over 18 years. Aside from her household chores she works providing care to children under four years of age. She wants funding to help out her spouse who is a welder. He will buy some hand tools. She is requesting the loan to help her spouse buy these tools. She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay it in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some tools for her spouse.

loans.name: Kanykei's Group

texts.en: Kanykei A. is the leader of this group. She is thirty-eight and married with three children: her sons are nineteen and thirteen and her daughter is two years old. Her elder son works in Russia and each month he sends her 6,000 soms. Her youngest children are at home. Kanykei sells convenience goods: four years ago she applied for a loan and opened a shop near her house. She started her business with 5,000 soms and now earns 8,000 soms monthly. With the profits from her business, she has been able to buy a microwave and cattle for breeding.
