Kanykei is applying for a loan in order to purchase construction materials to make capital repairs to her house. In the future, she is planning to expand her business and buy a big shop. The other group members are: Gulnara B. is treasurer of the group. She is thirty-five and married with three children: her daughters are thirteen and eight and her son is sixteen. All her children go to school. Her husband works in Russia. Gulnara grows rice and sunflowers, a business she started seven years ago with initial investment of 4,500 soms. She now earns 3,500 soms from farming. With the profits from farming, she was able to build a house and purchase cattle. She has applied for a loan to purchase construction materials in order to make capital repairs to her house. In the future, with the help of the profits from her business, she plans to educate her children and improve the living conditions of her family. Zhanysh B. is forty-nine and married with four children: his son is twelve and his daughters are ten, eighteen and twenty-one years old. His youngest daughter goes to school and his other children work in Russia. His wife is a housewife. Zhanysh farms rice and millet, a business he started five years ago with an initial investment of 6,000 soms. Currently, he earns 4,000 soms monthly. He is planning to start cattle breeding and is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle. In the future, he is planning to buy a car. Sveta A. is forty-seven and married with four children: her sons are twenty-one, sixteen and one year old and her daughter is twenty-one years old. Her elder son works in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan) and sends home each month 5,000 soms to his family. Sveta’s three youngest children are at home. She farms millet, rice and sunflowers with the help of her second son. She started ten years ago with initial investment of 6,000 soms and now earns 5,000 soms monthly. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase fertilizer to continue farming millet, rice and sunflowers. In the future, with the profits from her business, she is planning to purchase a car and a plot of land. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni N. lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (late bothers children).

Zaituni has a business of fish selling. She has been in this business for seven years and she works six days out of every week. Zaituni sells her products at the market, by means of retail.    

Zaituni has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of smoked fish. She also generates additional income through cooked food vending.

The main business challenges for Zaituni include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own  permanent business premises and also to start supplying smoked fish to different market vendors.   

Zaituni lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity but has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and rent.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un padre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside en el sector Insculas del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de cinco años a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura. Por un lado posee un pequeño terreno de cultivo en el que usualmente siembra limón y adicionalmente cría animales menores para venderlos a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con estas actividades el saca adelante a su familia y trata de darles una mejor calidad de vida.

Daniel desea adquirir una motobomba para poder regar su cultivo de manera más eficiente, ya que en la zona el agua para usos agrícolas es escasa y generalmente tienen que valerse de pozos para regar sus cultivos. Durante los últimos meses ha venido ahorrando dinero y ahora se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles con los cuales espera completar el dinero que necesita para lograr su objetivo.

El es una persona emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y poder obtener buenas cosechas para asegurarle el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel, 43, is a father who lives in Insculas, an agricultural region that belongs to the Lambayeque province, which is located more than an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

He has worked for over 5 years in agriculture. On one side, he has a small field in which he usually plants lemons. In addition, raises animals to sell to dealers who often visit the area. With this work, Daniel helps his family get ahead and tries to give them a better quality of life. 

Daniel wants to buy a pump in order to irrigate his crops more efficiently, since water for farming use is scarce in his area and people generally rely on wells for irrigation. Over the last few months, Daniel has been saving money and he is now requesting a loan for 800 soles (USD 300) from Edpyme Alternativa, which he hopes will satisfy the total amount of money he needs to complete his goal. 

Daniel is an entrepreneurial person with a strong desire to succeed. His greatest desire is to continue growing as a business person and to harvest good crops, ensuring his family’s livelihood.

loans.use: Purchase a pump to draw water from wells and irrigate crops

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La  Sra. Sonia Del Carmen P. Rostran es originario del municipio Santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de León donde tiene más de 21 año de laborar  como Auxiliar de Enfermería en el MINSA de esta localidad.
Cuenta con su propia casa de habitación  la que piensa mejorar con el financiamiento otorgado por la institución. 
Esto le permitirá a la clienta   mejorar las  condiciones de su casa de habitación.
texts.en: Señora Sonia Del Carmen P. Rostran comes from the town of Santa Rosa Del Peñón, in the León region, where for more than 21 years she has worked as a nursing assistant in the state hospital. She has her own house, which she is planning to improve with the loan granted by this institution [the field partner CEPRODEL]. This will permit our client to improve the conditions in her home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés, de 46 años, es un padre ejemplar, junto a su esposa Betty, de 37 años, salen adelante para poder ofrecerles una buena educación a sus 3 hijos, ellos viven solos en su casa propia, ubicado en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Como socios, ellos se distribuyen las diversas actividades económicas que realizan. Betty cuida de su pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde todos los días ofrece productos de primera necesidad. Mientras Moisés, se dedica al servicio de trasporte, en la ruta Tarma-Huaricolca. Pero la actividad que más los une a ellos es la agricultura, ahí todos los fines de semana, cuidan de sus cultivos de papa, avena y olluco (productos agrícolas), ya tienen 20 años dedicándose a ello, y juntos hacen posible mandar el dinero necesario a la capital del país, donde estudian sus hijos. Para el futuro desea comprar una casa en la capital, donde planean poner una tienda de comestibles y alquilar cuartos, de esa manera estará cerca de sus hijos. Es el quinto crédito con MFP y, está muy contento, de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde los integrantes son personas unidas y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará 15 sacos de abono, para esparcir sus cultivos de papa, que dentro de algunos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
46-year old Moisés is a model father. He and his 37-year old wife Betty have made a great effort to provide a good education for their three children. They live in their own house located in the rural area of Huaricolca.

Betty takes care of their small grocery store where she sell daily necessities. Moisés works in transportation, on the Tarma-Huaricolca route. However, their greatest bond lies in farming. Every weekend for the last 20 years they have worked in their fields of potatoes, oats, and olluco. This work has made it possible for them to send the necessary money to the capital where their children are studying.

In the future Moisés would like to buy a house in the capital, open a grocery business, and rent out rooms in order to be nearer his children.

This is his fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he is very happy to belong to a community bank where the members are so united and supportive. With the loan he will buy fifteen bags of fertilizer to spread on his potato fields which will be ready for harvesting in a few months.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
Ma. Ana P. is 27 years old, married and supports her family by operating a fishing/fish vending business.  She lives in Malocbaloc, Brgy. Agujo, Daanbantayan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her fishing/fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,800. Ma. Ana is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Ma. Ana aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 33 años, convive con Américo, de 35 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Cristopher de 8 años, y una pequeña mujercita, que muy pronto nacerá, pues Lidia tiene 9 meses de embarazo. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. El Trabajo al que se dedica está hermosa mujer, es la compra y venta de verduras, los que comercializa en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, los días miércoles, viernes y domingos, en un puesto que arrendó en la sección de verduras. Estos días de feria, donde todos los pobladores compran los alimentos de la semana, Lidia, mueve un capital de 3 mil a 4 mil nuevos soles, generando una ganancia del 10%, en los mejores días. Pero como buena administradora de sus ganancias, ella invirtió en la compra de un camión, con el que traslada la producción de los terrenos agrícola a la ciudad y como buena mujer del campo también siembra papa y arveja, cuyo cultivo cuida los fines de semana. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y como miembro activo de su Banco comunal, siente que sus integrantes son personas solidarias y activas. Por ello, con el crédito solicitado, piensa invertir en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arvejas de buena calidad, que sembrará en estos meses.
texts.en: Lidia, age 33, lives with her partner Américo, who is 35. They have 2 children: Cristopher, who is 8 years old, and a new little lady who will very soon be born, as Lidia is 9 months pregnant. They live as a family in a rented house, located in the city of Tarma. This lovely woman dedicates herself to her work of buying and selling vegetables. She rents a stall in the vegetable section of the largest market in the city, on Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays. On these market days, when all the local people buy their food for the week, Lidia turns over 3000-4000 Soles on good days, generating a 10% profit. As a good manager of her funds, she invested in a truck with which she can move the produce from the agricultural lands into the city. As a good country woman, she also sows potatoes and peas, which she cultivates at weekends. This is her second loan with [field partner] MFP, and as an active member of her communal bank, she feels that her fellow members are reliable and active people. Because of this she is planning to invest the loan in the purchase of 2 bags of good-quality pea seeds, which she will plant over the coming months.

loans.use: To buy two bags of pea seeds

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe tiene 53 años, su actividad es el comercio de ganado. Hace más de 25 años que tiene este negocio. Pues siempre le ha gustado ser muy independiente y encontrar una forma de generar ingresos a su hogar. El siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan pues es una persona muy trabajadora. Por sus Padres fue el que el inicio su negocio, ya que ellos decidieron enseñarle como ganarse la vida de una forma honesta. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de ganado. Ya que en esta temporada es que tiene ciertos pedidos.
texts.en: Felipe is 53 years old and is in the livestock business.  He has been in this business for more than 25 years. He has always liked to be very independent and to find ways of making income for his household.  He has always been aware of what his customers are requesting as he is a very hard-working person.  He started his business because his parents decided to teach him how to earn a living in an honest manner.  He would like this loan to buy livestock as he has a certain number of orders to fill during this season.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Olga Argentina

texts.es:
Doña Olga, tiene 62 años D. edad, vive en Guatajiagua departamento D. Morazán, donD. vive con su hija y tres nietos, más su esposo, ella se dedica a la sastrería, dedicándose desD. hace 20 años a esta actividad, su horario es D. 8:00am a 6:00pm, ella aprendió este oficio por que su esposo también es sastre y le enseño.
Dona Olga necesita D. materiales para poder confeccionar vestidos, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra D. telas, zippers, broches, botones e hilos, con esta compra mantendrá un buen número D. materiales a disponibilidad para confeccionar trajes, vestidos, faldas para dama.
Su objetivo es mantener todo lo necesario para que su taller D. sastrería funcione perfectamente, además generar ingresos a través D. los trabajos para pagar este préstamo adecuadamente, y ayudar a sus nietos en sus estudios.
texts.en: Mrs Olga, age 62, lives in Guatajiagua in the department of Morazán, with her daughter and three grandchildren, and her husband. She has worked as a tailor for 20 years. Her schedule is from 8 am to 6 pm. She learned this work because her husband is also a tailor and he taught her. Olda needs materials to be able to make dresses, so she is requesting a loan for the purchase of fabrics, zippers, clasps, buttons and threads. With this purchase she will have a good amount of material available to make suits, dresses, and skirts for women. Her goal is to have everything necessary for her workshop to function perfectly, and to generate income through her work to pay this loan properly, and help her children in their studies.

loans.use: the purchase of fabrics, zippers, clasps, buttons and threads.

loans.name: Wilmer Yohalmo

texts.es:
Wilmer, de 31 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de CD y reparación de equipos de sonido, él vive en casa de su tío con su compañía, sus padres lo dejaron a cargo de don Santos quien ha hecho las veces de un padre, el negocio de Wilmer es la venta de CD de música, audífonos, y a la vez repara aparatos de sonido, su tío le enseño a manejar este negocio desde hace 10 años, el local está ubicado en el parqueo de buses.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de CD audio, Diskman y audífonos, esta compra la hará al mayoreo ya que de esta manera le permite negociar los precios obteniéndolos a menor costo para comercializarlo a buen precio para recibir ganancias.
La aspiración  de él es realizarse como persona, comerciante, y mejorar la condición económica acutal.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 31 years old, and he lives in San Miguel.  He sells CDs and repairs sound equipment.  He lives with his uncle in his uncle’s house.  His parents left him in his uncle’s care.  Santos has been a father to him.

Wilmer’s business is selling CD music, headphones, and repairing sound equipment.  His uncle taught him how to manage this business ten years ago.  His place of business is located at the bus parking lot.

He is requesting a loan to buy audio CDs, Diskman, and headphones.  He will make this purchase wholesale because that will allow him to negotiate the prices and get a lower price.  That way he will sell them for a good price and get earnings.

His aspirations are to fulfill himself as a person and merchant and to improve his current financial circumstances.

loans.use: To buy audio CDs, Diskman, and headphones

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila nació en la ciudad de Ocongate provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco. Actualmente, Luzmila vive en la ciudad donde nació junto con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Luzmila tiene una tienda donde vende productos agro veterinarios como por ejemplo abono que sirve para los terrenos de cultivos y también tiene  un hospedaje con cinco cuartos. La pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana en su domicilio. 
 
Con el próximo préstamo que Luzmila va recibir S/. 2000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar urea.
texts.en:
Luzmila was born in the city of Ocongate in the Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.  She belongs to the “Las Margaritas Ocongate” (The Ocongate Daisies) Communal Bank with the Cusco Arariwa association.

Luzmila currently lives with her husband and their four children in the city where she was born.  (The city of Ocongate is located two hours from the city of Cusco).

Luzmila has a store where she sells farming and veterinary products.  For example, she sells fertilizer to use on fields where crops grow.  She also has a boarding house with five rooms.  You can find her at her house seven days of the week.

Luzmila will receive 2,000 soles with her next loan.  She would like to use the money from the loan to buy urea.

loans.use: To buy urea

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: Porfirio es socio propietario en el  sindicato de minibases Señor de San Roque;  el crédito  lo necesita para la compra de llantas  y el mantenimiento de motor de su vehiculo. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso que tiene. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona de San Roque de la ciudad de El Alto. Es primer crédito con Impro. Porfirio es soltero y no tiene hijos.
texts.en: Porfirio owns a vehicle and belongs to the mini-bus syndicate called "Señor de San Roque."  He needs this loan to buy tires and to do maintenance work on his vehicle.  This business is the only source of income that he has.  He lives in his own home, located in the San Roque neighborhood in the city of El Alto.  This is his first loan with IMPRO.  Porfirio is single and does not have children.

loans.use: To buy tires and do maintenance work on the motor of his vehicle, which he uses to provide public passenger transportation services.

loans.name: Jorge Egas

texts.es:
Jorge de 43 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene un negocio de cerrajería. Comenzó aprender como ayudante en un taller desde los 18 años. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que tiene mucha clientela porque lo conocen por el sector donde vive como el cerrajero. Para seguir con su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo hierro y así hacer mas puertas, ventanas, ensamblados etc. En el futuro quiere tener mejor ubicado el local.
texts.en:
Jorge is 43 years old and he is a hardworking man. He has a blacksmith business. He started out learning as an apprentice in a shop when he was 18 years old. 

He has great aspirations for his business especially because he has many clients that know him as a blacksmith in the sector where he lives. With his loan he wants to purchase steel to make doors, windows, and assemblages in order to keep up his business. In the future he wants to have his business in a better location.

loans.use: To purchase steel.

loans.name: Dam

texts.en: Dam K. is a 53-year-old widowed villager who lives in the city of Phnom Penh. She is the mother of four children, two of whom are married. Her husband died of senility years ago. Dam K. has worked as a rice farmer since she was single. She always grows her rice crop on her existing rented farmland. Her family’s living conditions are not so good because their walls are broken due to strong winds. To solve the problem, Dam K. has requested a loan to buy some zinc for building new walls.

loans.use: to buy some zinc for building new walls

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim L. (shown in the photo with her loom) and her husband, Mr. Sophorn Hean, have been married since 1988. They have two sons and two daughters. One of the children weaves silk at home and the others are in school. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Lim is a silk weaver. Her husband is a wooden house builder. They are also rice farmers. Lim hopes to continue her silk weaving business because it is a traditional professional business. Therefore, she is asking for another loan of $500 to purchase silk materials.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Akala Ya Wunie Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim C. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Ibrahim was born in Makeni city, about 42 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has 4 children – one in primary school and three in secondary school. Ibrahim sells clothes and has been running this business for 23 years. 

With the help of this loan, Ibrahim and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Ibrahim will use his share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to clothes at wholesale to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes at wholesale to add to his business

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DANAYA sont tous des femmes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident au quartier Massablacoura de la ville de BOUGOUNI troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles se sont connues par des relations de mariage. Avec le souci d’acheter assez de balles de friperie afin d’augmenter leur stock, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce d’articles divers et d’habillements avec Mariam S.. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe et les trois précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt ces Mariam S. compte acheter 2 douzaines de maillots pour petits garçons, 20 complets de robe  et beaucoup d’autres habillements pour les nouveau nés, sur le marché de Bamako pour ensuite les revendre en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes dans le marché de BOUGOUNI. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes comptent chacune obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour surmonter les frais d’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the DANAYA group are all married women who average 30 years of age and five children each. They live in nuclear families with their children and spouses. These reside in the district of Massablacoura, in BOUGOUNI (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of marriage. 

These sellers of clothes and various merchandise decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to stock up on bales of used clothing. They are on their fourth group loan. The three previous loans were correctly repaid.

Mariam S. plans to use her loan to buy two dozen shirts for small boys, twenty dress suits, and lots of clothing for newborns. She gets her merchandise at the Bamako market for resale at retail at the Bougouni market, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of both men and women.

With this loan, the group members expect to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA each, which they will use to pay for the children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Virgen De La Puerta Group

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Grupo “Virgen D. L. Puerta”, tiene su negocio D. internet, también se dedica a L. compra y venta D. granos al por mayor y menor, Vilma vive con su esposo, sus hijos ya son mayores D. edad quienes ya son independientes, el préstamo lo invertirá para L. compra D. una computadora con L. cual ampliara los servicios D. internet que brinda.

(*) L. Foto pequeña corresponD. a L. Sra. Ruth Nancy
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the "Virgen D. L. Puerta" Group.  She has an Internet services business and also buys and sells wholesale grains.  Vilma lives with her husband.  Her adult children are independent.  The loan will be used to buy a computer in order to expand her Internet services.

(*) The small photograph is of Mrs. Ruth Nancy

loans.use: To buy a computer for Internet services.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is one of the CCT* community's partners with a passion for technology. This shows in his business, which is a computer shop. At 32 and having graduated from college, Albert is doing well making his business grow. He currently lives with Judalyn and their son in Tanza, Cavite. 

Albert makes it a point that people who have the same passion as he should have easy access to the Internet. Thus, every day he opens his shop for online users in his community, whose ages range from elementary students to middle class working professionals. His shop is located adjacent to his house so that he can manage it more efficiently.  Albert has been successful for four years now even without the aid of any employees. Monthly, he earns an estimated net income of Php 9,200.

To help him improve his business and continuously feed his passion, Albert solicits the help of CCT by applying for a loan worth Php 11,000. He intends to use this loan to purchase another computer for his shop. With this fund, he can also be equipped with ready money to purchase any necessary spare parts for his existing set of computers. According to him, this loan will definitely increase his profits and lead to the creation of an additional branch. 

Certainly there are times when trouble occurs, not just with his computers but also with his health. These are the struggles he currently faces. Nevertheless, Albert fights these struggles head on, knowing that his faith in the Lord and his undying passion will carry him through. It is his desire to have a healthy life and a strong family relationship. He also aims to have his own house as he strives to support his son all the way to college.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy a computer

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia Del Carmen tiene 49 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de calzado. Tiene más de 2 años en este negocio, Lucia es profesora de primaria con mucho sacrificio inicio este negocio, ya que el salario que obtiene es muy bajo y necesita generar ingresos para su familia, lo que resulta muy favorable es que su trabajo es a medo tiempo en lo que ella aprovecha y sale a ofrecer sus diferentes productos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de zapatillas, zapatos deportivos, sandalias, botas y chinelas playeras.
texts.en: Lucia Del Carmen is 49 years old.  Her activity is footwear retailing.  She’s been in this business for over two years.  Lucia is an elementary school teacher and she started this business with much sacrifice because the salary she earns is very low and she needs to generate income for her family.  What is advantageous for her is that her job is half day so when she gets off work she can go out to sell her various products.  The reason for the loan is to buy slippers, athletic shoes, sandals, boots and flip-flops for the beach.

loans.use: to buy sandals, athletic shoes, slippers, boots and beach flip-flops.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. Fatuma has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. Fatuma sells her products from home by means of retail. Fatuma has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of  charcoal. The main business challenges for Fatuma are transportation and defaulters. Her goal is to expand the business so that she can build rental rooms. Fatuma lives in a house that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Shetu Ndjrumbomenyi

texts.en:
Shetu Ndjrumbomenyi was born in 1973. She lives in Church Center Bamenda, Northwest region in Cameroon. She is separated with 3 children. With the difficulties she had in the matrimonial home she was unable to cope with the situation. Her parents died when she was still young. Shetu Ndjrumbomenyi was unable to continue her education. Her last resort was to get married, which could provide a solution to her problem, but later turned out to be a negative. Since she separated from her husband, the husband has never supported her nor provided needs for the children so she is the sole person that provides for the basic needs for herself and the children. 

Before joining GHAPE, she was roasting fish, but without capital. She usually borrows and sells before paying, which earns her little income. Given a new loan, Shetu Ndjrumbomenyi plans to continue her business and even expand. She has a good site with more customers who are ready to buy. The profit she will obtain from the loan will enable her to pay her children's school fees and also provide the family with basic needs. 

Shetu Ndjrumbomenyi prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the interest rate and repayment modalities offered. It is better when compared to other financial houses found in her locality. This, along with the training GHAPE gives its clients before a loan is granted, has also encouraged her to join GHAPE.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: purchase fish

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
Benigno nació en el distrito de Echarate y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. La ciudad de Echarate es la ciudad capital del distrito de Echarate de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.). 

Benigno tiene 23 años y es una persona responsable es padre de un hijo y le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Nueva Luz de Echarate” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
 
Él es chofer y trabajan en la ruta Cusco - Puerto Maldonado y viceversa. Ya son seis años que se dedica al servicio y le está yendo muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo. 

Benigno ha comprado un terreno pero a crédito en la ciudad de Echarate donde va cultivar cacao, fruta y otras cosas más. El accede al crédito para pagar las últimas cuotas que le falta.
texts.en:
Benigno was born in the district of Echarate, and lives in the city where he was born.  Echarate is the capital of the district of Echarate, province of La Convención, and a large commercial center for the Lares and La Convención valleys.  Major activities are production in coca, coffee, cacao, and fruit trees.

Benigno is 23 years old, responsible, and father of one child.  He was invited to join the Nueva Luz de Echarate communal bank, of the Arariwa Association.

He is a driver working the Cuzco-Puerto Maldonado route.  He has been providing this service for six years, and things are going well for him because he does his work conscientiously.

Benigno has purchased a piece of land, on credit, in Echarate, where he plans to grow cacao, fruit, and other things.  He is asking for a loan in order to pay the remaining installments.

loans.use: pay the last installments on his land.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora. María eso socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi, esta parroquia es muy visita por ser el balcón de la ciudad de donde se puede admirar gran parte de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

La Señora. María tiene 50 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, 6 son casados e independiente, sus tres hijos solteros son de 18, 15 y 12 años de edad, su hija de 18 años estudia en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
Doña María se dedica al bordado, esta actividad la desempeña hace 12 años, trabaja en su casa todos los días y sin un horario fijo, este trabajo lo aprendió gracias a cursos que les dieron en su comunidad. 

En el banco comunal es socia fundadora, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela, e hilos para continuar con el negocio del bordado.

 Su meta es de ampliar mucho más su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Mujer y Fortaleza” (Women and Strength) Communal Bank.  She lives in the outskirts of the Turi parish.  This parish is visited a lot because it is the balcony of the city where you are able to admire a large part of Cuenca.  Its people devote themselves to commerce, raising animals, and farming.  They also work in the city in different business activities.

María, age 50, is married and has nine children.  Six are married and independent.  Her three single sons are 18, 15, and 12.  Her daughter, age 18, attends the university.  Her last two children go to a school in the city.  Her husband is a farmer.  The house they live in is their own.

María devotes herself to embroidery, and she has been doing this for 12 years.  She works in her house every day without a fixed schedule.  She learned this work thanks to courses that were given in her community.

She is a founding member of her communal bank.  She will use the loan to buy fabric and thread in order to continue with her embroidery business.

Her goal is to expand her business a lot.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a married man. He runs a vehicle repair business in Mombasa. He has been in this business for ten years now. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenges he faces are financial constraints. He is requesting this loan of KES 30,000 to buy spare auto parts to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He describes himself as a friendly person.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle repair business

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is 55 years old and a mother of four children: three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is married and operates a grocery store in the market where he sells daily-use items such as cooking oil, lentils, spices etc. His behavior with his customers is very good and his prices are also very reasonable; that’s why he has a good number of customers who purchase groceries from him regularly. Her other children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Khalida stays at home and does her household responsibilities.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her son wants to expand his grocery store business. With the loan, he will purchase groceries in bulk quantity which will allow him to fill the needs of his clients and earn more profits. He has been operating his business for the past three years and Khalida is hopeful that the loan will help him expanding his business and increase his profits. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Merriapie

texts.en:
Merriapie is 32 years old, married and has three children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past five years.

He has successfully repaid his previous loan from KADET and has now applied for a second loan to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers, and buy more animals. 

He hopes to make a profit that will help in expanding his farm and educating his children. He dreams of having a prosperous farming business and being able to provide better lives for his children.

loans.use: purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina is a 34-year-old businesswoman and married mother of four children, all of whom attend school.  For the last three years, Edina has been running a tailoring business to earn a living. She also relies on her husband's support in the business.  In the next five years, Edina wants to expand her business and is now requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy more fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar lives happily with his family. He is 46 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. His wife is a housekeeper. Oscar is a farmer, planting corn in the Philippines. To quickly provide their daily needs and pay the school fees for his children, Oscar and his wife engage themselves in planting and harvesting various types of vegetables in some part of their field, and sell in the public market to gain profit.
   
Oscar also engages in a hog raising business. With the profit earned from his farming business, he can provide his hogs with feed. Due to a typhoon encountered by the farmers, his crops were destroyed. Now, Oscar is requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 33 years old and lives in Napisik, Sulipat, Calamba.  She is married and has one child. 

To earn a living, Corazon has a quarrying business. She has had this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 6500.  She has requested a loan of  PHP 30,000 to purchase housing materials to complete her house. Corazon has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: buy building materials

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena con 51 años de edad, es una mujer soltera e independiente, desde hace 6 años tomó un negocio de familia en el municipio de La Ceja – Antioquia, tras la jubilación de su padre, en su negocio María Elena, ofrece gran ayuda a las personas de su municipio, ya que les brinda asesoría en como afiliarse a un seguro medico, les ayuda con los tramites para sacar licencias de conducción, contratos de compra y venta entre otros tramites más.

Actualmente María Elena, desea comprar una impresora para ofrecer nuevos servicios que volverán su negocio mas competitivo en el mercado, de modo que genere mayores ingresos para poder tener y dar a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida, es por esto que actualmente solicita un crédito, porque quiere seguir mejorando su negocio y sostenerse para seguir siendo una persona independiente y ayudar a su comunidad.
texts.en:
María Elena, 51, is a single and independent woman.  Six years ago she took over a family business in the town of La Ceja, Antioquia, following her father's retirement.

In her business María Elena is a big help to the people of her town, since she offers them advice on how to get health insurance, she helps them with the procedures for getting a driver's license, sales contracts, and other procedures.

Currently María Elena wants to buy a printer to offer new services that will make her business more competitive in the market and generate greater income to be able to give her parents a better quality of life.  For this reason she is currently requesting a loan, because she wants to continue improving her business and support herself, to continue being an independent person and help her community.

loans.use: to buy a printer to offer new services in her microenterprise

loans.name: Nohad

texts.en:
Nohad (standing, face hidden) is a 30-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child, who attends school. 

He has owned a barbershop since 2003.  In parallel, he has also worked as a driver for a locA. company since 2006 in order to generate a higher income to support his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase shaving tools and products. 

He plans to expand his business and focus on being a barber.  In the future, he plans to hire a full-time employee.

loans.use: to purchase shaving tools and products.

loans.name: Angaza A Farmers Group

texts.en:
Chenge is the facilitator of the Angaza A Farmers group. Chenge and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Chenge takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Chenge had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Chenge was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Chenge and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Chenge will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Angaza A Farmers group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Chenge is pictured with his group members. The field officer is on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 22 years old, married, and the father of one child. He is a fruit vendor and has been in the business for the last six years with a monthly profit of around KES 7,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to add stock for resale, such as bananas, mangoes and pineapples.

He will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for his child. In future, Julius hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To add to his stock of fruits, like bananas, mangoes and pineapples.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a married woman with four children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Adelaida earns a living by selling Ready-To-Wear clothes, like mens and ladies shirts and jeans. She also sells bags. 

Adelaida earns about 10000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as shirts, jeans and slippers. 

Adelaida hopes this loan will help grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shirts, jeans and slippers

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes works hard to earn a living. She is happily married to the supervisor of Yakult. The couple are blessed with two adult children. Both of them have settled in marriage and are separately living with their own families.

Mercedes owns her variety store, and she has had this business for three years. She is aiming to increase her product offering to satisfy her customer demand, but her income is insufficient. In regards to this, she is asking for a loan amount of 50,000 Philippines pesos. She will be using her requested loan to buy merchandise for her retail store. She believes that her sacrifices will lead her to reach her goal, which is to increase her profit and save some for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail store.

loans.name: Jose Hudil

texts.es:
José, es ganadero y agricultor, tiene 38 años de edad, vive con sus hijos de 16 y 14 años, también le acompaña su suegra, él se dedica a atender las labores ganaderas y agrícolas, sembrando maíz y frijol, tiene 15 años de experiencia y lo aprendió por su padre.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de 3 reces, ya que se le presenta la oportunidad de aumentar el número de reces en el terreno, mejorando su capacidad ganadera.
La aspiración de José es que sus hijos crezcan, se desarrollen, aprendan a trabajar para que se defiendan en un futuro.
texts.en:
José is a rancher and farmer. He is 38 years old and lives with his children of 16 and 14 years, as well as with his mother-in-law. His job is to take care of stockbreeding and agricultural tasks, planting corn and beans. He has 15 years of experience and learned it from his father. 

Right now he is asking for a loan for the purchase of three heads of cattle, since he has been presented with the chance to increase the number of animals on the land, improving his ranching ability. 

José's goal is that his children grow, develop, and learn to work so they can take care of themselves in the future.

loans.use: to buy three heads of cattle.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is a 48 year-old married woman with two daughters. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband, a driver. Thu runs a shop where she sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Thu is requesting a 15,000,000 VND loan from CEP to buy more products, such as beverages, instant noodles, rice, cookies and milk to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers.

Thu hopes her business will run smoothly and that she can earn extra income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 46 years old and lives in the town of Seeta, in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, who are all currently in school. For the past seven years, Fred has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells mostly foodstuffs, like sugar, milk and bread. 

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items to sell at the store, such as milk, soup and bread. This purchase will help Fred to generate greater profits, so he can pay his children's school fees and meet their basic needs. Fred hopes that in the future, he will be able to become a very powerful businessman in the whole town. 

Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell at the store, such as milk, soup and bread

loans.name: Geremias

texts.pt:
O Sr. Jeremias de 42 anos de idade casado e pai de 8 filho todos estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário e secundário. Ele é negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade a mais de 20 anos, actividade que esta a explorar junto com sua esposa no seu estabelecimento comercial.
Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade (feijão verde, amendoim, arroz, tomate e mais diversos produtos) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condições de habitação .

loans.use: para comprar feijão verde, amendoim, arroz, tomate e mais diversos produtos) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 11 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, anteriormente solicito un credito para la compra de materia prima, en esta ocasion esta solicitando un credito para mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y encementando el piso, pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando otro credito para la compra de laminas, polines, cemneto, arena y pago de mano de obra y asi tener una vivienda mas segura y comoda.

loans.use: compra de laminas, polines, cemneto, arena y pago de mano de obra

loans.name: Bertha Nilda

texts.en:
Bertha is a very active woman, she is married and her husband works as operator in a company, they have a kid of 11 year-old, that studies at the primary school. She decided to start her \"tamales\" elaboration business, since the expenses of her family could not be covered all with her husband\'s salary and seeing that every day the necessities are bigger; she decided to start a business that allowed her to assist to her family because that is her principal priority. So she began on the elaborating and selling \"tamales\" among her well-known people, which little by little are increasing their demand. She does not have employers, so that at the same time she makes and sells them.

The necessity of Bertha is to be able to have the raw material to cover her demand increment that presents with the season change with the traditional Christmas parties, the demand for her products are increasing, for this reason she requests a loan for the quantity of $250 USD to be paid in a term of 3-6 months. She hopes with people\'s support, she wants make grow her business.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Bertha es una mujer muy activa, ella esta casada y su esposo trabaja como operador en una empresa, tienen un hijo de 11 años que estudia la escuela primaria. Ella decidió iniciar su negocio de elaboración de tamales, ya que los gastos de su familia no podían ser cubiertos con el ingreso de su esposo y viendo que cada día las necesidades eran mayores decidió iniciar un negocio que le permitiera a su vez atender a su familia que es su prioridad. Fue así como empezó elaborando y vendiendo tamales entre sus conocidos, los cuales poco a poco fueron demandándole mas. Ella no tiene empleados así que se encarga de la producción y venta de los mismos.

La necesidad de Bertha es poder contar con las materias primas suficientes para hacer frente al incremento en la demanda que se presenta con el cambio de temporada, ya que con las tradicionales fiestas navideñas la demanda por sus productos se incrementa, por esto ella solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 USD para pagarse en un plazo de 3-6 meses. Ella espera que con el apoyo de la gente pueda hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Macario

texts.en:
"I have had my own mechanic's shop for 2 years. There is no one who has the equipment to vulcanise rubber in this area, so I'd like to buy this equipment , which would allow me to offer my clients tire changing and tire repair. Offering this service would bring me more clients. I am applying for a loan for $1200.00 dollars to buy vulcanization equipment."

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo mi taller mecánico desde hace 2 años, por ese sector no hay una vulcanizadora y a mi me gustaría comprar aparatos que me permitan también darles a mis clientes ese servicio de cambio y reparación de llantas ya que así mi taller tendrá más clientela. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para comprar equipo para vulcanizar."

loans.use: Buy vulcanization equipment to offer tire changing and tire repair

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 32 years old, and the mother of 3. Her husband works in a paint factory and helps her with the business in whatever way he can. Her store has allowed her to make significant improvements to her home, which only a couple of years ago, was still made out of wood.

Irene has a general store where she sells clothes, school supplies, decorations and snacks. She has had this business for about 6 years. Prior to this she was a door to door clothing saleswoman. She set up her business with the intention of continuing her clothes sales, but she found that other items were also profitable and sold faster. She buys most of her products in bulk. This allows her to also travel to rural towns and sell in large quantities to micro businesses there. She is seeking her second loan in order to continue investing in wholesale quantities in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: Invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Durasan

texts.ru:
Durasan Q. was born in 1961. He is married and has 4 children. He has been a builder for 20 years. His tools are too old to produce quality job. Durasan applied for this Normicro loan to finance the purchase of new tools.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Касумов Дурасан.1961 года рождения. Женат, имеет четверо детей. Двадцать лет подряд работает мастером. Со старым инструментом работа не дают хорошего результата. Дурасан по этому обратилься вНормикро Аксуниского филиала. Взяв кредит он поменяеть свой инструмент.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Arona

texts.fr:
Le niveau actuel de couverture des besoins en éducation pour la catégorie classée  dans la petite enfance est très faible dans la commune d’arrondissement de thiaroye sur mer. L’Etat devant l’immensité de la tâche ne semble pas être en mesure de fournir partout où le besoin se fait sentir un cadre adéquat pour l’épanouissement de cette catégorie. Partant de ce fait, le secteur a besoin d’initiatives venant des collectivités de base qui doivent être conscientes de la nécessité de participer à leur prise en charge. C’est pourquoi  initiative de thiaroye sur mer pour la solidarité et le développement (ITSD)_qui ambitionne de participer au relèvement de l’offre d’éducation préscolaire et de participer à l’amélioration de la qualité de l’éducation préscolaire a ouvert une école communautaire qui est subventionnée par les membres de la dite association. C’est donc dans un souci d’atteinte de ses objectifs que venons solliciter ce prêt au près de vous. Ce prêt nous permettra de renforcer les activités dans ce domaine.les eleves font une participation financiere mensuelle qui nous permettra entre autre activité de remboursé ce prêt.

Note: there are eleven members in this group and the photograph features the Group Leader.

loans.use: Remforcement en besoins de fonctionnement d'une école maternelle

loans.name: Kaltoum

texts.en: Kaltoum is a 39 year old woman who lives in the Beirut suburbs in the region of Borj el Barajneh. Kaltoum owns a grocery shop which is her only source of income. Kaltoum suffers from a physical handicap and is striving to support herself through her business. She needs $400 to purchase enough merchandise for her store. Kaltoum is a remarkable woman who is determined to stay independent.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
Juana Maria Jiron sells bicycle parts in the Ivan Montenegro market in the city of Managua. She started this business with the small amount of money that she had been saving all her life.

She is mother of 3 kids, one of whom is a young girl in High School, and this is why she started her business. Before she was just a housewife, but due to their difficult financial situation and her realization that her kids needed support, she decided to start selling bicycle parts in a stall in the market.

Mrs Jiron has had 10 loans with Ceprodel, and she has invested them wisely in the buying of bicycle parts to sell. It is necessary to make it clear that she has been faithful to the repayments despite her difficult economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Juana Maria J. es una dama que se dedica a la venta de repuestos de bicicletas en el mercado Ivan Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua. Su negocio lo inició con un pequeño capital producto de sus ahorros propios obtenido a lo largo de su vida.

Es madre de 3 hijos, entre ellos una jovencita que cursa la secundaria, por este motivo es que ella inicia este negocio ya que anteriormente se dedicaba solamente como ama de casa pero al contemplar la difícil situación económica que atraviesa y consiente de que sus hijos necesitan su apoyo, decide comercializar los repuestos de bicicletas en un local del mercado.

Actualmente, la señora J. ha realizado 10 préstamos en Ceprodel habiéndolos invertido sabiamente en la compra de repuestos para su respectiva comercialización. Es necesario destacar que a pesar de su difícil situación económica se ha mantenido fiel en el cumplimiento de estos créditos en tiempo y forma.

loans.use: To buy bicycle parts/Compra de repuestos para las bicicletas

loans.name: Maria Del Rayo

texts.es:
Ms. F. has owned her small grocery store for over two years. This business is her family's source of income. She currently needs to purchase more merchandise and to make some improvements to her store so that she can sell dairy products and cold cuts. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,200.00 to purchase merchandise and to make improvements to her store.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maria tiene ya más de 2 años con su tienda de abarrotes. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia. Me esta haciendo falta mas mercancía y mejorar el local para vender también lácteos y carnes frías. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. para la comprar de mercancía y mejorar el negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and to make improvements to her store.

loans.name: Ni Komang Mahyuni

texts.id:
Ni Komang Mahayani was originally from Jawa but nowadays a Balinese because she married a Balinese; I Komang Sukadana is her current husband. Ni Komang Mahayani is very capable in making all sorts of cakes and traditional sweets, usually used in Hindu community for religious worship. This work actually was her hobby but usually bring about income for Mahayani and assist in alleviating her husband’s burden that works as a bus driver. Each day Mahayani makes sweets, which will be sold in the market and also fulfill orders from the neighborhood from already long standing customers. If a significant day, then sales of sweets will be more. Capital needed for buying raw ingredients of Rp. 500.000.- (USD55). Income generated amounting to Rp. 50.000.- (USD6) daily. This income is used for fulfilling living expenses as well as her 2 children’s education in grade 7 and 3. The house Mahayani reside in currently was self-built on ancestor’s land; of a semi-permanent nature. Her hope with the loan attained from Dinari, she will use to purchase baking equipment like blender, mixer and a variety of molds. With these appliances, Mahayani can optimize and increase output.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Komang Mahayani awalnya adalah orang Jawa asli dan kini menjadi orang Bali karena menikah dengan orang Bali, yaitu I Komang Sukadana yang menjadi suaminya sekarang. Ni Komang Mahayani sangat pandai membuat aneka kue dan jajan tradisional yang biasanya dipergunakan untuk sarana persembahyangan umat Hindu. Pekerjaan ini memang merupakan hobinya dan bisa mendatangkan keuntungan bagi Mahayani dan bisa membantu meringankan beban suaminya yang bekerja sebagai sopir bus. Setiap hari Mahayani membuat jajan yang dijual dipasar dan juga merupakan pesanan para tetangganya yang sudah menjadi langganannya sejak lama. Kalau hari raya, maka penjualan jajannya semakin banyak Modal yang diperlukan untuk membeli bahan baku sampai Rp. 500.000.- Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp. 50.000.- perhari. Keuntungannya ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga untuk pendidikan kedua anaknya yang duduk di kelas 1 SMP dan kelas 3 SD. Rumah yang ditempati oleh Mahayani saat ini dibangun sendiri diatas tanah orang tuanya dengan bangunan yang semi permanen. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari, ia akan perguanakan untuk membeli alat – alat untuk membuat kue seperti blender, mixer dan aneka jenis cetakan. Dengan kelengkapan itu, Mahayani optimis bisa meningkatkan usahanya.

loans.use: Purchase appliances to support preduction like blender, mixer and variety of molds (Membeli peralatan yang dapat menunjang produktifitasnya seperti blender, mixer dan aneka jenis cetakan)

loans.name: Yolanda Del Rio Group

texts.es:
La asociación Yolanda del Río del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, debe su nombre al cariño  respeto y admiración que las 21 socias que componen la misma, le tienen a la responsable de dicho Centro.

En su mayoría, las socias se ven obligadas a deambular ofertando sus productos, por las principales ferias y mercados de sus zonas a raíz de la carencia de puestos de venta fijos. Ropa nueva y usada, electrodomésticos, repostería y otros, son pequeños negocios que les representa el sustento para sus familias, principalmente aquellas que son casadas, ya que de todo el grupo solo un 10% son solteras.

Actualmente ellas precisan de capital para invertir en sus negocios, con el objetivo de generar los recursos suficientes para hacer frente a la difícil situación que atraviesa el país, con el único objetivo de sustentar a sus familias.

loans.use: NECESITAN CAPITAL PARA INVERTIR EN SUS NEGOCIOS

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Upon marrying, Victoria left her husband, leaving behind her job as a company cashier. In this way she came to seek other work and began selling in a market in a traveling position. In the beginning, she sold clothes and fruits for a year each. After purchasing her own spot in the market, she changed her business to condiment sales. It has been eight years that she has been in the same line of work, selling in the mornings and evenings.

Victoria has been separated from her husband for more than five years. She lives alone with her two grown children, who have families of their own. She is saving the earnings from her work to one day apply toward opening a hairdressing salon and a bazaar in her home with her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Al casarse Victoria se fue vivir con su esposo y abandono el trabajo de cajera que tenia en una empresa. Fue así que decidió buscar otro trabajo y empezó a vender en el mercado en un puesto ambulante. Al inicio ella vendió ropa y frutas por un año cada uno. Pero luego de comprarse un puesto propio en el mercado, cambio su negocio a uno de venta de especería (condimentos). Hoy ya lleva ocho años dedicándose a esto vendiendo por las mañanas y por las tardes.

Hace mas de cinco años que vive separada de su esposo. Actualmente vive solo con sus dos hijos que ya son mayores y con su propia familia cada uno. Las ganancias de su trabajo por ahora las esta ahorrando, pues más adelante piensa poner con su hija una peluquería y un bazar en su casa.

loans.use: Establishment of a bazaar-hairdressing salon

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina I. is forty-six years old.  She is a widow with four children.  She lives in Edo State, Nigeria.  She owns a poultry farm were she rears chickens and hens.  She does this for commercial purposes (i.e. selling them to people in her community).  She has been in business since 2004.  She needs the loan amount of  $875 to buy more chicks to rear, and also to buy bird feed.

loans.use: To buy  more bird feed and chicks to sell.

loans.name: Sirojidin

texts.en: E. Sirojidin is 28 years old. He is married with two children. He loves his children very much and doesall the best in order to make them happy and give them a good education. Sirojidin is running the farm. He has worked in agriculture for ten years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. His father and brothers help him with the business. He is growing wheat, rice, and different kinds of seasonal vegetables. The business is stable and generates the main source of income for the family. However, this business requires lots of work and capital. In the current season, Sirojidin wants to grow wheat, potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Thus, Sirojidin needs to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer, and he requests 1000 Somoni ($300 US) for the term of 6 months. Sirojidin thanks those who support him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Mrs. Ung S., 28, is married and has two children. She works weaving baskets and other items made from bamboo, making about $2/day of net income. Her husband operates a motor-taxi business transporting passengers to different locations and typically earns around $2 to $3 each day. To meet her growing customer demands and expand the quantity of her products, Mrs. Ung S. has requested a loan to purchase more bamboo.( Her mother who lives with her is pictured because Mrs. Ung S. was not available)

loans.use: To purchase more bamboo to produce more baskets

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 18, 16, 13 y10 años, quienes le ayudan en su trabajo.
Desde muy pequeña estuvo relacionada con la crianza de animales, sus padres fueron unos grandes ganaderos de su localidad, desde que contrajo matrimonio Teofila vio en la ganadería su mejor opción de ganarse la vida, aproximadamente ya son 25 años que está plenamente  dedicada a sus animales, que son unas preciosas llamas, sale a pastear todas las mañanas por los campos de los alrededores de su comunidad, siendo esto lo que más le agrada de su trabajo, aunque lo más difícil es poder alimentarlas en tiempos de invierno, ya que el frío perjudica su normal actividad.
Teofila basa su esfuerzo en sus cuatro hijos, quienes son su mayor estímulo de seguir trabajando.
Con le dinero que solicita desea incrementar su ganado, adquirir un par de llamas adicionales para poder garantizar el bienestar de  su familia.
texts.en:
Teofila is 48 years of age, and she lives with her husband and 4 children, who are 18, 16, 13 and 10 years old and help her with her business.

Since she was very young, she was related to the breeding of animals. Her parents were great livestock breeders in their area; and since she got married, Teofila saw in livestock breeding her best of option for making a living. It has been approximately 25 years that she has been fully dedicated to her animals, which are beautiful llamas. She goes out to graze them every morning to the surrounding pastures in her community, which to her is the part of her work she most enjoys. The most difficult thing is to feed them during the winter, since the cold weather affects her normal routine.

With the loan she is requesting, she would like to increase the size of her livestock by acquiring a couple of additional llamas to guarantee the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two more llamas to increase the size of her livestock.

loans.name: Asoono

texts.en: Asoono T., 42, is married with 3 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells to the general public and villagers 2 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Asoono's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase farming supplies like weed killer, fertilizer, chain link wires and other farming materials. Her husband and children will help out in the farming business.

loans.use: Purchase weedkiller, fertilizer and chain link wires for fencing

loans.name: Mgeni's Group

texts.en:
Mgeni A. B. has been selling firewood in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She works from 8:00am to 4:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $80 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can expand her inventory, sell more firewood, and increase her profit.

Mgeni is 30 years old, divorced, and has four children, aged 3, 6, 12, and 14. She also cares for her two elderly parents.

Mgeni will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Sina, Mwanapili, Mwajuma, Tatu, and Miza. Each has her own small shop in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her shop.

loans.name: Lon's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan for three group members. The borrowers all live in Beung Melea Commune in Siem Reap Province.

The first group member is Mrs. Lon L., 49, who makes a living selling Kmer noodles in Beung Melea Village. She currently earns approximately $2 per day. She has six children: four are in school, and two are married and farmers. Her husband, Mr. Cheum Chea, 50, is a rice farmer who also grows vegetables such as cabbages and water lillies to sell. Lon is requesting a $200 loan to buy groceries and piglets.

The group also includes Mrs. Kheng H., 32, who is local rice farmer. She is requesting a loan of $200 to buy a cart for transporting rice. The last member is Mrs. Sky S., 43, who is a farmer. She is applying for a $200 loan to purchase piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy groceries and piglets

loans.name: Amavi Kafui

texts.fr:
Née à Kouma Adame, une des villes de Togo, Madame A. est une revendeuse de charbon à son domicile à Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Elle a commencé ce travail depuis dix ans, donc elle est bien expérimentée, mais elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES.  Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permit d’acheter du charbon afin de reconstituer son stock.
Madame A. est une femme âgée de 54 ans.  Elle est marie avec un Ingénieur de Jeunesse et Sports et ils ont 2 enfants qu’ils soutiennent.
texts.en:
Born in Kouma Adame, a city in Togo, Ms. A. is a retailer of charcoal out of her home in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She started this work 10 years ago, so she has a lot of experience, though she has never been a recipient of a WAGES loan. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy charcoal to replenish her stock. Ms. A. is a 54-year-old woman married to a youth & sports engineer. They have two children to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Vorng

texts.en: Mr. Vorng T. was born in 1947 and his wife's name is Seak That, 56. They live together in Banteay Meanchey Province. They make a living by selling dried fish, which they purchase from fisherman and market sellers, slicing and drying them and sell their died fish to regular customers and villagers. They currently earn income of approximately $10 per day, and started the business in 2005. The couple has two children, both of whom are married and employed: the first child is working on the staff of a train station and the second child is a grocery seller. To grow the business and earn additional income, Vorng T. is applying for a loan to buy more fish to make dried fish and sell. T.'s wife is pictured, because he was not available.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi: Chị Vũ Thị T. năm nay 45 tuổi,  Năm 2000 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán rau. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi  cả hai vợ chồng chị  T. đều đang chăn nuôi bò, đây cũng là  công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị  với thu nhập 1.5000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị T.  mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm bò về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vu Thi T. is 45 years old. In 2000, she joined TYM Fund to borrow funds for investing in raising pigs and selling vegetables. In addition to raising pigs, Mrs. Vu and her husband also raise cows, which, at the rate of 1,500,000 VND per month, is the main source of income for the two. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to buy more cows.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: C., 28, a resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia, cultivates rice and also owns a small milling machine providing a rice-hulling service for farmers. He normally earns about $7 a day from his investment.  His wife, Mrs. Sambath, 25, earns a living raising pigs from home. C. is now applying for a $400 loan to buy a motorcycle for family transportation and more piglets for his wife to raise.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and more piglets.

loans.name: Rozalina

texts.en:
"Skillful and determined woman" describes Mrs. Rozalina M., who is 47, married and living in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She has three children. Her husband is a farmer.

At first, Mrs. M. baked bread for her husband during snack time. Many of her neighbors who tasted her bread encouraged her to bake bread and sell it to them. Because she enjoys what she’s doing, she tried and it was successful. In order to have additional capital, she joined Paglaum Muti-Purpose Cooperative to take a loan.

As a member in good standing, she is on her 11th loan cycle already. Now she applies for a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy flour and ingredients for making bread. She plans to have mixing equipment someday and to expand her business into a bakery.

loans.use: To buy flour and ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Khatira

texts.en: Khatira S., the 55-year-old mother of seven children, rents a store where she sells cosmetics, women’s crèmes and underwear. This business, which she has operated for the past two years, earns permanent income and allows her family to live in normal conditions. As this is the family’s only source of income, Khatira does her best to make her business successful, always carrying a wide range of products and maintaining very friendly relationships with her customers. Kahtira is hoping to expand her business with a loan of $1500 to purchase more items for the store.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: El señor Julio Alberto A., tiene la edad de  75 años, habita en el barrio las Francia numero uno en Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, ellos tiene a su cargo dos nietos, una niña de nueve años y un niño de siete, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida a sus nietos, para poder darle mejor bienestar. Don Julio desde hace 25 años se dedica a la agricultura, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la perdida del cultivo ya que los gases del volcán, le afecta, el inicio los trabajos agrícolas lo inicio con sus propios esfuerzos. El financiamiento lo quiere, para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo y poder sacar una buena producción y vende a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Julio Alberto A. is 75 years old and lives in a neighborhood of Ticuantepe together with his wife, who helps him with the farm work. They are raising two dependent grandchildren, a nine year old girl and a seven year old boy. Their plan for the family is to improve the conditions in which their grandchildren live in order to improve their wellbeing. Julio has been working in agriculture for 25 years. The greatest difficulty he faces is the loss of crops, since the gases from a nearby volcano affect the crops. He started his farming business with his own efforts. He wants the loan in order to buy supplies and fertilizer in roder to improve the quality of his crops, reap a good harvest and sell his products at a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and fertilizers in order to improve his harvest

loans.name: Bendu Group

texts.en:
This is Wurie B., Saidu C., Daniel B., Paul B., and Jatu K.. They have named their group B. United, named after the group leader’s surname. Wurie B. (second from left) is 39 years of age. He was born in Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. He is married with two children, all of whom attend primary school. Wurie sells ready-to-wear clothes and has been in this business for over 18 years now.

This will be the third loan these entrepreneurs have requested from Kiva lenders through SMT. Their previous loans have significantly impacted the lives of these borrowers: they have been able to feed their families, send their children to school, and solve many of their daily financial challenges.

Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan to further strengthen their businesses.

loans.use: To invest in his clothing sales business

loans.name: San Miguel Group
