texts.es: El grupo "San Miguel" esta representado por la señora Amparo Nadia y conformado por 13 miembros en los cuales no existe parentesco alguno, una mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la comercialización y venta D. diferentes productos como ropa, cosméticos, pan y a actividades D. servicio D. limpieza, atención en salón D. belleza y a la educación pública. Dentro del comercio existe mucha competencia en la oferta D. mercadería y servicios, por lo que las socias deben esforzarse el doble para adquirí un ingreso diario para el sustento D. su familia, es por este motivo que requieren el crédito para la compra D. material D. trabajo y herramientas para un trabajo mas eficiente y prolijo así como para el incremento D. su mercadería que brindara a sus familias un ingreso mayor y una mejor calidad D. vida. Las socias van cursando su segundo ciclo juntas por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo D. la Fundación a la cual demostraron ser capaces D. cumplir con sus obligaciones en forma puntual y responsable demostrando unidad dentro del grupo.
texts.en:
The "San Miguel" Group is represented by Mrs. Amparo Nadia and composed of 13 unrelated female members. A majority of the members work in the commercialization and sale of different products like clothes, cosmetics, bread, and cleaning services, beauty salons, and public education. Within this commerce there exists a lot of competition in offering services and merchandise; thus, the members must work twice as hard in order to acquire a daily income to maintain their families. For this reason they require a loan to purchase work material and tools in order to be more efficient and orderly, as well as to increase the merchandise that will offer them a better income and a better quality of life for their families. The members are in their second cycle together, so they are familiar with the work methods of the Foundation, in which they proved to be capable of fulfilling their obligations punctually and responsibly, demonstrating unity within their group.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Marie Esperance

texts.en: Marie Espérance M. is a 40-year-old widow with four children. For the past 3 years she has run a small clothing store in the capital, Kigali. She is the only one employed at the business and brings in a modest profit of 60,000 Rwandan francs (FRW) per month. This is her first loan request from Vision Finance Company. She will use the 500,000 FRW loan to grow her business.

loans.use: Business growth

loans.name: Agasen

texts.en: Agasen M. is a very loving father who is devoted to the needs of his four children, whom he adores. He raises livestock and, every morning, leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. He wants to improve the quality of his animals but, to do this, he needs to purchase better breeds of livestock and these animals are very costly. Agasen needs $2000 USD and, because he does not have that much money at this moment, he is requesting this loan. He hopes that you trust his hard work and honesty.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa G. is from the village of Lantay, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Marisa is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Marisa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp. She also offers spices like onions, garlic, and others in the local community. Marisa has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marisa is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en la casa que lograron adquirir a base a mucho esfuerzo. Ella se dedica a la preparación de banquetes, los cuales elabora para diferentes eventos; como fiestas de cumpleaños, bautizos, matrimonios, etc. A María le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le permite realizarlo desde su casa, además de tener tiempo libre para estar con sus hijos. Los días que tiene pedidos son muy ajetreados, desde la mañana hasta la entrega, y generalmente le demanda mucho tiempo y dedicación; felizmente cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, los cuales aminoran la carga de trabajo. Adicionalmente, María alquila algunas habitaciones, negocio que también le da ingresos extras para su economía. Ella quiere dedicarse de lleno a esto, ya que le resulta muy rentable este negocio, es por ello que quiere construir su casa para poder tener más cuartos para alquilar. Este es su primer préstamo individual con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en todos  sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará utensilios de cocina y material para la construcción para la ampliación de su vivienda.

loans.use: Compra de utensilios y ampliación de su vivienda

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She has a store where she sells cement. She has been in this business for the past 8 years. She hopes for the amount of N100,000 to purchase more cement to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cement to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a  member of the Kichangani borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 29 year old woman,  she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 10,7, and 5 years old.

Maria has owned a food business selling local beer for 2 years, she works 4 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Maria`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities like maize for local beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Maria hopes to save money,pay school fess and expand her business.

loans.use: To buynmore maize for  local beer

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: S., 42 years old, is a vegetable seller from Phnom Penh City. She runs her business in the area of the Prek Tmey Market and sells different kinds of vegetables like cabbages, potatoes, and morning glories. She currently earns an average of $5 a day and has been running the business for more than nine years. S. is married to Mr. Roeun who is a military policeman. She has four children, two of whom are married and live away from home, while the other two are students. S. finds it hard to traveling to anywhere, because she doesn't have her own vehicle for riding purpose. Thus, she will be used her loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Hamana

texts.en: Hamana is 33 years old and married with two children. She sells motor parts and has been in business for the past 13 years. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more motor parts to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more motor parts to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith B. is from the village of Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old, married, and has two adult and one school-aged child. Judith owns and operates a computer services business in their place. She has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. She gladly poses at her Internet Cafe with her customers. Judith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services and to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 from MPC. Judith is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to buy another computer and computer accessories like headphones, keyboards, speakers, and printers. This will be her seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy another computer and accessories

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es:
Rosa M. es presidenta del grupo Girasol, que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana,  vende zapatos de cholita (mujer originaria) en diferentes  pueblos como Achacachi y Batallas, actualmente cuida a sus 6 hijos sola y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.
Las demás integrantes del grupo venden ropa, sombreros, comida, fabricación de calzados, costura de prendas de vestir como chamarras, son los negocios a los cuales se dedican las integrantes es este grupo, con los cuales se generan  ingresos para sustentar a sus familiar. Necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería y materia prima según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is the president of the Girasol group, which belongs to the Panamericana community center. She sells “cholita” (native women) shoes in different towns like Achacachi and Batallas. She currently takes care of her six children by herself. She needs the loan to buy merchandise. The other members of the group sell clothes, hats, food, and make shoes and articles of clothing like jackets. Those are the members’ businesses, which generate the incomes to support their families. They need the loan to get merchandise and raw material according to the businesses that they have.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Peter Kibuthu

texts.en:
Peter is married to Jeniffer and they have not yet had any children. Peter operates a second-hand clothing sales business outside of Nairobi. He was introduced to KADET by an existing client and is taking out his first loan. Peter plans to use this loan to purchase additional stock of second-hand clothing (shirts, pants, etc). 

Peter's business is located in a very busy market and therefore he is able to reach many clients. With the extra profits he anticipates earning as a result of the loan, Peter plans to expand his business and reinvest in more stock of second-hand clothing. 

Peter hopes to build rental houses one day. He believes he is hardworking.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a 25-year-old married man who has one child currently in school. He trades cassava dough for a living. Cassava dough is milled cassava mixed with water and is used to prepare local meals like banku. 

Solomon is requesting a loan to buy more bags of cassava to increase his production of cassava dough. He is expecting higher profits during this season as he looks forward to selling more to people who want to enjoy local meals like banku and kenkey. He believes your support will enable him to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase cassava in bulk

loans.name: St. Michael Group

texts.en: Esther is 28 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a mostly commercial community. Esther is a trader. She trades in printed fabrics. She hawks and treks to sell. Esther is the leader of a trust bank group called St. Michael. The members of the group are mainly traders. They are hard working, trust themselves and want the loan to invest in their businesses. Esther, the group leader, is second from left in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda R. is from the village of Owaon. She is 63 years old. Erlinda is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 1,700 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP for the same purpose. This will be Erlinda's 7th loan from PMPC and her second loan from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Kimman

texts.en: Mrs. Kimman M. is 30 years old and she lives in Chrouy village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare field to cultivate rice. In order to support her crops, Mrs. Kimman M. is applying for a KHR 2,000,000 loan from AMK to buy fertilizer and pesticides. Her husband, Mr. Peoun Pang is a fisherman who earns a small income by selling fish to support his family. The couple has three children; two are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study as the child is a year old. Her husband and her children are presented with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her crops.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 45 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Desde muy pequeña le enseñaron a trabajar en varios oficios para alcanzar sus metas, ahora se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y cuyes, los cuales ella misma cultiva y cría respectivamente. Pero paralelamente, trabaja junto a su hermana en la elaboración de quesos y manjar, los que lleva a la ciudad de Lima para su venta.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es criar sus cuyes y lo hace con mucho amor, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que viajar constantemente a la ciudad de Lima por los pedidos de manjar y queso que tiene. Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio siga creciendo y que le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el décimo préstamo de María con MFP, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea meter en problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más comida para sus cuyes, ya que es la actividad que mejores ingresos le está generando.
texts.en:
Maria, 45, is a cheerful and unassuming woman who lives in her own home. What she most desires is to have a better quality of life. From the time she was very small, she was taught many trades in order to reach her goals. Now she sells alfalfa and guinea pigs, which she cultivates and raises, respectively. At the same time, she works with her sister making cheese and dulce de leche (a milk-based dessert), which she takes to the city of Lima to sell. What she likes most about her job is raising her guinea pigs, which she does with a lot of love. She has been carrying out these activities for 15 years, and what she considers most difficult is to have to travel constantly to the city of Lima to fill her orders for dulce de leche and cheese. Over time, she hopes that her business will continue to grow so that it will provide a better economic return. This is Maria's 10th loan with MFP, and she is prepared to make all of her payments on time, since she does not want to create problems in her communal bank where she is very supportive of her fellow members. With the 2,000 Peruvian soles requested she will buy more feed for her guinea pigs, since this activity generates the most income for her.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feed for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Estefana's Group

texts.es:
Los señores Bartolomé, Estefana, Telma, Jacinta y Elmer, necesitan invertir su crédito en cultivo de verduras, ya que desde un pincipio se dedicaban a trabajar por dia con otras personas. Conociendo el trabajo, se animaron a cultivar una cuerda, por el hecho de que no cuentan con mucho capital, ellos necesitan seguir trabajando, gracias a Dios han logrado que la siembra que tienen por el momento les ha ayudado a salir adelante, ya que también se dedican a otras actividades tales como, compra y venta de verdura, totillería y cultivos con otras personas.
Ya que no cuentan con mucho capital para dedicarse solo a lo propio necesitan, es por eso que han solicitado su crédito. Su sueño es luchar para poder comprar un sitio aparte para poder vivir por separado ya que por el momento todos viven juntos.
texts.en:
Sres. Bartolomé, Estefana, Telma, Jacinta, and Elmer need to invest their loan in growing vegetables. At first, they worked each day for other people. Being knowledgeable in what they do, they were encouraged to plant crops together since they do not have much capital and need to continue working. Thanks to God, they were able complete their planting which, for the moment, has helped them stay ahead. They also engage in other activities such as buying and selling vegetables, selling tortillas, and helping other people with their crops. Since they do not have much capital to dedicate to only what they need, they decided to apply for this loan. Their dream is to struggle to obtain separate places to live because, at the moment, they all live together.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in growing vegetables

loans.name: Lidia Monica

texts.en:
Lidia Monica is part of the Los Diamantes (The Diamonds) communal bank. The bank consists of 32 members, all hailing from the Cuzco area. Lidia is 34 years old and lives with her spouse and their two children in the city of Cuzco. 

Lidia Monica makes a living in the auto repair industry, buying car parts and using them to fix the cars of her clients. She owns this business with one other person. Lidia Monica plans on using the Kiva loan to buy more car parts so she can grow her business. She is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

In the photo, Lidia Monica is pictured with her daughter.

loans.use: Car parts for car repair business

loans.name: Oluwageniga

texts.en:
Oluwageniga is 40 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria.

Oluwageniga sells medicine. He has been in this business for over 10 years and with LAPO microfinance for 2 years. Oluwageniga is requesting a loan of N70,000. With the loan, he plans to expand his medicine business, which is now booming. With this kind of business, he hopes to increase his earnings in the long run and be able to provide better for his children's education.

Oluwageniga says thanks to all Kiva lender for their support and assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Maria es separada, tiene 49 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende especerías que ella misma prepara, además viaja a las ferias de la región llevando sus productos.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra comino, canela.
Maria sueña con aumentar su mercadería y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria, 49, is a member of the Marcela communal bank. She is separated and has two children. Maria has a stall in the 12 de Abril market where she sells spices that she herself prepares; she also travels to regional farmers markets to sell her products. Maria needs a 900 sol loan to buy cumin and cinnamon. Maria dreams with increasing her stock merchandise and to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cumin and cinnamon.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.pt:
Avelino C. M. nasceu na Província de Cabo Delgado, norte de Moçambique, tem 50 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 26, 24, 20, 20 e 07 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 6ą classe do antigo sistema e não continuou porque na altura não havia possibilidades de ir mais alem. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu sobrinho que vive com ele.
Saiu de Cabo Delgado cumprindo o serviço militar obrigatório em 1975. Mais tarde constituiu sua família no Distrito de Boane onde vive actualmente. É reformado do Ministério da Defesa ha mais de 5 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem uma pensão de 6.604.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo no valor de 16.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, blocos, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com o melhoramento da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.500.00mt, 8.500.00mt, 12.500.00mt, 7.050.00mt e 15.500.00mt todos para a mesma actividade (habitação). 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra oferecendo assim melhores condições de habitabilidade da sua família.
texts.en:
Avelino C. M. was born in the province of Cabo Delgado in the north of Mozambique. He is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children who are 26, 24, 21, 20 and 7 years old. All of his children are currently in school. Avelino only studied through 6th grade under the old system of education, and didn't continue because at that time there was no chance for him to do so. He lives with his family in their own house and helps to support a niece who lives with them. He left Cabo Delgado in 1975 to comply with the obligatory military service. Later he built a family in the Boane district, where he currently lives. He is retired from the Ministry of Defense and has a monthly pension of 6604 Meticais. He doesn’t employ any household help. He uses the money from his pension for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account. Avelino has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who also work with the institution. This is his 6th loan, for the amount of 16,000 Meticais. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, iron, blocks, sand and other items) in order to continue working on a home improvement project. His earlier loans were for 6500, 8500, 12,500, 7050 and 15,500 Meticais and were all used for the same purpose. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to finish his house, in order to offer his family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, blocks, iron and other items)

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Evelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine has been in the business of selling spare parts for a long time. She is 35 years old and married. Vestine works hard every day in order to expand her business. She works from morning hours until late in the evening hours.

Vestine is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business meaningfully. With this loan, Vestine will purchase additional spare parts to sell. She really hopes that her sales will increase as well as her profits. Vestine will keep reinvesting the profits in her business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a variety of spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase CDs, DVDs, and Play Station 2 games

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa C. is from the village of D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Josefa is married and has an adult children. To make a living, Josefa owns and operates a restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving local foods to customers. Josefa has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Josefa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be the second loan taken out by Josefa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He will use the money to make some home improvements.  He will rewire the home and build a wall.

loans.name: Niño De Praga Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Niño D. Praga inicia su segundo ciclo con 13, las socias son del Distrito D. Concepción, Provincia D. Vilcas Huaman, Departamento D. Ayacucho.
La señora Sofia es socia del Banco Comunal hace 1 año, Sofia es casada, tiene 5 hijos, 3 varones y 2 mujeres, Sofia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, ropa, calzados, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos, su mercadería los adquiere en la ciudad D. Ayacucho y luego lo transporta con carro propio. Sofia solicita un crédito para la compra D. calzados.
Los sueños D. Sofia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una empresa D. apicultura.
texts.en:
The Niño D. Praga (Holy Child of Prague) Communal Bank began its 2nd cycle of loans with 13 members, all from the District of Concepción, Province of Vilcas Huaman, Department of Ayacucho. Sofia has been a member of the Communal Bank for 1 year. She is married and has 5 children (3 boys and 2 girls). Sofia operates a store in her house where she sells groceries, clothing, shoes, and drinks. She does this every day with the help of her husband and children. Her merchandise is acquired in the city of Ayacucho and then transported in their own car. Sofia is requesting a loan to buy shoes to sell. Her dreams are that her children may become professionals, and to have a bee-keeping enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SHOES TO SELL IN HER STORE

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina C. is from the village of Mabini. She is 34 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Lina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for house repair. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lina from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en: Eleonor B. is from the village of Brgy. Payawan, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 40 years old. Eleonor is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Eleonor runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Eleonor has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Eleonor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleonor is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Eleonor from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Malumbo Group

texts.en:
Kulwa S. is in his mid forties. He is married and has four children. Kulwa has been running a food stall since 1999. He sells fruits and vegetables. The stall is open daily between 6 am and 6 pm. Kulwa earns a good monthly profit from his business. 

This will be Kulwa's second Mothisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  (A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.) Kulwa used his first loan to increase his stock of vegetables, and he plans to do the same with his second loan. Kulwa also plans to use the loan to buy new types of fruits and vegetables. Kulwa's dream is to open another food stall in the near future. 

Kulwa will share the loan with his loan group called Malumbo, which has 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Kulwa is standing in the back row, the first person on the left.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Magda Lisseth

texts.es: La Sra. Magda M. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como profesora de secundaria en el colegio José de la Cruz Mena donde tiene 9 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de madera, zinc y pago de mano de obra con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Magda M. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón.  She currently works as a junior high school teacher at the José de la Cruz Mena school.  She has worked there for nine years.

This will be her first loan through CEPRODEL and will use the money to buy lumber and zinc metal sheeting, and to pay for labor in order to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra C. is from the city of Prenza, Tangub City. She is 28 years old and married, with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Myra operates motor transport services. Myra has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

Myra joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myra is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP,  to be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey S., 29, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. S. is a housewife while her husband is employed preparing firewood, earning an income of about USD 7.50 per day. S. has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water, and USD 38 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a plot of farmland to grow more rice. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Leonardo José

texts.es:
Leonardo José M. U. es un señor trabajador, esforzado y emprendedor de 49 años quien tiene el servicio de transporte para materiales de construcción desde hace 10 años. El con el crédito compra llantas para su camión. 
M. tiene la meta de adquirir otro camión para aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonardo José M. U. is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising, 49 year old man who has had a construction materials and supplies hauling service for 10 years.  He will use the loan to buy tires for his truck.

His goal is to buy another truck to increase his business.

loans.use: For truck tires.

loans.name: Marcela Alexander

texts.es: Marcela Alexander tiene más de 5 años con su negocio que es una pulpería. Pues siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar su condición de vida, ya que es una persona muy responsable y siempre se preocupa por proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día. Se acercan buenas temporadas y Marcela quiere aprovechar para vender más. Ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de gaseosas, golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos y pan.
texts.en: Marcela Alexander has been running her general store for more than five years. As a very responsible person, she has always been concerned about improving her standard of living and providing for her family. The important holiday season approaches, and Marcela wishes to take advantage of it by increasing sales. She is seeking a loan to buy soft drinks, candy, detergent, basic grains, and bread.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store

loans.name: Saphie

texts.en:
Saphie is 43 years old, married and has two children. Currently one of her children attends school. Saphie sells cassava, which she has been doing for four years. She works together with her husband. She will use the loan to purchase more cassava to sell.

With the increased profits from her expanded business Saphie plans to buy a plot of land, renovate a house and pay her children's school fees. In the future she would like to own a big shop with a variety of items.

loans.use: To buy more cassava to sell

loans.name: Paz Y Amor Group

texts.es: Ynes es socia del Banco Comunal Paz y Amor, que empieza su ciclo 18 con 20 socias, Ynes es la Presidenta del Banco Comunal, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos D. 11 y 8 años D. edad. Ynes se dedica a la venta D. comida los sábados y domingos en el Campo deportivo D. Huayllapampa y los demás días D. la semana en su casa, también venD. aguas gaseosas y bebidas. Solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra D. insumos para la preparación D. alimentos. A Ynes le gusta las reuniones D. Su Banco comunal porque le hablan D. sus derechos y como trabajar, le gusta ahorrar. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ynes is a member of the Paz y Amor communal bank which is beginning its 18th year with 20 members.  Ynes is the president of the bank and is 28 years old with two children, ages 11 and 8.

On Saturdays and Sundays Ynes sells food at the Huayllapamnpa sports field and the rest of the week she works out of her home selling soft drinks and other beverages.

She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients for her food sales.  Ynes likes the meetings at the communal bank because she learns about her rights and how to work.  She likes to save her money.  Her dream is for her children to have professional careers.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil and food ingredients

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Mrs. Gina A., 36, is married and lives at P2 Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Gina has three school-aged children. When she learned about Paglaum MPC, she became a member in July 2010 so that she could get help to set up her business. She used her first loan of 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy kilos of fishes to sell to her neighbors. She is grateful to God that her fish business has done very well. She was able to send her children to school and supplement her husband's income. Now she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 for additional working capital. Gina would be happy enough if her business would grow more. Seeing her children finish their studies would be a great achievement for her as a mother. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Vie Nouvelle Plus Group

texts.en:
"Vie Nouvelle Plus" (New Life Plus) is a group of 22 owners of small businesses chaired by Dorange. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Dorange, single and aged 30, runs a clothing stand while taking care of two relatives. She has been in business for many years. Dorange has used seven Hope loans (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) to finance the expanding of her inventory. Due to the high demand in her community, she intends with the next loan to buy still more goods for resale in order to meet clients' demand and generate additional profit. This will help her to achieve her plans to grow the business. It brings in a profit of US$100 per week. 

Dorange’s ambition is to purchase goods abroad herself. She is engaged.

loans.use: purchasing additional goods for her store for resale at a profit

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthy N. is 41 years old.  He is a widower and has only one daughter. He lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Chanthy sells flowers and bananas at the market. He grows the flowers himself and buys banana from fellow villagers to resell. His daughter assists him  in the business. 

Chanty is asking for his first loan of $1,200 to build a new house to live in.

loans.use: To build a new house to live in

loans.name: Dewi Fortuna Group

texts.en:
Jero Pudak S. is the leader of the "Dewi Fortuna" Group. Currently, Jero Pudak S. is requesting her second loan. The loan will be used to buy four pigs, whereas feed will be purchased from the profits gained from the sales of the first loan period.

Jero Pudak S. is very excited to pursue this business because it is proven to help the family income. Her husband is very supportive of this and often helps her in the care of their pigs.

Jero Pudak S. has a dream to use profits from all the work raising these pigs to renovate her house and buy a cabinet for her son.

loans.use: To buy four pigs.

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en: Mairamkul O. is the leader of this group. She is 49 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she has raised two daughters and a son. The first daughter works as a teacher at a school and the other children study at school. Mairamkul herself works as a teacher too. Ten years ago, she got a salary in the amount of 10,000 soms and that money she spent on purchasing cattle. Since that time, the family has been engaged in cattle breeding. With money received from the loan, Mairamkul would purchase some more farm animals for breeding. In the future, she hopes to purchase a vehicle for her family. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is 60 years old. She lives in the Kakheti Region, in the village of Khashmi, with her daughter, son-in-law and two little grandchildren. Mary works as an office cleaner in a local company and earns 150 Laris per month. Mary’s daughter trades golden jewelry. Her average monthly profit is 300 Laris. Mary’s son-in-law works in a local institution in the position of logistic/provider. Besides the above-mentioned jobs, family members are engaged in agricultural activities: they have three milk cows and make cheese, which is sold in Tbilisi (the capital city of the country). 

With the requested amount, they will buy two additional milk cows and will be able to produce and sell more cheese and increase their income. 

The increase in the income will be reinvested in their farming business. Mary hopes she will be able to expand her farm, increase the income of the family and respectively improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy milk cows

loans.name: Adjoa Authur

texts.en:
Adjoa Authur K. makes a living selling banku, a Ghanaian staple made of fermented maize and cassava, at Eguafo Village near Elmina.  She is married and has one child. Adjoa Atta’s income helps pay the household utility bills and school fees. 

Adjoa Atta needs a loan from Kiva to increase the volume of food she sells. She plans to purchase more maize with this loan. Ultimately, Adjoa Atta wants to earn enough to purchase a piece of land to build a home some day.
 
At the time of visit, she had finished selling and so was showing the pot she uses to prepare the banku.

loans.use: to buy more maize to make banku

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a young woman from Rafah in the Gaza Strip. Iman is the mother of Siba, one year old, Ameen, four years old, and Majd, three years old. Iman is married to a Palestinian National Authority employee.

As the family's income is meager and doesn't cover their expenses due to the relatively high cost of living in Palestine. Iman and her husband managed to have a grocery store with the help of relatives to increase their income.

Iman took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a large variety of goods to increase sales and thus income. Iman's husband is photographed here as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of inventory.

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn is a married woman with 5 children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Robelyn has been in the hog-raising business for 3 years. She raises pigs in her backyard and sells them at the market. Robelyn also helps her husband grow rice on their farm.

This loan will be used to purchase feeds and farm inputs such as fertilizer. In the future, Robelyn hopes to have good living conditions.

loans.use: buy pig feeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar es un cliente de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposa y 2 hijos en una comunidad rural en vías de desarrollo perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. La comunidad donde Cesar vive es una comunidad rural de condición humilde que no cuenta aún con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe.

Cesar se dedica a la  crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal comercializa en el mercado local,  cuenta  con una experiencia de 3 años en esta labor y su buen desempeño hace que tenga clientes constantes. Adicionalmente, Cesar es peón estable en una parcela en la cual es cuidador y jornalero, su esposa lo apoya en sus labores y cuenta con herencia de terreno agrícola, la cual todavía no está desarrollada físicamente.

Cesar solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de animales para ampliar su ganado, así como en la implementación de una pequeña granja para aves. Él desea mejorar la calidad de su crianza pues tiene planeado ampliar este negocio, de venta de animales, en un futuro.

Cesar tiene muchos deseos de superación y espera que le concedan el crédito para poder lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Cesar is a 26-year-old client living with his wife and two children in a rural, developing community belonging to Tambogrande-Piura District.  The community that Cesar lives in is a rural community in humble conditions that still does not the have basic utilities of water, electricity and sewage.

Cesar raises sheep and barnyard fowl.  When they reach ideal size and weight he sells them in the local market.  He has three years experience in this line of work and his good working habits insure his having regular customers.  In addition, Cesar works as a trusted laborer on a field where he is caretaker and day laborer.  His wife helps him with his jobs and has an inherited piece of farmland that still is physically undeveloped.

Cesar is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to buy animals to increase his herd as well as to equip a small farm for the fowl.  He wants to improve the quality of his care because he plans to expand this business, the sale of animals, in the future.

Cesar has a strong will to improve and hopes that the loan will be granted in order to reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy animals and equip the farm.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en: Zam is married, with three children, all of whom go to school. She doesn't take care of any additional family members. Zam sells yellow bananas. She has been in this business for the last ten years, and sells to all categories of customers, both retail and wholesale. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of yellow bananas. Zam lives in a house that she rents, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of yellow bananas.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Allen is a 38-year-old single mother of two children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in secondhand clothes for seven years. She started with working capital of 300,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardship is lack of enough capital and her vision is opening up another outlet in town.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Felix Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Félix, vive en su propio domicilio ubicado en la zona la guardia,  es nacido en Santa Cruz, tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, es de ocupación moto taxista, trabaja hace unos cuatro años en esta actividad,  el destino del crédito es para comprar una moto nueva y trabajarla, generándole otros ingresos,  de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y de toda su familia, su deseo es el de ver a sus hijos convertidos en personas de bien y profesionales, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le brindo.
texts.en:
Sr. Félix lives in his own home in the District of La Guardia, but he was born in Santa Cruz. He has three children who are of school age. Félix is a motorcycle taxi driver and has been in this business for approximately four years.

This loan will be used to buy a new motorcycle to use for his work and generating additional income. This will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his entire family. His hope is to see his children become good people and successful professionals. Félix is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Barcelyn

texts.en:
Barcelyn is 39 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Barcelyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Barcelyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

Barcelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 63 years old and married with 6 children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF, to buy more inventory like sugar, groceries, etc. for sale in her sari sari store.

Saturnina has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the sari sari store for 30 years, and also earns an income from her vegetable vending business.

Saturnina aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 4 children. Angelina has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

Angelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Angelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas for sale

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is a 29-year-old single man living with one parent and one sibling. He has owned a barbershop in his village since 2006 and has 12 years of experience working in the same occupation. Like the majority of the Lebanese guys, he helps his family with his business income. With his requested loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase new chairs and additionA. shaving tools. He is very optimistic and hopes that the loan will positively impact his business.

loans.use: to purchase new chairs and shaving tools

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry selling business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and restaurant operators. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and disease outbreaks in her place of operation. Janet dreams of expanding her poultry business in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a divorced woman with six children who are all grown up. She owns a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has worked as a porridge and cassava crisps seller for the past thirty years; her potential clients are Kinarini residents, neighbors, family and friends. She faces a major challenge of lack of funds to expand her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase cassava and porridge flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it is easy to access loans.

loans.use: To purchase cassava and porridge flour for her business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 23 years old and lives in Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is married and has no children. 
Arlene has a clothing business where she earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month. She has requested a loan of 11,000 to  purchase more materials for her house. 
Arlene has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Arlene hopes to have a large amount of capital from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her house

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora Maria Isabel ella es técnica en vectores. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción como bloques, arena, cemento ya que realizara la pared para construir su cocina de su casa. Vive en casa propia con mucho esfuerzo ella ha realizado las mejoras necesarias a vivienda. Maria es cliente desde hace mucho tiempo, sus pagos siempre han sido puntuales y esta será la cuarta vez que desea este crédito.
texts.en: Señora Maria Isabel makes deliveries for a living.   She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as blocks, sand and cement so that she can build a wall for her kitchen.  She has her own house that she obtained with a lot of hard work and has made the necessary improvements.  Maria is a long-time customer and her payments have always been on time.  This will be her fourth time requesting a loan.

loans.use: purchase blocks, sand, and cement.

loans.name: Flor Elena

texts.es:
Flor vive con su hija, propietaria de una venta de ropa y presta servicios con un molino de mixtamal, estos negocios los inicio gracias a su propia iniciativa y a la ayuda de su madre, se dedica a dichas actividades desde hace dos años y trabaja de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de variedad de ropa para la época navideña, vestidos de fiesta, blusas, faldas, pantalones, esta compra le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y obtener buenas utilidades las cuales le permitirán ayudar aun mas a su familia.
El proposito de Flor es ver crecer a su hija con los estudios adecuados hasta culminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Flor lives with her daughter.  She’s a clothing merchant and also provides corn milling service.  She started both businesses on her own initiative and with help from her mother.  She’s been in both these businesses for two years and works from 6am until 4pm.

She is asking for this loan to buy an assortment of clothes for the Christmas season: party dresses, blouses, skirts and pants.  This purchase will help her strengthen the business and earn good profits that will make it possible for her to help out her family even more.

Flor’s goal is to see her daughter grow up with adequate schooling until she completes a university career.

loans.use: to buy party dresses, blouses, skirts and pants.

loans.name: Lango

texts.en:
Lango is 43 years old, lives in an airport community, and was educated to the ninth grade. She has five children between 16 to 27 years old; three are in college and working and living on their own, while the two younger ones are in school and live at home. Lango's husband is a businessman.

For the past 14 years, Lango has been selling cold drinks like soda, and soft drinks, to sustain her and her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase soda and soft drinks for her business. Her plans are to build a house and send her younger children to college.

loans.use: to purchase soda and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Twitezimbere Group

texts.fr:
Consolate est une commerçante âgée de 43 ans qui habite la localité de Songa de  la Commune et Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle  vend  de la bière en détaillant depuis 11 ans, un métier qu’elle a commencé alors qu’elle était  une travailleuse à la  banque (Meridian Bank). Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 9è année secondaire. Elle est mariée à Dieudonné qui est un travailleur à la PAM, et ont ensemble 3 enfants dont 2 sont à l’école secondaire et 1 autres  au primaire. Sa famille héberge 1 garçon qui a maintenant 25 ans de  la parenté proche.
Son crédit  Kiva de 250,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient va lui permettre  d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup de caisses de bière à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire TWITEZIMBERE
texts.en:
Consolate is a 43-year-old retail merchant who lives in the village of Songa, part of the Commune and Province of Gitega in the central region.

She has been retailing beer for the past 11 years, a job she started when she was an employee at the Meridian Bank. She studied up to the 9th grade.

She is married to Dieudonné who is a worker at the WFP (World Food Program), and with whom she has three children: two are in high school and one in primary. Her family also hosts a 25-year-old close relative.

Kiva's credit loan of 250,000 Burundian francs will bolster her working capital. This will enable her to buy many cases of beer for retail sales, in order to realize large profits and increase her savings.

She is a member of the Twitezimbere community group.

loans.use: increase her capital and buy many cases of beer for retail sales, in order to realize large profits and increase her savings

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Elsa has a shop that sells green bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

Elsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Mrs. Seam, age 31, is a local farmer and her husband works as a construction worker around the province of Kompong Cham. She’s really busy with her work nowadays because it’s time to collect her rice harvest. She has two children who attend a local public school. 

The family has had difficulties in travelling as they don’t own a motorcycle. For this reason, Seam decided to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle, and with the remaining funds, she’ll buy lubricating oil for her threshing machine. She hopes that she’ll be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle and lubricating oil.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is a 36-year-old married woman. She has two sons and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living as a worker.

Van has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop at her house. She has been in business for twenty years.

She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish.

loans.name: Jorge Dionicio

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos, tiene un hijo de 4 años.

El se dedicaba, a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz  Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida con la finalidad de mejorar la producción de sus cultivos. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es mejorar la producción de sus cultivos. Su desafío es el transporte. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver las noticias y hacer deportes.
texts.en:
Jorge is 24 years old and single.  He lives with his parents in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province.  He has a four year old son.
He is a farmer, and he grows corn.

He is requesting the loan to buy compost, insecticide, fertilizer, urea, and fungicide in order to improve the production of his crops.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas.  His goal is to improve the production of his crops.  His challenge is the transportation.

In his free time he likes to watch the news and play sports.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting and earning income as well. Leonida has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Leonida has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. Someday, Leonida hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is a 47 year-old married woman. She has a son, a dynamic hard-working personality, and is always looking out for the well-being of her family. Her husband works in a shopping mall, however his income does not cover all the family expenses so she decided to start her own business selling new and used clothing in the traditional markets. Recognizing her natural capacity for sales, she decided to open her own small business six years ago.

Now she needs your support through a loan of $375 USD. With the seasons changing, she needs new merchandise for her business. If you choose to support her, she is sure that she will be successful and can grow her business. She plans to repay the loan within 4-8 months. You can be part of her success by supporting her!

** Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Alberta es una mujer casada de 47 años, que tiene un hijo, su personalidad es muy dinámica y trabajadora y siempre busca el bienestar de su familia. Su esposo trabaja en un centro comercial, sin embargo los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su familia, es por eso que decidió iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada en los mercados rodantes, a ella siempre le han gustado las ventas y viendo la facilidad que tiene decidió iniciar hace seis años su pequeño negocio.

En estos momentos ella requiere de un apoyo por la cantidad de $ 375 USD para capital de trabajo, ya que por el cambio de temporada necesita surtir con nueva mercancía su negocio, si te decides a apoyarla ella esta segura que podrá salir adelante y hacer crecer su negocio con el préstamo, el cual piensa pagar en un plazo de 4-8 meses. Se parte de su éxito y apóyala con su préstamo.

loans.use: For work capital

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married and has two sons, one of whom is physically challenged. A college graduate, she runs a small business selling women’s clothing in the central city market in Kherson. She believes that one of the biggest advantages of her work is a flexible schedule that gives her the opportunity to take good care of her disabled son. Olga has been in business for seven years. She has promptly repaid a total of seven loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Her attentiveness and creativity have helped her develop a good understanding of what her clients need and want. They always feel complimented when she goes out of her way to help them with their selections. This has naturally boosted Olga’s sales and led to growth in her business. Olga is requesting a loan for $1,000 to enable her to significantly expand her business by purchasing a new vending facility. She is also planning to re-stock her existing kiosk and purchase a supply of inventory for her new vending location. Olga is hoping to reinvest generated income into further expansion of her business. She believes that consistent growth will help her provide a stable source of income and continue to secure her family’s well-being.

Ольга – одружена, в неї двоє синів. Один з них – інвалід. Ольга має вище освіту. В неї є власний бізнес з продажу жіночого одягу на центральному ринку міста Херсон. Найбільшою перевагою свого бізнесу Ольга вважає гнучкий графік роботи, який дозволяє їй дбати про свого сина-інваліда. Ольга займається цим бізнесом вже сім років. Вона вчасно сплатила усі сім позик від „Надії України”. Її дбайливість та творчий підхід допомогли їй порозумітися з багатьма клієнтами. Покупцям дуже приємно бачити, як Ольга прагне якомога краще обслужити кожного з них. Саме її підхід до роботи сприяє зростанню обсягів продажу та розвитку її бізнесу. Ольга просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб значно розширити власний бізнес завдяки придбанню нового торгового приміщення. Вона також планує поповнити асортимент товарів для роздрібного продажу. Ольга сподівається вкласти отриманий прибуток в подальший розвиток її бізнесу. Вона вважає, що поступове зростання торгівлі забезпечить стабільне джерело прибутку та гарантуватиме добробут її рідних.

loans.use: To buy a new vending facility

loans.name: Mohammad Din

texts.en: Mohammad D. lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan with all members of his family. He is educated and he has always wanted to be in business. He has a cobbler shop and he produces shoes and exports them to other shops in the city for sale. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take a individual loan to buy new stitching machines and some extra materials that he needs for his shop. He is very happy that he can expand his business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Manuela Victoria

texts.en:
Manuela Victoria runs a little cafeteria serving fried potatoes and cafe con leche (coffee with milk). She just got it going 8 months ago, and with this loan she'll have a stove to add more to her menu, including garnachas, enchiladas, pupusas (a tortilla with fried pork rind and cheese).  Garnachas are fried wedges of tortillas and topped with refried beans, cheese and chile sauce. Manuela is just 21 years old, but is married with three small children, and has big entrepreneurial ambitions. She's thinking that this year she might be able to open a little eatery in the nearby city of Quetzaltenango, and maybe more in the future. But with her current operation Manuela pays about US$13/day for food and supplies, and ends up making a profit of about US$6.00/day.  She pays rent of US$55 per month. Manuela is a member of the women's group "Nueva Esperanza" and is just beginning with Friendship Bridge.
Written by Kiva Fellows: Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay

loans.use: A stove to allow her to fix pupusas and garnachas (traditional Guatemalan food)

loans.name: Mohammad Kabir

texts.en: Mohammad Kabir lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and educated, but he has always liked to have his own business. He sells building supplies. He has a small shop, so he wants to enlarge his business. He wants to take an individual loan to buy extra materials for his shop and build a close relationship with the construction companies. He wants to make a good income for his family. He is happy with this loan.

loans.use: To buy extra materials

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina has been divorced from her husband for three years now, and has been responsible for earning her family's income ever since. Together with her two sons, she works on the family's plantation in order to make a living. Tina has applied for a loan of US$300, which she plans to use to buy chemicals and tools necessary for the plantation. She hopes to sell the produce grown on the plantation at a local market, and to make 240 Tala (US$96) in weekly profit.

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals and tools for a plantation

loans.name: Bukari

texts.id:
Bukari’s profession is a trader in recyclable materials to cover his family’s expenditure. Everyday he starts work at 7 in the morning and return home at 6 in the evening. Bukari purchase recyclable materials like used cardboard boxes, empty bottle, cans, iron, household equipment and others then these are resold to recycle consolidators. Profit generated by Bukari is used to fund this activities the balance to cover their daily living expenses. Besides that Bukari needs to pay the monthly lease for the room costing Rp. 150.000 (about USD16).

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Bukari berprofesi sebagai seorang Penjual barang bekas untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Setiaphari Bukari mulai bekerja pada pukul 07.00 pagi dan kembali lagi kerumah pukul 18.00 atau jam enam sore. Cara kerja Bukari adalah membeli barang-barang bekas seperti; kardus, botol kosong, kaleng, besi, peralatan rumatangga dan lain-lain yang kemudian barang-barang tersebut di jual lagi ke Pengepul barang bekas. Hasil yang didapatkan oleh Bukari digunakan lagi untuk modal usaha selain untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya bersama istri seiaphari. Selain itu juga Bukari harus membayar kontrakan kamar yang perbulannya harus dibayar dengan harga 150.000 rupiah.

loans.use: Capital for purchasing recyclable materials (Modal untuk membeli barang bekas)

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
Rohat is 45 years old. She is the loving mother of three kids, whom she is raising alone. Rohat is working hard in order to provide for her kids, give them all they need and pay for their education.

Rohat has been running her own business for four years to provide for her family. In the local market she sells shawls and headscarves and clothing for men. Rohat is very successful in her business, which is important since it is the only source of income for her family.

Rohat has received loans from IMON for more than two years. She has a positive credit history without any late payments. Today, Rohat requests $1,000.00 USD. This courageous woman plans to use the loan to increase the range of goods she sells so that she can improve the lives of her kids. Rohat shall repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase new goods for increase the number and type of goods

loans.name: Verónica Esperanza

texts.es:
"I own a small business in my house and I would like to invest in it to purchase more merchandise since it's missing several things. I also have plans to expand the store so that everything is well placed. But for now, I need to put together the capital for that which requires a greater investment". I am requesting $500 to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


“Tengo un negocio pequeño en mi vivienda y me gustaría invertir en la compra de mercancía ya que me hacen falta muchas cosas, tengo planes de ampliar para que todo este más acomodado pero por lo pronto necesito juntar el capital para eso ya que se requiere de una inversión mayor”. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio

loans.use: Invest in my business / Invertir en mi negocio

loans.name: Ear

texts.en: Mrs. Ear C., 42, works selling clothes in the market with her daughter, making on average about $10 per day. Her husband contributes to the family income by operating a service cleaning motorbikes and cars at home, earning about $5 a day. They have five children, two of whom are married and living away from home. To expand her business and meet customer demand, she requests a loan of $200 for the purchase of additional clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ilusion Group

texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband on the Eastern peninsula of Samana, DR. She has raised three children (ages: 24, 25, 26) and now focuses on her small business. She sells new clothing from a small store, and with the money from this loan she wants to buy a fresh supply of clothes to add to her store. In her free time she enjoys reading, and her favorite food is fish. She hopes that in the future she will see the Dominican economy get stronger and stronger.

This will be the 4th loan that “Ilusion” has applied for with Esperanza, and they all appreciate the support of Kiva lenders that has maD. this possible. On behalf of Esperanza, thank you for investing in the lives of these borrowers. The impact will be sustained far into the future!

loans.use: To buy new clothes to add to her current merchandise.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman is a mother who works selling snacks for school kids. Her kiosk is located strategically near a school so her business is quite good. Everyday she walks to buy merchandises for her kiosk in Badung market as her house is not too far away from the market. Besides selling snack, she also sells other food such as rujak buah (cut fruits with sour and spicy sauce) and lontong sayur (rice cake and vegetable with spicy coconut milk soup). Her regular customers are usually her own neighbours. The income from the kiosk is spent for capital and also for her daily life expenses. Ni Nyoman hopes that the loan can help her expand the kiosk.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman adalah seorang ibu yang berprofesi sebagai penjual makanan ringan dan konsumennya adalah anak-anak sekolah. Tempat berjualannya yang bersebelahan dengan sekolah cukup strategis, sehingga usahanya cukup lancar. Setiap harinya ia belanja kebutuhan warungnya di Pasar Badung dengan berjalan kaki, karena jarak antara rumah dan pasarnya tidak terlalu jauh. Selain menjual makanan ringan, dia juga menjual makanan lain seperti rujak buah dan lontong sayur. Biasanya pembelinya adalah tetangga-tetangganya sendiri. Hasil dari warungnya dipergunakan sebagai modal lagi dan juga memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Ni Nyoman berharap, pinjaman kali ini bisa membantunya mengembangkan warungnya.

loans.use: To add more capital

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en:
Fikret A. is a 40-year-old trader who owns a retail store. He is married and has two daughters and one son. This store is the only source of income for their family,

He opened his business in 2002 with a strategy of offering many different types of goods in one store. Fikret states that when people enter the store they find clothes which they purchase and then they need some shoes to coordinate with the clothing. That is the benefit of his store. He also sells housewares such as tablecloths and dishes.

Fikret is requesting a loan to expand the number and diversity of goods he sells in the store. He is focused on purchasing more summer clothes, because summer is 'wedding season' and women shop in his store more frequently to purchase special dresses for weddings.

loans.use: To expand the number and diversity of goods available for resale

loans.name: Sii

texts.en: Sii E., 60, is married with 12 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the Pancakes business. She sells to the village people and public 5 days per week. This loan is Sii's first with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Sii’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan received through SPBD will be use to further expand the business.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, frying pan (big one)

loans.name: Sine
