texts.en: Mrs. Sine E. lives in Preak Daung Village in Kandal Province, and she is a garment factory worker who makes a small salary to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Song Pol, is a fisherman, but he currently cannot do fishing because his boat is leaking and he does not have enough fishing equipment. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Sine E., decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat, and she would use the rest of the loan to buy ten-fish-net for her husband's business. Mrs. Sine E. is 36 years old and the mother of two children; the oldest one is a 12-year-old and he is attending school. The youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new boat and a ten-fish-net for her husband business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Juliana es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 3 hijos, Juliana junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual realizan transporte a la selva ayacuchana, su esposo es quien conduce el carro y viaja 3 veces por semana. Juliana antes vendía ropa en la selva ayacuchana, pero dejo de realizar porque tenia que cuidar a sus hijos. Además Juliana tiene una vulcanizadora en una avenida para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de personales, Juliana solo visita su negocio para supervisar la atención de su negocio.

Juliana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento mecánico de su carro. Juliana sueña con construir otra casa, tener una tienda, un restaurante y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the “Arco Iris” communal bank. Juliana lives with her husband, is 41 years old, and has 3 children. Juliana and her husband have a car, which they use for transport to the jungle in the area around Ayacucho. Her husband drives the car and makes the trip 3 times per week. Juliana used to sell clothing in the Ayacuchan jungle, but she quit doing this because she had to take care of her children. Additionally, Juliana owns a tire repair shop and has the help of employees. Juliana just goes to her business to supervise. Juliana needs a loan of 1000.00 soles, which will be invested in maintenance for her car. Juliana dreams of building a new house, having a store, a restaurant, and that her children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Juliana needs a loan of 1000.00 soles, which will be invested in maintenance for her car.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en:
Mehriniso S. is 40 years old. She lives with her spouse and her children. Every day, she goes to work very early in the morning. She wants to get ahead and achieve her goal of having her five children successfully finish school and enter University.

Her business is located in the local market called “Labi Daryo” and she sells clothes for women. Thanks to the support of her spouse and her own efforts, she was able to expand her business, which began with little inventory and in a small space. Her business is now in a bigger space and she has a large base of clients. With the loan of 3400 Somoni ($1000 USD), which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a greater variety of clothing styles to sell. She will also buy clothing for a variety of occasions and even purchase a few specific requests of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for women in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
Диндорова Мамлакат 1973 года рождения, она замужем и у нее один ребенок. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она  начала в 2005 году, с продажи женской одежды.  Она торгует на центральном рынке Гисара. Так как она сама женщина и разбирается очень хорошо в тканях ей легко. У нее много клиентов, как обычные покупатели, так и швейные цеха. В его ассортименте имеются  такие ткани как  шифон, шелк, штапель  и т.д.
Свой товар Мамлакат закупает в оптовых рынках. В момент осеннего сезона ей необходимы дополнительные средства для увеличения ассортимента и количество продаваемого товара. Для этого она хочет получить займ в сумме 3600 сомони.
texts.en:
Mamlakat D. was born in 1973, is married, and has one child. She began her business in 2005 when she started selling women’s clothes. She trades in the central market in Gisara. She is a woman, and understanding different fabrics comes easily to her. She has many customers, both from the general public as well as from professional sewing shops. Her inventory includes chiffon, silk, rayon, etc.

Mamlakat buys her goods in the wholesale market. This autumn, she needs money in order to increase the assortment and quantity of the goods she sells. To do this, she wants to take out a loan for 3,600 somoni.


Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seasonal fabric

loans.name: Mrs. Pao Soun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, led by Mrs. Pao S., a basket maker, consists of 21 members living in Ou Ta Sek Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Each will use the loan for different purposes. For example, Pao’s husband, Mr. Va Chor, is a farmer whose field is currently infertile, so Pao is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to support his field and make it more productive.

Mrs. Pao S. is 35 years old and the mother of six children, all attending the local school. The two M. in the picture are there in place of their wives.

This is a village bank loan consisting of 16 end-of-term loans and 5 monthly payment loans. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support her husband's field.

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
El tejido Y bordado, a mano de chompas, para adultos y niños, es una de las actividades mas comunes dentro la asociación “Gaviotas” que trabaja en el centro focal  de Villa Tejada. Además  de esta actividad algunas también se dedican al bordado de manteles y tejido en macramé, Todas casadas han encontrado en Pro-Mujer la oportunidad de crear pequeños negocios, que les permite obtener ganancias suficientes para el sustento diario de sus familias. 
La asociación Gaviotas desea ampliar sus ventas con el fin de obtener mayores ganancias, para esto precisa mayor capital para la compra de prima.
texts.en:
Weaving and hand embroidery of sweaters for adults and children is one of the most common activities within the "Gaviotas" (Seagulls) association, which works in the center of Villa Tejada. In addition to this activity, some people also embroider tablecloths and sew macrame. All of the married women have found in Pro-Mujer the opportunity to create small businesses that allow them to earn sufficient income to support their families. The Gaviotas association wants to increase their sales to achieve greater profits, so it needs more capital to buy quality materials.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: More capital is needed to buy high quality materials.

loans.name: Kov

texts.en:
Kov N., 30, lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She earns a living by selling grocery inventory from her house, selling items such as cooked food, plastic goods, and sweets for kids. She has a long time's experience in this business. She normally earns around $6 a day from her investment.

N. is married and currently takes care of two children; both of them are single and also attend school. Her husband is a local painter. He has been running his business very well, so that a lot of people recognize his good service.

N. works hard everyday and is very responsible for her family. Recently, she sold all her groceries from her store. Because grocery selling is N.'s main source of income to support her family's living expenses, she would like to ask for a loan of $1100 to purchase a range of groceries for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a range of groceries for sale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine R. currently sells beer from her home and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Twenty-eight years old and married to a businessman, she has three children, all in school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
For 3 years, Fatma has been selling bites (maandazi, chapati, and breads) in the Milinne neighborhood in Zanzibar. Fatma is 46 years old, divorced, and has two children: ages 25 and 18. She is a member of the Asaa Khery loan group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more flour and cooking oil for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to increase her business.

loans.use: Buy more flour and cooking oil for food business

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Meng R., 50, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the Takeo province. She makes and sells rice noodle to earn a living and is able to make approximately US $5 eveR. day.

Her husband has a water pump and he services farmers. On average, he makes US $6 in revenue per day. Two of their children are construction workers and one is in school.

Meng R. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to operate a motor-taxi business. (Meng is pictured with her husband).

loans.use: Operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is engaged in hog raising. Maintaining her business requires her to invest some capital in feed. To sustain her business, she wishes to borrow 5000 PHP. She works hand in hand with her husband to meet the needs of their family. She prays that somehow she will be successful in this venture. “It is through God that we can do more than what we can do in our lives”, says Celia.

Celia is happily married to Charlie and they have five children: Rodante – 36 years old and Benedict – 34 years old, they are both factory workers; Mary Jane – 32 years old, a domestic helper in Singapore; Mary Ann – 30 years old, a housewife and their youngest is Maribel – 27 years old. Celia and her husband are living together at Barangay Tandul in Cabatuan, Isabela.

loans.use: Investment in hog raising business

loans.name: Maura Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Maura del Socorro López Cáceres , tiene la edad de 61 años , habita en el barrio Juan Ramón Padilla , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , ella es madre soltera , tiene seis hijos , ya todos mayor de edad , trabajan por cuenta propia ella tiene una pulpería el cual ha ido incrementando poco a poco también sus hijos le apoyan con algunos gastos de la casa , doña Maura quiere mejorar su vivienda , ya que se acerca el invierno y no quiere que se le pase el agua , como en años anteriores , Ella inicio a construir con el apoyo de su hija , pero ella ya esta casada .La señora  quiere el financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción y poder hacer las mejoras necesarias como cambiar el techo de su vivienda. Este es su sexto ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por contribuir a las mejoras de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maura del Socorro López Cáceres, 61, lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood, which is located in the Ticuantepe municipality. She is a single mother, and she has six grown children who all work on their own. She has a small mini market that has been growing little by little. Her children help her with some of the household expenses. Maura would like to improve her home. Since winter is coming, she does not want water to leak into the house as it has done in previous years. She started construction with her daughter’s help, but now her daughter is married. She wants the loan to buy construction materials. She will then be able to make the needed improvements, like changing the roof on her home. This is her sixth loan cycle with Afodenic. She is thankful that they have contributed to improvements for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair the roof on her home

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86573&_tpos=5&_tpg=1
Carmen Rosa es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos
Carmen Rosa  es soltera, tiene 45 años,  estudio para profesora de primaria, pero por motivos  familiares, tuvo que dejar de enseñar en el colegio. Estudio zapatería  y se está dedicando a  hacer zapatos de tela y pantuflas. 
Desde que Carmen Rosa  esta en Finca, las capacitaciones han ayudado para ampliar su visión de negocio, y para trazarse metas nuevas. 
Carmen Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de material para hacer zapatos  
El sueño de Carmen Rosa es tener una empresa de confección de pijamas y pantuflas.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the Los Viñedos (The Vineyards) Communal Bank. Carmen Rosa is 45 years of age and single. She studied to become a primary school teacher, but for family reasons, she had to leave her studies. She studied shoemaking and now she makes cloth shoes and slippers. Since Carmen Rosa has been working with FINCA Peru, the trainers have been helping her to expand her vision of business so that she can set herself some new goals. Carmen Rosa needs a loan of 1,400 Sols to purchase materials for making shoes. Her dream is to have a business manufacturing pajamas and slippers. Click HERE to see her Previous Loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material for making shoes.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
Asunta es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores .
Asunta  es conviviente tiene  41 años, dos hijos de 12 y 8 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Asunta estudio enfermaría pero no la ejerció, se puso a vender en los mercados  como ambulante por 18 años, hasta  que decidió confeccionar buzos en su casa y también  consiguió trabajo como enfermera.   
Desde que esta en Finca Asunta aprendió a ser responsable con los pagos, ser unidas, con sus compañeras. 
Asunta necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para compra de ropa por temporada.
El sueño de Asunta es que sus hijos sean profesionales y darles lo mejor.
texts.en:
Asunta is a member of The Flowers cooperative bank. Asunta is married, 41 years old, and has two children ages 12 and 8 that are studying at the public school. Asunta studied nursing, but never practiced. She started selling at the markets by the age of 18, until she decided to make sweatsuits from her home. She also got a job as a nurse. Since she has been with Finca, Asunta has learned how to be responsible with her payments and how to work in conjunction with her colleagues. Asunta needs a loan of 1,200 soles to buy seasonal clothing. Asunta’s dream is to see her children become professionals, and to be able to provide the very best for them.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Asunta needs a loan of 1,200 soles to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en:
Tumenbayar T. lives with his wife in the Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He is 34 and just got married to his wife last year. Tumenbayar drives a micro van between Arhangai province and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been driving the passenger van between the aimag (province) and Ulaanbaatar for the last nine years. He started his business with a purchase of a small van with 1,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) and today he owns two vans valued at 3,500,000 MNT. 

As he is an experienced driver, customers are happy to choose his service for the long trip. In the future, he hopes to purchase a big bus in order to be able to carry more people at once. He requests a loan to purchase new accessories and tires for his micro van.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Thol Tun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan Thol T. is a 46-year-old widow with five children: one of whom is a coconut seller, while another is a construction worker and the others are attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand by purchasing more piglets to breed to earn more income for her family. 

Mrs. Chan Thol T. has been selected to be the village bank president by its nine members. This village bank is located in Khav village in Takeo province. The members plan to use their loan for different purposes. 

One member in this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn P. is a 22 year old farmer from Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She is married to Noel P. and is blessed with one child. Now she is helping her spouse on the farm. They are tilling a 1.5 hectare farm and have toiled so hard to achieve an abundant harvest. 

She would like to ask for a loan worth Php 6,000. She will use the loan to purchase 3 sacks of rice seeds and 4 sacks of complete fertilizers.

Now she is joining with the other entrepreneurs in their village. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage services as well.

loans.use: To purchase 3 sacks of rice seeds and 4 sacks of complete fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, y es madre de 2 hijos, ella estudió educación secundaria (completa), vive en el Barrio Huascar.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para aumentar su capital para la compra de calzados.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, este monto ella lo invertirá en la compra de calzados que los encarga a la provincia de Trujillo.
Su deseo es  continuar trabajando  

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los pagos y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de calzados.

loans.name: Flores De Chacaltaya Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, “Alto Lima”, se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Flores de Chacaltaya”, ellas están juntas hace aproximadamente 10 años. Actualmente están solicitando un nuevo préstamo para seguir mejorando sus negocios ya que todas tienen diferentes negocios como el tejido de chompas, venta de papa, atención de llamadas, venta de fruta, aceite, lubricantes y comida. 

Elsa Q. de 31 años y Paola C. de 22 años, ambas integrantes del grupo, tejen chompas  y necesitan el préstamo para comprar lana al  por mayor y seguir operando.

Nolverta M. de 65 años, vende papa y chuño (papa deshidratada),  en la zona Alto Lima y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.

Lucia C. de 38 años vente lubricantes  en la zona de Alto Lima, ella tiene un puesto fijo donde atiende todos los días, también necesita del préstamo  para comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
In one of the central focal points in Pro Woman, Alto Lima ("Tall Lime"), is the Community Association "Chacaltaya Flowers," and these women have been together for about 10 years. Currently they are requesting a new loan to continue to improve their business now that all of the women have different responsibilities such as weaving sweaters, selling potatoes, phone reception, and selling fruit, lubricants and food. Elsa Q., 31 years old, and Paola C., 22 years old, both part of the group, knit sweaters and need the loan in order to buy wool wholesale and continue operating. Nolverta M., 55 years old, sells fresh and dehydrated potatoes in the Alto Lima zone and needs the loan in order to buy goods. Lucia C., 38 years old, sells lubricants in the Alto Lima zone; she has a permanent stand where she works every day. She also needs the loan in order to be able to buy commodities.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials and commodities

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en: Zeina is a 30-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has owned a mini market at her town since 2006 because she needed to work, to feel independent, and to help her family financially. Today, Zeina is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy more merchandise so she can increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Mrs. Nara Toun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which located in Spean Thmar village in Kandal province consists of 23 people and all the members will use the loan in different purpose. Mrs. Nara T. is a village bank president and she is a perfume seller. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more perfume products to re-sell for an income. Her husband, Mr. Prum Sophal, is a construction worker and he is also a farmer. Mrs. Nara T. is 30 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or stuD. because that child is on the age of 2 years old. All the members are shown in the picture B. some of whom are blocked.

Eight members in this village loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more perfume products to re-sell for an income.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 35-year-old married mother of two children ages 7 and 9. Both of her children attend school. She resides and owns a two-room house which she shares with four people. Rose takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but lacks piped water. 

Rose owns a stall selling food like bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes in Naguru. She does not pay rent on the stall, but pays monthly market dues and operation license fees. She works in the outskirts of Kampala, Uganda. Rose has been in this business for ten years with MCDT. She does not pay transport costs to and from the market. Her challenges include defaulters and the ever-increasing cost of foodstuffs. Rose wants to use this loan to buy more goods to sell. She hopes to seeher business grow stronger so she can start buying from farmers directly.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like cassava, sweet potatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es:
El señor Ovidio R. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Adriana Gómez y sus tres hijos.
El señor Ovidio trabaja como chofer de transporte publico y su esposa realiza costura de manteles que vende en oficinas de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para el acabado de la construcción de dos habitaciones para habitarlas y así tener espacio principalmente para sus hijos.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Ovidio R. lives in his parents' house, in the zone of Pasankeri, on the west hillside of the city of La Paz, together with his wife, Mrs. Adriana Gomez, and their three children. Mr. Ovidio works as a chauffeur in public transportation and his wife sews tablecloths that she sells in offices of the city, income which supports their family. The requested credit will be used to finish the construction of 2 rooms, in order to have enough space principally for their children. This is the fourth time that they have requested a loan, and a socioeconomic analysis qualifies them favorably to access this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish the construction of two rooms in his house for greater comfort for his children

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: La señora Manuela es una mujer honesta, trabajadora y alegre, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 47 años y es madre soltera de dos hijos los cuales son su motivo para seguir adelante, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, pues cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su casa. Paralelamente da pensión a los empleados de una empresa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Carmen Cabrejos” desde hace 9 años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles y lo invirtió en la compra de gaseosas. En la actualidad ella requiere un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar productos de abarrotes y bebidas para  vender en su bodega. La meta de Manuela es ampliar su bodega y progresar. Además agregó que gracias al Movimiento Manuela Ramos ha podido progresar pese a que tuvo muchas dificultades.
texts.en:
Manuela, 47, is an honest, cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is a single mother of two children, who are the motivating force for her to continue forward. She sells general merchandise from a small store set up in her home. She also provides daily meals to the employees of a company. For the last 9 years she's been a member of the "Carmen Cabrejos" communal bank. Her first, 300 sol loan, was used to buy soft-drinks. She now needs a 2000 sol loan to buy grocery items and beverages to sell in her store. Manuela's goal is to enlarge her store and get ahead. In addition, she thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to ge this far despite the many difficulties she encountered.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items and beverages.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is 35 years old and happily married with four children. She sells crates of drinks at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. With this business, she hopes to meet the basic needs and necessities of her family members. She hopes to own a drink factory in the future. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Chamel

texts.en: ChamE. is a 28-year-old single man living in Al Mary, Southern Lebanon. ChamE. works with things necessary for interior design decorations such as fake ceilings and wooden floors. He has been doing this since 2004. ChamE. requested a loan from Al Majmoua to buy necessary equipment for his business and to invest in some agricultural land. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and relatives. He believes his special way of working is his strong point. In the future, ChamE. plans to own a decorating company that can compete with the available ones.

loans.use: To purchase necessary equipment for his business

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LUCERO” y viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Los socios se reúnen cada 30 días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa y esta conformado por 24 socios. En el video se ve que la asesora hace juramentar a la nueva junta directiva del banco comunal. La nueva presidenta da unas palabras de saludos por las fiestas navideñas y por el año nuevo a los socios.

Nuestros socios tienen pequeños negocios en sus propios domicilios como por ejemplo: Clorinda tiene una carpintería, Luz mariana tiene una panadería, Soledad y Bony cada una tiene una tienda de abarrotes, Carmen tiene un restaurante, Mercedes vende productos secos, Ismael vende auto partes de carros y Francisca vende carne de cordero. 
Otros socios dan servicios como la socia Luz Marina que es profesora del nivel inicial, Justina es empleada del hogar, Delia es secretaria en el colegio I.E.I. “San Jerónimo” y Los socios Vilma y Juan que son esposos y tienen un negocio familiar de servicio de agencia de transportes terrestre que llevan pasajeros a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. 

Nuestra socia Bertha tiene 34 años es casada y tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica a lavar ropa de sus amigas y sus vecinas todos los días, de esa forma ayuda al ingreso económico de su familia. La socia es una madre emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a sus hijos. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia require el prestamo para el gasto familiar. 
  
Los socios que tienen negocios requieren el préstamo para comprar productos como madera, harina, arroz, azúcar, auto partes y los que brindan servicios para el gasto familiar como la educación de sus hijos.       

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “Lucero” communal bank and they live in the city of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. The group meets every 30 days in the main office of the Asociación Ararwia and it is made up of 24 members. In the video you can see the advisor swearing in the communal bank’s new executive board. The new president says a few words of holiday and New Years greetings to the members. Our members have small businesses in their own homes, such as: Clorinda has a carpentry shop, Luz Mariana has a bakery store, Soledad and Bony each have a small grocery store, Carmen has a restaurant, Mercedes sells dry food products, Ismael sells car parts, and Francisca sells lamb meat. Other members provide services: Luz Marina is a pre-school teacher, Justina is a domestic, Delia is a secretary at the high school I.E.I. “San Jeronimo”, and Vilma and Juan, who are spouses, have a family-owned bus company that takes passengers to the city of Puerto Maldonado. Our member Bertha is 34 years old, she is married and has two children. She washes clothes for her friends and neighbors every day and in this way she helps with an income for her family. She is an entrepreneurial and hardworking mother who helps her children get ahead in life. She has been in this line of work for several years and things have gone well for her because of the effort she puts into her work. She will put her loan towrds her family's living expenses. The members who have the business need the loan to buy products such as wood, flour, rice, sugar, and car parts, while those who provide services need it for family expenses such as their children’s education. The members value and appreciate the loan granted to them through this program and they are committed to making their repayments in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members who have the business need the loan to buy products such as wood, flour, rice, sugar, and car parts, while those who provide services need it for family expenses such as their children’s education.

loans.name: Carmen's Group

texts.en:
Carmen M. is from the village of Santa Cruz in Tangub City. She is 55 years old. Carmen is the leader of a 5-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Carmen is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Carmen runs a general store where she sells a variety of different products, such as shampoo, sugar, salt, noodles, juice packs, Milo (chocolate milk powder), and eggs, in the local community. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP each month from these activities.

In 2010, Carmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmen is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Carmen's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarom O. is 32 years old and lives in Pech Changva village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice.

In order to grow crops and support their farming conditions, Mrs. Sarom O. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide. She would use the rest of the loan to hire a laborer for the farm.

Mrs. Sarom O. is the mother of three children who are between 1 and 11 years old. Two of her children are currently in school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to hire a laborer

loans.name: Reina Guadalupe

texts.es: Reina Guadalupe M. C. de 20 años de edad, vive junto a su madre y a su pequeña hija de 9 meses de edad. Reside en casa propia, la cual esta ubicada  en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Reina posee una tortillería, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa, desde hace un tiempo atrás que ella se dedica a este oficio, debido a que es madre soltera, y que su madre sufre una enfermedad muy grabe, la cual le impide trabajar. Es por esta razón que Reina debe trabajar muy duro por seguir adelante tratando de crecer en su negocio de tortillas, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta. Reina solicitó un préstamo a Integral con la esperanza de poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que por medio de este ella comprará mayor cantidad de maíz, el cual al comprarlo por mayor lo obtiene a precios más bajos. Esto será de mucho beneficio para ella ya que le permitirá atender mayor demanda, lo cual le brindará mayores ganancias. Esto llena de muchas esperanzas a Reina ya que contará con el dinero necesario para brindarle todos los tratamientos médicos que su madre necesita.
texts.en:
Reina Guadalupe M. C. is 20 years old and lives together with her mother and her small, 9-month-old child. She lives in her own house, which is located in the department of Ahuachapán. Reina owns a tortilla shop, which is located in her own home. She has been in this business for some time, due to the fact that she is a single mother and her mother has a serious illness. This is why Reina must work very hard to continue progressing and trying to help her tortilla business grow, as it is the only source of income that she has. Reina requested a loan from Integral with the hope of being able to improve her business conditions. With this loan, she will purchase more corn and with purchasing it at wholesale price, it will be at a lower price. This will be of great benefit to her, as it will help her meet higher demand and provide her with higher earnings. This gives Reina a lot of hope, since she will have the necessary money to provide her mother with all of the medical treatments that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale corn

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal “SARITA COLONIA”, está conformado por 8 miembros emprendedores quienes viven en L. zona alta D. Huaycán, distrito D. Ate, departamento D. Lima, trabajan con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad recientemente.
Ofelia quien es socia del grupo, tiene 49 años, es separada desD. hace 19 años, tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales 2 son menores D. edad. Ofelia asume el cargo D. presidenta desD. el 09 D. marzo del presente. DesD. hace 4 años se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes, gaseosas en su vivienda además realiza ventas en forma ambulante en una avenida principal D. Huaycan en donD. ofrece ropa D. niños y adultos. Con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo ha logrado construir su vivienda y pagar L. deuda que tiene con el Banco D. materiales del Perú. El gran sueño D. Ofelia es seguir y crecer  en el negocio D. L. venta D. prendas D. vestir llegar a  tener más mercadería y diversificar sus productos.
Con el préstamo otorgado será utilizado para invertir en ambos negocios. Agradecen el apoyo brindado e iniciativa para su constitución como Alcancía Comunal y prometen cumplir con los pagos establecidos en las fechas pactadas.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Sarita Colonia” has 8 entrepreneurial members who live in the high zone of Huaycán in the district of Ate and the department of Lima. They work with the newly prospering EDAPROSPO. Ofelia, a member of the group, is 49 years old. She has been separated 19 years and has six kids, two of which are minors. Ofelia has assumed the responsibility of president of the group, from March 9th until present. For four years, she has sold groceries and soft drinks from her home, and she also is an intinerant vendor on a main street in Huaycán where she offers adult and children’s clothes. Because of her hard work, she has succeeded in building her home and paying off the debt she had with the “Banco D. Materiales” [Materials Bank] of Peru. Ofelia’s big dream is to continue and grow her business selling pieces of clothing, to be able to have more merchandise, and to diversify her products. The granted loan will be used to invest in both businesses. The group appreciates the support and the initiative for the creation of the communal bank. They promise to fulfill the specified payments on the agreed upon dates.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia G., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For investment in two businesses.

loans.name: Mileidy

texts.es:
Mileidy S. P.  es una señora de 36 años de edad la cual vive solamente con sus 2 hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Doña mileidy  desde hace algunos años inicio su propio negocio una pulpería. Ella pensó que fue una excelente idea ya  que el negocio que existía no satisfacía la demanda de la comunidad.  Con este negocio ha logrado tener  una actividad económica rentable que la ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida. Pero en este momento  su local se ha deteriorado  y necesita mejorar las condiciones de este para seguir teniendo éxito con su negocio.

Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢665.000 (seiscientos sesenta y cinco  mil colones) para comprar los materiales necesarios para reconstruir su local y poder seguir con su negocio que tanto le ha ayudado a superarse y sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos. Asegura que mejorar su negocio es muy importante ya que por medio de él es que ha podido superarse por su propia cuenta. 

Doña Mileidy es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito pueden ayudar a muchas mujeres a superarse por sí solas.
texts.en:
Mileidy S. P. is a 36-year old woman who lives alone with her 2 children in a community called Los Chiles, located in the Alajuela province. This community is known for being mountainous and for its proximity to our country’s northern border. Her primary activities are raising livestock and farming, more specifically, the planting of basic grains, sugar cane, and citrus. A few years ago, Mileidy started her own general store business. She thought this an excellent idea, since the businesses that existed in the area did not meet the community’s needs. With this business, she has managed to become profitable and improve her standard of living. However, currently, her business location has deteriorated and she needs to improve conditions so that her business can succeed. She needs a loan of 665,000 colones to buy the necessary materials to rebuild her locale and continue with her business, one that has greatly helped her and her 2 children get ahead. She assures us that refurbishing her business is very important since, by this means, she has been able to succeed on her own. Mileidy is a member of the Manantial de Santa Fe cooperative bank, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This would be her first loan and, through it, she hopes to grow both personally and financially. She also stresses that it is thanks to these types of organizations, which facilitate access to credit, that many women have managed to get ahead on their own.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her business locale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 47 years old. He is married and has two children, who are in school. He runs a taxi business in Nairobi to earn a living. John has twenty years of experience in this business. He was previously employed as a mechanic, before starting his taxi business. He has requested for a loan of KES 70,000 from Faulu Kenya to repair his vehicle and to add another car. He plans to run a car hire business in ten years time. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle and add another car for his business

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es el Sra. ANDREA,  Nuestra socia tiene 38 años  casada y tiene 4 hijos, de 19, 17, 15, 6 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista ella tiene  un  pequeño negocio de venta de chicha en su casa, la socia misma lo elabora con maíz fermentado, Nuestra socia también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados y a su respectivo engorde, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder compra un torete pequeño, ella tiene 2 toros actualmente.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Sacro Community Bank. She is a native of the Cruz Pata community, in the town of Chinchero, Urubamba province, department of Cusco. Andrea is 38 years old, married, and has four children who are 19, 17, 15, and 6 years old. She alternates her various activities with her retail business. Andrea has a small business selling chicha (a sweet drink made of corn) from her home; she makes the chicha herself from fermented corn. She also buys and sells livestock, as well as raising them. Andrea requests this loan to buy a small bull; she currently has two bulls. Andrea is thankful and appreciative of the support offered here and promises to pay what she owes in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a small bull

loans.name: Jamileh

texts.en:
Jamileh is a 51 year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. She is married.

Jamileh owns a printing shop. She also owns computers for people who want to work or access Internet services. Her customers include friends and other community members.

She is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. She plans to use the loan to invest in a computer and a printer for her shop. In the future, Jamileh hopes to further expand her business and provide greater support to her family.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a printer for her shop.

loans.name: M. Paulin

texts.fr: H. M. Paulin est né le 19 Novembre 1987 à Kétonou au Bénin. Marié à MOUSSA Nafissatou, une couturière, Paulin est père de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Paulin vit avec sa famille depuis neuf ans, à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Paulin n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris le métier d’électricien bâtiment. C’est cette activité que Paulin mène depuis quatre ans, et qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. A côté, Paulin vend de façon ambulante, des matériels électriques (fils, interrupteurs, multiprises, etc.). Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits,  Paulin sollicite pour une première fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé. Paulin envisage prochainement, ouvrir une boutique pour vendre ses produits.
texts.en:
Mr. H. M. Paulin was born on November 19, 1987 in Kétonou, Benin. Married to Ms. MOUSSA Nafissatou, a seamstress, he is the father of three children, who are all in school. He has lived with his family for nine years in Lokokoukoumè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. Family expenses are covered by the couple. Paulin did not attend school, but he learned the trade of building electrician that he has work at for four years. It allows him to provide for his family. On the side, he sells electrical supplies and equipment (wire, circuit breakers, power strips, etc.) door-to-door. With the goal of bolstering his working capital and increasing his inventory, Paulin is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the first time. He envisions opening a store soon to sell his products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying electrical supplies and equipment

loans.name: Masianday Ii Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Masianday II” group. They are small-scale-business people in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and make better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve and they will at least be able to provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills in case any of them fall sick.

Kadiatu C. is the leader of this group. She was born in Bumbuna, about 35 miles from Magburaka. She is 38 years of age, is married to a businessman, and they have four children – two in secondary school and two in primary school.

Kadiatu sells chewing gum, cigarettes, bathing soap, batteries, biscuits, rice, etc., and has been a businesswoman for twelve years now. With her share of the loan, she will increase her business inventory by buying wholesale the above mentioned items.

loans.use: To buy chewing gum, cigarettes, bathing soap, batteries, biscuits, rice, etc., for her store

loans.name: Hajidmaa

texts.en:
Hajidmaa T. is a 36-year-old single mother who lives with her three children and her mother in Uvurhangai province, central Mongolia, in a 2-storey- house. Hajidmaa currently operates a clothing business in her town to support her family. She started her business in 1997 and since then she has been operating it in a stable fashion out of a rented stall at the local market. She has found success in her new trade and attributes this to her good business knowledge and selling skills. 

Hajidmaa has purchased a new container where she will sell her products and work separately and independently from her friends. Hajidmaa is very hard-working, optimistic and is persistent in achieving her goal. She has been considered as a reliable borrower of Xacbank. She says, "My business is continuing quite well. I began running it with my friends, but now I am able to employ a salesperson. I am trying  my best to own my own store with the help of my children,  and I wish them to grow up to be highly educated people in the future." Hajidmaa is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase and import more clothes from Erlian city in China for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en:
Mr. Chheang D., 53 (pictured above), and his wife, Mrs. Sokny Lun, 49, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 20 kilometers away. They have been married for 20 years and have four children: three sons and one daughter. The eldest son is a truck driver and the other three are in school. 

Chheang has been a motor taxi driver since 1992. He drives in Phnom Penh. His wife is a garment factory worker. Unfortunately, his motorbike is old, which costs him a lot of money to repair. Facing this problem, he is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike. He will be able to continue his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Nghiêm

texts.en: M.  Nghiêm

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el anexo Santa Rosa del caserío Lagunas, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, este distrito se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su población situada en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre si. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega – tienda situada en su domicilio desde hace tres años. Ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de artículos de uso diario por los cuales tendrían que movilizarse hasta el pueblo de Mórrope para adquirirlos. El negocio goza de buena acogida ya que ella siempre trata de brindar un buen trato y productos de calidad a sus clientes. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ayuda a sus padres con el sostenimiento de la economia de su familia.

Wilder desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos de modo que pueda satiafacer la demanda de sus clientes y percibir mayores ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Wilder es una persona tranquila y responsable. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Wilder is 34 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the annex Santa Rosa of the village of Lagunas, a rural area in the district of Mórrope. This district is characterized by having the majority of the population living in rural areas with a lot of distance in between them. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He works selling basic necessities and groceries in a store that has been located in his house for the past three years. He offers his customers all types of goods for daily use, which he had to move from the town of Mórrope where he purchased them. The business gets a lot of business and Wilder always tries to offer a good deals and quality products to his customers. With the income he receives from this business he helps his parents support the family financially. Wilder wants to help his business grow by buying more products so he can meet the demand of his clients and receive greater profits. To accomplish his goal he has seen the need to request a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Wilder is a very calm and responsible person. In the area where he lives, his neighbors and acquaintances consider him a calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic necessities and groceries to expand the store installed in his house.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena P. is from the village of Mabini, Baliangao. She is 44 years old, married and has six children, three are adult-aged and three are school-aged. To make a living, Magdalena owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Magdalena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used for house repair. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Magdalena from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa A. is from the village of San Lorenzo. She is 48 years old. Elsa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business manufacturing & selling charcoal to local businesses and community members. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Elsa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Elsa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Melisa Ethefu

texts.en:
Melisa Ethefu O. is a 38-year-old skilled and experienced business lady who has longstanding relationships with her school and pupils. She operates her own private school where she earns a living. She is married to Mahero Mutsoli; they have three children aged 17 years, 13 years and six years respectively.

Melisa started her business in 2000 with Ksh.20,000 start-up capital, working in Eldoret town. She has been in this business for the past ten years with an income of Kshs.247,000 per month.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and she is applying for her first loan of Kshs.40,000 with KADET LTD. With her loan she plans to build more classrooms and make desks.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur REVIEW Melisa Ethefu  from  Kenya

loans.use: To build more classrooms and make desks

loans.name: Bak

texts.en: Bak S., 56, is married and lives with four of her children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband sell rice and typically make about $2 each day and are supported by three children working in the garment factory. Bak S. is asking for a loan of $250 to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Lady Marilin

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

La señora Lady es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, se desempeña como fiscal de pagos del Banco y le gustan las reuniones y las charlas. Ella tiene 50 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos, tres mayores y una menor que es la que vive con ella. Su marido es mecánico. Ella aprendió corte  y confección ya que su familia que se dedicaba a esta profesión.

Es modista y tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, confecciona todo tipo de ropa pero lo que más le gusta hacer es ropa de mujer y de niñas, trabaja todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 21h00 y en ciertos casos hasta más tarde, le cose a personas que llegan hasta su local y  también cose ropa y la vende hecha.

Este crédito es para comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura.  Su sueño es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
In El Progreso neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo, the 'Ilusiones' community bank meets every fortnight.  This is a marginal urban area which is very densely populated and known as the 'jail district' since the women's jail of Portoviejo is found there.

Lady is a founding member of the community bank.  Her role in the bank is that of payment collector and she likes the bank's meetings and talks.  Lady is 50 years old.  She is married and has four children from her marriage.  Three of her children are grown up and one daughter is still living with her.  Lady's husband is a mechanic.  She learned dressmaking because her family is in the profession.

Lady is a dressmaker and she has a small sewing workshop in her home.  She makes all kinds of clothes but what she most likes making is women's and girls' clothes.  She works every day from 7.00am to 9.00pm and sometimes even later.  She sews for people who come to her business and she also sews clothes and sells them.

This loan will be used to buy fabric and other materials for her sewing.  Her dream is to finish building her house.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita L. is 51 years old from Bitadton, Culasi, Antique, Philippines. She is married to Hector L. Sr. and they are blessed with two children, both of them are still in school.

They earn a living through farming and hog fattening, which helps them sustain the needs of the family.

Margarita has been an active member of ASHI Antique North Branch since 2004. Being a member, she maintains 100% credit rating in repayments, attendance and project. She has also availed some incentive loans from ASHI such as house repair loans and educational loans.

For her next loan she is requesting 15,000 PHP to use as additional capital to her hog-fattening project.

Her greatest dream in life is that her eldest child, Hector, will finish college and by that, he also helps his younger sister, Hyniah, to pursue her dreams. In addition to that, Margarita is also dreaming that someday their standard of living will improve.

loans.use: Hog fattening

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.es: Liliana Díaz V.  de 44 años es una mujer emprendedora que inició su experiencia de negocio desde el año 2005, cuando compraba colonias, talcos, cremas y champoo mediante guías especializadas de productos, posteriormente con sus utilidades logró comprar un enfriador e inició la venta de bebidas   los fines de semanas en la puerta de su casa y ese es ahora su principal negocio. Las cajas de cervezas le salen a $33.600 COP y obtiene una utilidad de $11.800 COP por cajas, vende 20 cajas semanales,   como también vende   mercancía a crédito tiene unas cuentas por cobrar que rotan cada 19 días, mientras sus mercancías lo hacen  cada 30, obteniendo una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de 25% y una liquidez de 2.8% y una capacidad de pago de un 35 % incluyendo el crédito.  Desde que inició su vinculación a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo su negocio ha mejorado porque tiene efectivo disponible para comprar de contado y con descuentos, igualmente ha podio agregar productos a su canasta de ofertas por lo cual sus clientes la prefieren.  Liliana es casada y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 14 a 22 años y con su cónyuge han logrado sacarlos adelante, así como  su negocio ha sido un gran respaldo para este fin.  Su sueño ahora se encamina a comprar una casa y ampliar su patrimonio, porque espera tener un techo propio que ofrecerle a su familia. Con su credikiva comprará bebidas por cajas y refrescos pues se acerca la temporada de  fiestas como grados, cierres de año, navidad que hacen que sus ventas se incrementen especialmente en lo relacionado con estos productos.
texts.en:
Liliana Díaz V. is 44 years old.  She is an enterprising woman who started her business experience in 2005 when she bought aftershaves, talcum powder, creams and shampoo through specialist product guides.  With her profits she managed to buy a refrigerator and started selling drinks on weekends from the doorway of her home.  This is now her main business.

Boxes of beer cost 33,600 Colombian pesos and she makes 11,800 pesos profit per box.  She sells 20 boxes a week.  She also sells merchandise on credit.  Her accounts receivable turnover is 19 days whilst her merchandise turnover is 30 days.  Her profitability on sales is 25%, her liquidity is 2.8% and her payment capacity is 35%, including the loan.

Since she joined Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Liliana's business has improved because she has had cash available so that she can make her purchases in cash and thereby obtain a discount.  She has also been able to add products to her basket of offers which has made her loyal customers.  Liliana is married and has 3 children aged 14 to 22 and, together with her husband, she has managed to get them ahead in life.  Her business has been a great support in achieving this goal.  Her dream now is to buy a house and expand her estate because she hopes to have her own home to offer to her family.

Liliana will use her Kiva loan to buy boxes of drink and soft drinks since the party season is approaching with graduations, end-of-year parties and Christmas.  This season sees her sales increase, especially as far as these products are concerned.

loans.use: To buy boxes of drink and soft drinks as party season is approaching with graduations, end-of-year celebrations and Christmas.  This is a season which sees her sales increase

loans.name: Gerta Ligia

texts.es:
la joven Gerta Ligia V. tiene 26 años de edad, vive en la colonia Nuevos Colorados y se dedica a la produccion de cuajada, tambien tiene cria de cerdos.
su producto lo distribuye en Choluteca y en la cuidad de Tegucigalpa a personas que le hacen pedidos todas las semanas, los cerdos los vende mensualmente a varios compradores que vienen de San Lorenzo.
Gerta realiza esta actividad junto con su madre, trabajan duro para salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leche de vaca y pastillas de cuajo.
texts.en:
Gerta Ligia V. is a young woman of 26.  She lives in Nuevos Colorados and she makes 'cuajada' (a compact, cheese product).  She also raises pigs.  Gerta sells her products in Choluteca and in the city of Tegucigalpa to people who make orders with her every week.  She sells her pigs monthly to a number of buyers who come from San Lorenzo.

Gerta works in this business together with her mother.  They work hard to get ahead and have a better quality of life.  She will use her loan to buy cow's milk and rennet tablets.

loans.use: To buy cow's milk and rennet tablets

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres y hermanos en  uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, la maracuyá y el limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo ella siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

Mariela se vale de esta actividad para salir adelante y apoyar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria. Ella desea  desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500  nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.
texts.en:
Mariela is 21 years old and single. She lives with her parents and siblings in one of the hamlets in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, a semitropical climate zone which mainly produces fruits like mango, passion fruit and lemon. Tambogrande is in the Piura region and is four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Mariela sells beauty products and cosmetics through a catalog. She has a group of customers who buy their products often. The more orders she processes, the more perks she gets from the company that provides her with the products, and therefore the greater the profits she makes. For this reason she always strives to get more and more customers.

Through this activity Mariela supports her family´s daily expenses. She wants enough capital to purchase more products and have a fixed stock of cosmetics that will allow her customers to buy the products they need quickly and not have to wait until the end of the month, when the orders are delivered. That´s why she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 soles to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: Buy more products so as to have a stock of cosmetic products.

loans.name: Khalida Muhammad Rafiq's Group

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Kamoki, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She lives there with her family in the area named Mor Amenabad in a two-roomed brick house. Khalida is 45 years old and married to M. R.. She has a 22-year-old son. Her husband operates a construction supplies business and his son also helps in this business. Khalida's husband has run this business for over 20 years and is well known due to the quality of his items and his good manner with customers.
Khalida herself is a talented lady who shares the financial burden with her husband by running an embroidery business. She has a number of customers in the neighboring areas who give her regular orders and she earns a good income by completing them on time. Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as cement, bricks, sand etc. in bulk, which will help meet customers' needs and earn extra income.
Khalida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for resale

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 38 years old and married. She supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: a general store, a farming business and a vegetable vending business. She lives in Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, farming and vegetable vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000. 

Liezel is borrowing PHP 14,000 so that she can fund operations of her general store. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Liezel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to join the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Mr. Ramon is 41 years old; he is married and has two kids. He is a builder, and he performs plumbing work, carpentry and masonry in general.  He first began over 10 years ago, so he takes care of the supervision and execution of different jobs.

He requested this loan from the Foundation so he could buy shovels, buckets, hammers, nails, etc., to perform good quality work. These are items that  need renewal due to constant use.  Mr. Ramon thanks the Foundation and Kiva for the support and help given; because of that he can take more jobs and increase his income, thus improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: The buying of shovels, buckets, hammers, nails, etc.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng K. is 46 years old and her husband, Mr. Loemkhorn Touch, is 45 years old.  They have been married since 1989 and have five children  – two sons and three daughters. The family lives in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Heng K. and her husband are farmers. Mr. Loemkhorn Touch also does construction work when he is free. They are in the process of building new house to live in, but it is not yet finished. Hence she is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to finish building their house.

loans.use: To finish house building

loans.name: Mickel

texts.en:
Mickel N. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. He is 33 years old. Mickel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mickel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. Mickel has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mickel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mickel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mickel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is currently in a business of selling groundnuts paste (peanut butter). She is 38 years old and married with four children who go to school. Mary requested a loan to stock more groundnuts paste to sell. She hopes to build a house in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more groundnuts paste to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still too young for school. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills, and transport costs.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Jennifer faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. She dreams of managing a well-equipped retail shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, mineral water and soft drinks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, mineral water and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive El señor Isidro G. tiene la edad de 45 años, es profesor y esta casada, el tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela de la comunidad.

el nos platica que hace mas de 15 compro algunos terrenos y decidio invertir en la siembra de caña de azucar ya que vive en una zona cañera y en eses tiempos la caña dejaba buena ganacia,el vende su cosecha cada zafra(tiempo en que los ingenios producen azucar) al ingenio la margarita que se encuentra a un poco mas de un hora de su comunidad, el nos cuenta que cone l pasar de los años la caña ha ido perdiendo valor pero a el legusta trabajar en ella y nos dice "yo amo mis tierras porque aun que sea un poquito de dinero me va dando cada año mi caña". Don Isidro necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes, y abonos para su sembradio. El espera que con esta inversion su caña cresca sana y fuerte  para que la proximma zfra le deje buenas ganancias. el se encuentra muy agradecido y manda un saludo a las personas que hacen posible estos creditos.
texts.en: In the state of Oaxaca there is a community called Arroyo de Pita which is known for being the only community for many kilometers with a high school. This community is where Mr. Isidro G. lives. He is 45 years old, a teacher, and is married with three children who attend school in the community. He tells Fundacíon Realidad A.C (FRAC) that more than 15 years ago, he bought some land and decided to invest in planting sugarcane because he lives in a sugarcane-producing zone and in those days, sugarcane brought in a good profit. He sells his harvest each zafra (period of time when the refineries produce sugar). The Margarita refinery is located a little more than an hour from his community. He also tells FRAC that over the years, sugarcane has been losing its value but he likes working in it and says, "I love my land because even if it's just a little money, each year it keeps giving me my sugarcane." Mr. Isidro needs this loan to invest in the purchase of organic and chemical fertilizers for the fields he currently has planted. He hopes that with this investment his sugarcane will grow healthy and strong so that he earns a good profit during the the next zifra. He is very grateful and sends his greetings to the people who make these loans possible.

loans.use: to plant and grow sugarcane

loans.name: María Ignacia

texts.es:
La Sra. María Ignacia, tiene  54 años de edad, estuvo casada con el Sr. Apolonio Benitez durante 34 años, del matrimonio nacieron 5 hijos: Mirian, Eusebio, Rolando, Ninfa y Liliana, viven en la Ciudad Nueva Londres, Coronel Oviedo.
María Ignacia es comerciante hace 18 años, tiene una despensa-carnicería en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Nueva Londres, una comunidad humilde de pobladores dedicados al ganado. Comenzó con un pequeño kiosko, donde vendía artículos de primera necesidad. Con el correr del tiempo fue creciendo, con mucho esfuerzo y con la compañía de su marido.
Se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para cuidar su pequeña granja, para alimentar a sus animales, ordeñar la vaca, para luego dedicarse a su negocio el cual es el sustento del hogar. 
Este negocio le ayudó a criar y a educar a todos sus hijos, algunos de los cuales ya son profesionales y de quienes está muy orgullosa porque supieron valorar el esfuerzo de sus padres. 
Para ella la familia es muy importante y le recuerda con mucha emoción a su marido a quien le perdió hace unos meses. Todo aquellos buenos recuerdos la impulsan y fortalecen para seguir luchando por sus hijos día a día. 
Se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya con el objetivo de recibir apoyo crediticio que le ayude a salir adelante, para poder comprar artículos de primera necesidad como fideos, yerba mate, harina, azúcar, carnes, etc. para equipar mejor su almacén.
texts.en:
María Ignacia is 54 years old.  She was married to Apolonio Benitez for 34 years, and they had five children during their marriage: Mirian, Eusebio, Rolando, Ninfa, and Liliana.  They live in Nueva Londres near the city of Coronel Oviedo.
