María Ignacia has been a businesswoman for 18 years.  She has a store selling groceries and meat in the center of the city of Nueva Londres, a humble community where people raise cattle.  She began with a small kiosk where she sold staple items.  With the passage of time it grew, with much effort and with the help of her husband.

She rises very early in the morning to take care of her small farm, feed her animals, and milk the cow, so that she then can devote herself to the business that sustains her home.

This business helped her raise and educate all of her children, some of whom are already professionals.  She is very proud of them because they knew how to value the effort of their parents.

For her, family is very important, and she remembers her husband, whom she lost a few months ago, with great emotion.  All of those good memories drive her and strengthen her to continue fighting for her children each day.

She approached Fundación Paraguaya with the objective of receiving a loan that will help her move forward and enable her to purchase staple items such as pasta, yerba mate, flour, sugar, meat, etc., to better supply her store.

loans.use: to purchase staple items such as sugar, yerba mate, flour, pasta, etc., for her store

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru: Мухарам проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Двое ее сыновей находятся на заработках за рубежом. Сама она занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сеет злаковые культуры. В этой области она 10 лет. Целью получения кредита является закуп семян и минеральных удобрений для посева.
texts.en: Muharam lives in Yavan. She is 48 years old, married, and has five children. Two of her sons are working abroad. She farms. At her house she has a plot of land where she grows vegetables and grains. She has been doing this for ten years.  She is taking out a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. TANYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Benita tiene 52 años de edad y La socia es casada, la socia  tiene  4 hijos,  La socia se dedica a la venta de comidas casera, la socia elabora platos típicos y de la región los cuales lleva a vender de forma ambulatoria en la plaza principal del poblado de Ocongate; la socio a desea el crédito para poder comprar insumos ta les como papas, aceite, arroz, fideos, entre otros productos para seguir elaborando los diferentes platos típicos y de este modo seguir apoyando a la economía de sus hogar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Sra. Benita is a member of the Communal Bank “Sr. Tanyancani”. She lives in the District of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

Benita is 52 years old, married, and has four children. She sells homemade food. Benita prepares traditional regional dishes and sells them as a street vendor in the main town square in Ocongate. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as potatoes, oil, rice, noodles, and other products so that she can continue preparing different traditional dishes. This will allow her to continue contributing toward the household income. Therefore, she is requesting this loan to buy needed supplies.

Benita values and greatly appreciates the loan that has been provided since it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. Therefore, she commits to completing her payments according to the stated terms.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, oil, rice, noodles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco” ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 02 hijos.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de animales caseros, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace catorce años.
La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar cuatro chanchos para su engorde, luego los venderá en la ciudad de Yunguyo
Su sueño es tener más chanchos y así mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Anastacia is a member of the “San Juan de Tahuaco” Communal Bank, located in the district of Yunguyo, Yunguyo province, Puno department. She is 52 years old, married, and has 2 children.  Anastacia never went to school.

She and her husband buy and sell household animals. Anastacia's first loan was for the sum of 300 new sols, and was invested in her animal sales business. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 14 years.

Anastacia is requesting a new loan for the sum of 500 new sols, to be used to buy 4 pigs to fatten and sell later in the city of Yunguyo.

Her dream is to have more pigs to improve her earnings.

What she likes best about the Communal Bank are the meetings.

loans.use: buy four pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Aurora Group

texts.es:
La señora Aura Francisca es casada, tiene 31 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la agropecuaria, a la crianza de animales domésticos, inicio la crianza de animales criando pollos y vacas, hasta el momentos lleva 10 años de experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de cerdos y la alimentación de estos animales  ya que quiere mejorar en la granja que  tiene. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a: la ventas de refacciones,  venta de combustible de vehículos, confección de  delantales y a la crianza de animales. Ya que en el futuro desean tener una granja con muchos animales.
texts.en:
Aura Francisca is married, 31 years old, and she did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is a livestock farmer and she raises domestic animals. She started out raising poultry and cows. She has 10 years' experience in this field of work. She has her husband's support. He is a construction worker. 

She decided to organize a group to request a loan. It will help her to purchase pigs and livestock feed. She wants to improve the farm that she has. The other members of the group have the following business types: spare parts sales, fuel gas sales, apron sales, and livestock sales. In the future she wants to have a farm with many livestock.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and livestock feed.

loans.name: Turdi

texts.en:
Turdi lives and works in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. He is married and the father of five children. His wife is a housewife. Turdi is engaged in cultivating crops such as water-melon, onion and corn. Turdi has been running his farming business for 30 years and he has a lot of experience in this business. His sons and daughter help him to plant seeds. Turdi would like a loan of 10,000 TJS to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer to increase his working capital.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Abdufattoh

texts.en:
Abdufattoh is an active and responsible father with one child. For the past six years, he has sold spare parts in a local market called “Navbahor.” Abdufattoh travels to Istaravshan city to purchase his goods. He has a good deal of experience and his business is stable and generates considerable income for his family to provide for improving living conditions.

Abdufattoh is requesting a loan of 2,100 USD to purchase spare parts to increase his working capital and expand his business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Seluwa

texts.en: Seluwa is 38 years old. She is a widow with five children. Two of the children are in school. She has a business selling beans in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years. Seluwa requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase more beans to sell with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profit from her business to pay for her children to go to school and to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with two girls, one of whom attends school while the other is still too young. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past two years, Mariam has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Mariam decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mariam is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, she dreams of becoming a leading supplier of charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mutuku

texts.en: Mutuku is a businessman who is 44 years old. He is married and blessed with four children who are still in school. For the last seven years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to make a living. He has improved the business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, he wants to expand the business. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to service his motorbike.

loans.use: To service his motorbike

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Alejandra tiene 45 años de edad, y es madre soltera de 3 hijos.

Ella cuenta con 7 años de dedicarse a la venta de pupusas (un plato tipico de El Salvador), este negocio lo aprendió de su madre.

Para adquirir los insumos que necesita para elaborar las pupusas, ella se traslada en autobús durante 40 minutos a una ciudad del oriente de país para comprarlos, puesto que ahí los adquiere a mejor precio.

La señora Alejandra esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar maíz, fríjol y otros ingredientes que necesita para elaborar las pupusas. Además, ella quiere reparar el lugar donde vende las pupusas ya que actualmente lo hace debajo de una ramada de hojas de plátano, ubicada al otro lado de la calle donde ella vive junto a sus hijos. A pesar de que cuando llueve se moja todo su negocio, el lugar es estratégico para su venta ya que por ahí pasan los autobuses y le compran las personas que viajan a otras ciudades.

Con la ayuda del prestamo ella espera obtener mejores ingresos, para ella y sus hijos logrando tener una seguridad económica para una vida mejor.

En un futuro, la señora Alejandra desea tener una crianza de cerdos y que sus hijos le ayuden para tener otra fuente de ingresos y asi seguir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandra is 45 years old and a single mother with three children. For the past seven years, she has been selling “pupusas” (a traditional dish in El Salvador). She learned this trade from her mother.

In order to acquire the supplies needed to make “pupusas”, Alejandra must travel 40 minutes by bus to a city in the eastern part of the country. She buys her products in this area because the prices are better.

Sra. Alejandra is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy corn, beans, and other ingredients needed to make “pupusas”. In addition, she wants to make repairs to the place where she sells her product, which currently consists of an arbor made of banana leaves and is located on the other side of the street where she and her children live. Even though her business gets soaked when it rains, the location is a strategic place for selling since buses pass through that area and people traveling from other cities buy her food.

With the help of this loan, Alejandra hopes to generate more income for herself and her children so that they will have financial security for a better life. In the future, Sra. Alejandra wants to raise pigs and have her children help her so that they will have another source of income. This will help them to continue improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hollow blocks-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her hollow blocks-making business.

Liezel has been in this business for a year. Liezel earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Perisa

texts.en:
Perisa is 25 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She has a business selling tomatoes and beans in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Perisa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase her goods for sale. She will use her profit from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes and beans to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona tiene como actividad agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Verónica desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cerdos, ovejas  y aves de corral), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales, una vez que sus animales llegan a su crecimiento óptimo podrá ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así pueda obtener muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado y para sanidad de sus animales, con la finalidad de que sus animales estén sanos y aptos para el consumo de las personas, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar su nivel de vida.  Verónica es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca cada vez más para brindarle más comodidades a su familia en casa.
texts.en:
Verónica is 34 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own home in a rural area in the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura.  They don't have basic services.  The people in this area work in agriculture, raising livestock and crafts.  

Verónica has been raising and selling farmyard animals (pigs, sheep and poultry) for some time now.  Her pens are located in the back part of her house.  She feeds her animals a balanced meal of natural grains and grasses.  When her animals reach an optimum size she sells them at different markets in her area.  This is how she brings in a good income to cover her household expenses.  

She has requested a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] to buy balanced feed so that  her animals are healthy and suitable for consumption by people.  With her earnings she will make her loan payments and improve her standard of living.  

Verónica is a hard-working and dedicated person.  The only thing she wants is for her business to grow so that she can make her family more comfortable at home.

loans.use: purchase balanced feed for the health of her animals.

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene 37 años de edad, es casada con dos hijos.

Ella esta creciendo y educando a sus hijos con la ayuda de su esposo, que se vio en la necesidad de emigrar a los Estados Unidos, en busca de una mejor vida para su familia, ya tiene 5 años desde  que se fue, con mucho sacrificio envía mes a mes la ayuda económica a sus hijos, para la alimentación y cualquier otra necesidad que surja en el hogar. 

Rosa desde los 13 años de edad se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos, ella hasta la edad de 25 años trabajo como empleada domestica en casas de familia y ayudaba a su mamá y a sus hermanos, desde muy joven empezó a luchar por su familia, luego conoció a su actual esposo y se dedico al hogar. Ella elabora tortillas para vender y el maíz lo compra con agricultores de la zona.

Rosa solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo para mejorar su vivienda, ya que necesita ponerle piso, por que el que tiene es de tierra, de esta forma, mejorara la calidad de vida de sus hijos y su casa se vera mejor y cuando la gente llega a comprar sus tortillas se sentirá más cómoda. Ella desea arreglar su vivienda, para bienestar de sus hijos, ya que por ellos dice Rosa, se hace cualquier sacrificio y brindarles el amor y la educación que se merecen.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old.  She is married and has two children.

Rosa is raising and educating her children with the help of her husband, who saw the need to emigrate to the United States in search of a better life for his family five years ago.  Since he left, he has sent financial help to his children every month, for their food and any other need that might arise in the household.

Rosa has been carrying out domestic tasks since she was 13.  Up to the age of 25, she worked as a domestic employee in family homes and helped her mom and siblings.  She started to work hard for her family from a very young age.  She then met her current husband and started looking after their home.  She also makes tortillas to sell and buys her corn from farmers in her area. 

Rosa is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo in order to improve her home.  She needs to lay some flooring because she currently has an earthen floor.  In this way, she will improve her children's quality of life and her house will look better.  When people come to buy her tortillas she will feel more comfortable.  Rosa would like to carry out work on her home for the good of her children because she says that, for them, she would make any sacrifice and would like to provide them with the love and education that they deserve.

loans.use: to lay flooring in her home as she currently has an earthen floor

loans.name: Njete Shg Group

texts.en:
Jane is the facilitator of the Njete SHG group. Jane and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jane takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Jane had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jane was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Jane will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Njete SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land and the person standing on the far left is the field officer.


In the photograph above, Jane is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 63-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife, five working children and two others who are still studying. He has been working in security in a local hotel since 2007. After finding it hard to cover his daughter’s heavy educational fees, he decided to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay her courses at the university. He believes in the importance of education and is ready to sacrifice as much as possible in order to see his child achieving higher educational levels. In the future, he plans to open his own security company and hire people to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to pay his child’s university fees.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has four children.
 
Rita has a shop that sells coconuts and bananas. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts and bananas.

Rita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is 42 years old.  He has been providing transportation services for 14 years and uses his handcart to transport goods.  He has retained his business because of his hard work and determination.  He has also grown his business through the financial support provided by Faulu Kenya.  Edward hopes to open additional business locations in the future and has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy a handcart.

loans.use: to buy a handcart.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City.  She is 39 and has three children.  She and her husband earn a living by running a laundry business. They started the business four years ago.

Anh would like to borrow money in order to expand the business by buying detergent and good quality laundry equipment.  She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying detergent and good quality equipment for her laundry.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Mamadou est âgé de 41 ans,  marié et père de 1 enfant, il vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec d’autres ménages au quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou.
Mamadou est titulaire d’un certificat d’aptitude professionnelle en déclarant en douane, mais faute d’emploi, il décide de faire une reconversion afin de s’insérer dans la vie économique. C’est ainsi qu’il commença à faire l’apprenti cameraman auprès des professionnelles de l’Office de Radio diffusion Télévision du Mali (O.R.T.M). Après plusieurs années à leurs côtés, il évolua seul  pour faire le métier de cameraman. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de son service offert. 
Dans le souci de mieux s’équiper pour faire face à la demande clientèle, il sollicite ce prêt. Il est à son 1er prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et compte l’utiliser  pour payer une camera, il s’approvisionnera au Ghana. Il fait ses prestations au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Avec ce prêt, il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice de 40 000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de faire face à la demande clientèle et de payer ses échéances avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou is 41 years old, and married with one child. He lives in a traditional family among other households in the district of Hamdallaye, in Segou. Mamadou holds a vocational training certificate as a customs officer, but due to a lack of employment opportunities, he opted to switch to a different career in order to enter the work force. He became an apprentice cameraman working with professionals at the Office for Radio and Television of Mali (ORTM). After several years of training, he branched out on his own to work as a cameraman. His main strength is in the quality of his services.

In order to be better equipped to meet customer demand, Mamadou is seeking his first loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to purchase a camera, which he plans to buy in Ghana. He works for cash, and his clientele consists of both men and women. He expects that this loan will help him to earn a profit of 40,000FCFA per month. This will allow him to handle customer demand and make loan repayments to Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy a camera.

loans.name: Murodullo

texts.en: Murodullo was born in 1981 year. He is married parent of 2 children. To be a responsible father, Murodullo works hard during 8 years to earn for living. He is a mater of repairing car. Also he buys old cars, repairs these cars and sells in a local market. He has his own workshop. His clients come to his workshop regularly because they are glad from his service. Murodullo runs with business alone. He needs to financial support now. He must to buy part of car to repair an old car. After finishing the repairing car he will sell it. From profit he is going to improve living condition. He is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy part of car to repair an old car. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy part of car to repair an old car to sell

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en:
Sarun is a 40-year-old mother of six children. She resides in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, where she runs her business. She raises pigs as her main business and works at a construction site for a secondary source of income. To help her to earn more income, her husband is a policeman. Nowadays, she can earn up to 34,000 KHR per day.

Sarun has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for a long time and she has fully repaid her past loan wisely. Now, in a group of three, she is a leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy pig feed and more piglets to expand her business. She hopes this loan can help her to earn a lot of income and to improve her family’s living conditions better than before.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more piglets to expand her business.

loans.name: Kwessiba Olivia's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Kwessiba Olivia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Kwessiba Olivia a n'a pas fréquentée l’école mais a appris la couture, activité qu'elle exerce depuis douze ans. Kwessiba Olivia est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Kwessiba Olivia est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Marc. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Kwessiba Olivia vend de façon parallèle à son activité des produits de merceries et des tissus ce qui lui permet de faire face aux besoins de sa famille. Kwessiba Olivia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu,  Kwessiba Olivia ensemble avec les membres de ce groupe, sollicite un quatrième crédit. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits de merceries et des tissus.

loans.name: Mullohoshok

texts.ru:
Муллохошок мужчина 30 лет, женат, счастливый отец троих детей. Он хорошо окончил сельскую школу но не имея возможности поступить в высшее учебное заведение пошел работать разнорабочим. Он работал на стройке, иногда подрабатывал таксистом в ночное время. Всеми способами Он помогал своим родителям. В возрасте 20 лет он женился. Сейчас у него уже трое детей, которых он очень любит и хочет обеспечить светлым будущим. Он на протяжение последних 5 лет занимается животноводством. У него 2 коровы и 4 барана. Его жена доит коров и продает молоко на рынке. Он любит свое занятие, проводит много времени на природе.
Он планирует расширить свой бизнес, купить одного теленка, и закупить корм для скота. Но на данный момент у него нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. У него хорошая кредитная история в МДО Арванд. Он надеется, что МДО Арванд поможет ему вновь и выделит нужную ему сумму. Благодарит за доверие и поддержку.
texts.en:
Mullohoshok is a 30-year-old married man who is the happy father of three children. Mullohoshok graduated successfully from the village school but, not having the opportunity to enroll in a higher education institute, he went to work as a laborer. He worked in construction, and sometimes earned extra money as a taxi driver at night. Mullohoshok helped his parents however he could. He got married at 20 years old. Now he already has three children whom he loves very much and wants to provide a bright future for them.

For the last five years, Mullohoshok has reared animals. He has two cows and four sheep. His wife milks the cows and sells the milk at market. Mullohoshok loves his occupation and spends a lot of time outdoors. He plans to expand his business, to buy a calf, and to buy feed for his livestock. But at the moment he does not have the full sum of money. So he has applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. Mullohoshok took a loan from us before, and has a good credit history. He hopes that MDO Arvand will help him again and will provide the desired amount. He is grateful for your trust and support.

loans.use: to expand the number of his livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Celina would like to grow her business to be able to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married and has two grown children. She runs a small business selling infant supplies in the local market. There are very few other entrepreneurs involved in this area of sales so it has been a good business for her and meets the needs of many customers. Presently, Valentina has about $2,000 of working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to $600. Valentina does her best to please her customers in every detail. She is very professional and always tries to have accurate knowledge about her products. These qualities in combination with financial assistance from “Nadiya Ukraine” have promoted the success of Valentina’s business. Over the 11 years she has been in business she has repaid 17 loans without any delinquencies. Valentina is requesting a loan for $1,000 to help her buy a new vending facility. She has already found a good location for a new kiosk and is planning to supply it with an inventory of diapers, milk bottles, bibs, towels, and clothing. Valentina believes that the infant supplies she can offer will make parents lives a lot easier, their babies happier, and will help many moms and dads use their baby supplies budget wisely.

Валентина – одружена, в неї двоє дорослих дітей. Вона торгує товарами для малюків та немовлят на одному з ринків міста Бердянськ. В цій сфері торгівлі працює небагато інших підприємців. Саме тому бізнес Валентини успішно розвивається, в неї багато покупців. Зараз у Валентини приблизно 2000 доларів робочого капіталу. Її щомісячний чистий прибуток складає приблизно 600 доларів. Валентина намагається якомога краще обслужити кожного покупця. Вона професіонал в торгівлі, до усього підходить із знанням справи. Ці якості у поєднанні з фінансовою підтримкою від „Надії України” сприяли успіху бізнесу Валентини. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже понад 11 років, сплатила 17 позик без жодних прострочень. Валентина просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб придбати нове торгове приміщення. Вона вже знайшла гарне місце для свого нового кіоску, зараз планує поповнити асортимент товарів, а саме, закупити підгузки, пляшечки, рушники та одяг. Валентина вважає, що товари для немовлят зможуть значно полегшити життя багатьох батьків, забезпечити усім необхідним їхніх малюків, а помірні ціни допоможуть розумно використати гроші з сімейного бюджету.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending facility

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah would like to buy Dairy meal and Chicken feeds

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela C. Pelicó is a member of a group of women who all rent little plots of land to grow crops for a little bit of supplemental cash. Manuela rents her little plot of just a single cuerda for about US$158/year, and grows ornamental flowers like daisies and carnations. She'll invest this loan in seed, fertilizer, and pesticides. Her little business brings in only about 15% of her income, so she also works extensively in the fields of others to support her five children.

Manuela's school-age children are not in school due to lack of money for the required supplies. The oldest (20) did complete second grade; Manuela, 40, never had any schooling, cannot read or write, and speaks only a smattering of Spanish, since day-to-day conversations are carried out in her native Quiché language.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for flower crop

location.town: La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
I have been embroidering for the last ten years, and am very good at my work. I have four children, two of which study at a local school and two who are not of school going age yet. My husband’s eyesight was lost in an accident and he is unable to work. I am the only breadwinner for my family. Eid (Muslim religious festival) is approaching and there is a high demand for embroidered clothes during the season so I wish to manufacture a large quantity. I need to buy raw materials in sufficient quantity. Please lend me $300 so that I can put food on my table and send all of my children to school.
Zahida P.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery materials

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is a well educated 29 year old. He has a wife and one child. And, he takes care of 6 orphans. He went to the university and received his teacher’s degree but wanted to work for himself. So, he went back and received a degree in computer science. Combining both degrees, Dan has returned to his home village, and started his new business which is called Global Information Center. 

His business is an internet café, but it is also much more for the people in his village of Mperewe. It is an unusual sight to see computers outside the major cities of Uganda. But Dan is determined to provide them with this service. A year ago he had two computers, now he has eight. And, he uses his business to teach students computer science. As Dan emphasized  “In the global world, the children of Mperewe need to know how to use computers. With it they will gain much information and information will empower them”.

With his loan, Dan plans to buy furniture for his business. He owns a plot of land and his dream is to build a permanent computer training center on the site.

loans.use: Dan plans to buy furniture for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence B. is 39 years, a widow and has 3 children.  She hails from Benin City where she fixes and braids hair for people.  She is currently a LAPO member.  She is in need of a loan to buy more weaveons, relaxers and hair cream to sell.

loans.use: To buy more weaveons, relaxers and hair creams to sell

loans.name: Khakimov

texts.en: Khakimov D. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has a child. Khakimov D. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007. His  business stability and income increase helped him to return his previous loan. Khakimov D. is experienced in business (about 5 years) and has the appropriate knowledge in livestock because he worked with the bovine animals from his early years. He helped his father in the farm as the stock keeper and further in the livestock raising and selling and milk production. It was the family business. His wife is engaged in livestock raising and selling also because it is the family business. Khakimov D. dreams of having a large flock and to open a business in the meat products making. In time he dreams of owning a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for  further meat and milk production (its supply to the bazaars: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc). Now Mr. Khakimov D. requests the loan of $500 for business development and the future horn pedigree bull purchase that would allow him to increase significantly the family income and permit him to plan further business development.

loans.use: for business development and a future horn pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: Gavino Marcelino

texts.es:
Gavino works as a tailor, making and repairing clothes for men, women and children. He's operated his business for 4 years during which he's perfected his skills with each stitch. He works in his house and his customers are mostly office workers who order skirts, pants and blazers. He learned to use a sewing machine at a very young age and he's passionate about his work. He works every day from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening.

He's applying for a loan so that he can buy different kinds of cloth and especially cloth for making school uniforms. The new school year will start soon and making uniforms is a good way to capture new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Vounteer

El señor Gavino se dedica a la sastrería en donde confecciona y repara ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, lleva 4 años en esta actividad, tiempo en el cual ha podido perfeccionarse en cada prenda que elabora, trabaja en su vivienda, sus clientes son mayormente oficinista que requieren que le elabore faldas, pantalones y bleizer. Este oficio le apasiona mucho, desde muy joven aprendió el uso y manejo de la maquina de coser, él atiende a sus clientes de 7:00am a las 8:00pm., todos los días.

El señor solicita un préstamo para comprar telas de diferentes tipos en especial para uniformes escolares en vista que los colegios iniciaron sus clases y esta época es buena para su negocio lo que le ayuda a captar clientes.

loans.use: Buy materials for tailoring business.

loans.name: Arafa's Mkombozi Group

texts.en:
Arafa is 32 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages12, 7, and 3 years old. Arafa owns a small food store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $85 from her sales.

In the past, Arafa has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in retail shops and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Doña Maria is a sewing expert. Her abilities to combine wool fibers and produce beautiful garments make her products of excellent quality. She makes tablecloths, hats, and wool scarves, as well as crochet work. Her ability and curiosity have innovated models and produced exclusive designs. As part of her desire to better herself and improve, Doña Maria has received trainings about business ideas and exporting. Through this she has awakened her big goal of becoming an excellent exporter. She wants to obtain a loan to increase her capital and invest it in buying a bigger quantity of raw material to continue to make her beautiful garments.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Doña Maria es una virtuosa del tejido, sus habilidades para entrelazar fibras de lana y producir bellas prendas hacen que su productividad sea de excelente calidad, ella elabora tapetes, gorras y chalinas de lana tanto a crochet como a palito, su habilidad y curiosidad ha innovado los modelos y ha producido diseños exclusivos. En su afán de superación y mejoramiento continuo Doña Maria a recibido capacitaciones acerca de las ideas de negocio y exportación y con el ha despertado su gran anhelo de convertirse en una excelente exportadora.Desea obtener un préstamo a fin de incrementar el capital de su trabajo e invertirlo en la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima a fin de seguir elaborando sus bellas prendas.

loans.use: Increase capital for work to acquire a greater quantity of primary material and to continue to make beautiful garments

loans.name: Mulyati

texts.id:
Mulyati lives with her child and parents on Kartini Street, Denpasar. Everyday, she works as a food seller in a kiosk. Her food kiosk opens from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm. Most of her customers are people from her neighborhood. Her daily profit ranges from $3 to $4. She sells desserts, rice cakes and snacks for children. Fortunately, Mulyati's mother helps her in this business. Mulyati hopes that this loan can help increase her business capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Saat ini Mulyati tinggal bersama anak dan orang tuanya di Jl.Kartini Denpasar. Setiap harinya dia bekerja sebagai penjual makanan di warung. Warungnya buka mulai dari jam 06.00 pagi sampai jam 10.00 malam. Kebanyakan pelanggannya adalah warga disekitar rumahnya. Setiap hari keuntungan yang didapat berkisar antara 30.000 – 40.000. Adapun jualannya seperti Es, Lontong dan camilan atau snack untuk anak-anak. Untungnya dalam menjalankan usahnya Mulyati dibantu oleh ibunya yang juga tinggal dengannya. Mulyati berharap kali ini diberi pinjaman untuk bisa menambah modal usaha.

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Aizotou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aïzotou K. was born May 14th, 1970 in Sokodé. She is married to Mr. Biraïma BATCHA who is a taxi driver. They have four children. She is a retailer of cosmetic products in the Agoè neighborhood. In 2006, she opened her store and achieves good sales turnover. The first loan she is seeking will allow her to buy six cartons of lotion and 6 cartons of perfumes.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Aïzotou est née le 14 mai 1970 à Sokodé. Elle s’est mariée à Monsieur BATCHA Biraïma qui est un chauffeur de taxis. Ils ont 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse des produits cosmétiques dans le quartier d’Agoè. Depuis 2006, elle a ouvert son magasin et réalise de bon chiffre d’affaires. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 6 cartons de crème et 6 cartons de parfums.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Tauala Feagai

texts.en: Tauala Feagai, 55, is married with 11 children. She has many years of experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to friends, relatives and the village community three days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~120 USD). She has one previous loan(s) with SPBD; these loans are Tauala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. The loan will assist her in operating her business, which she operates with help from her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of equipment (shovels, pesticides, knives) for her taro/banana business.

loans.name: Santi

texts.en:
Mrs. Shanti S. lives in Khogana Dobato. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Shanti S. lives in a nuclear family with her husband, one daughter and one son. Her husband's name is Mr. Yekendra S.. He works in his own electronics shop. Her daughter passed her SLC (School Leaving Certificate) this year and her son is studying in grade 7.

Mrs. Shanti S. opened a cloth shop few years ago to raise the living standard of her family because only her husband's income is not enough to run her family smoothly. She sells various qualities of cloth in her shop. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 10000.00 to buy various sorts of cloth for her business.

loans.use: to buy various sorts of cloth for her business

loans.name: Saom

texts.en: Saom C., 51, is married and she lives with four of her six children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has had a business selling "Nom Banchok" rice noodles. They are one of the favorite foods of Cambodian people. Rice noodles are served with many kinds of vegetables such as: mint, banana blossoms, string beans, English cucumber, mung bean sprouts and other vegetables. They are also used in two types of soup; green and red soup. Green soup is cooked with boneless fish and it is called in "Nom Banchok Samlah Khmer". Red soup can be cooked with pork or chicken and is called "Nom Banchok Namya". On average, she makes $1 of profit per day and she is helped by her child who works as a garment worker as well. Mrs. Saom would like to loan from Kiva to build a cage to raise pigs for extra profit for the family.

loans.use: To build a cage to raise pigs

loans.name: Alifmoh

texts.ru: Пирова Алифмох  жительница города Вахдат.Возраст 58 лет, замужем, имеет 10 детей.Муж клиентки работает таксистом на собственной автомашине.Этот вид деятельности является основным источником дохода их большой семьи.В данный момент ее муж хочет отремонтировать машину.Для чего ему нужны  деньги.Семья решила взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Alifmoh P. lives in the city of Vakhdat. She is 58 years old, married and has 10 children. Her husband is a cab driver. He uses their private car as a taxi. This business is the main source of income for this big family. Alifmoh’s husband would like to fix the car. The family decided to obtain a loan that they plan to repay in the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to fix the car

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Касимова Саломат, 1962 года рождения, замужем и у них 5 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи зелени и овощей. Данный момент она торгует овощами и фруктами на колхозном рынке города Турсунзаде. В ее ассортименте разновидность яблок, виноградов, персиков, перца и баклажана, помидоров и огурцов. Также в сезон в продаже имеются дыни, гранаты, хурмы, малины, клубники и т.д. Закупает свои товары с дехкан и у оптовиков из Узбекистана. Для увеличения ассортимента, закупа винограда и яблок  хочет участвовать в программе «Кива» и получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Salomat K. was born in 1962, is married and has five children. She began her business by selling greens and vegetables. Currently, she sells vegetables and fruit in the farmers’ market in the city of Tursun-Zade. Her inventory includes various types of apples, grapes, peaches, peppers, eggplants, tomatoes and cucumbers. Also during the growing season, she sells melons, pomegranates, persimmons, raspberries, strawberries, etc. She buys the goods from small farmers and from wholesalers from Uzbekistan. She wants to participate in Kiva to receive a loan for 3,500 somoni which will allow her to buy grapes and apples in order to increase her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grapes and apples

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Mr. Sophat T. is a farmer who lives in Preak Svay village in Kandal Province. He is 59 years old and the father of five children; two of his children are farmers, another is employed in a garment factory, and the other two are enrolled in the local school. He owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to earn his living. He faces some problems because his field is not fertile and has a lot of insects, which damage his crop. In order to deal with these problems, Mr. Sophat T. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. An Tai, is a jasmine seller. Mr. Sophat T. and his wife are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana is a member of the Bienestar (“Well-being”) Village Bank. She is 48 years old and married with three children.

Emerenciana owns two cars and a truck. She rents the two cars to drivers to use for inter-provincial passenger transport, and pays each driver 30 soles per trip (drivers typically make two trips per day). Her husband works for a local gas company, driving his truck to Lima and back to transport workers, equipment and machinery. He earns a fixed salary. Emerenciana and her husband have been working in transportation for ten years now.

Emerenciana is requesting a loan of 3600 soles to pay for replacement parts and new tires for her cars. Her goal for the future is to buy more cars and start her own transport company.

loans.use: Buy replacement parts and tires for cars

loans.name: Sroeurn

texts.en:
Sroeurn N. is 28 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia where she earns a living as a tailor, providing her good service for neighbors, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. From her business, she can earn an average of US$ 3 per day. She currently takes care of one child who is still young and lives in the family home.

Sroeurn N. is married to Veng Vuthy, 30, who is a blacksmith, and is currently earning approximately US$ 5 per day. N. and her family's living conditions are not so good and their house is small for them, because it is so old, hence N. would like to request a loan to purchase house materials to decorate and repair her old house.

loans.use: to purchase house materials to decorate and repair her old house

loans.name: Paska

texts.en:
Paska A. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to expand the enterprise. Twenty-eight years old and widowed, she has four children, all in school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Madina

texts.fr:
Madame Madina D. est une femme mariée de trente quatre ans, mère d’un enfant qui vit dans une famille nucléaire à Sanankoroba à 20  kilomètres de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
 Elle travaille comme monitrice au jardin d’enfant du village d’enfants SOS (VESOS) de Sanankoroba.
Pour améliorer ses revenus, elle décida d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après trois prêts solidaires tous correctement remboursés,  elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter,  10  sacs à mains, 10  paires de chaussures et divers autres articles sur le marché du Burkina Faso où  elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois et effectue ses ventes à Sanankoroba et à Bamako au comptant et à crédit.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de trente trois mille francs CFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Madina D., age 34, is married and the mother of one child. She lives in a nuclear family in Sanankoroba, located 20 kilometers from Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali. She works as a teacher at the kindergarten of the children village SOS (VESOS) in Sanankoroba. To increase her income, she decided to join the loan credit of Kiva's partner Soro Yiriwaso. After three solidarity loans (group loans) that were repaid without problem, she's seeking her first personal loan. She intends to use it to buy 10 handbags, 10 pairs of shoes, and various other items at a market in Burkina Faso, where she goes get her supplies once a month. She then resells her goods in Sanankoroba and in Bamako, for cash or on credit. She hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 33'000 (ca US$ 66), to be used to repay the loan and provide for the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell 10 handbags, 10 pairs of shoes, and various other items

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Mrs. Roberta B. is 33 years old, married and a resident of Mobod, Oroquieta City. They are blessed with 2 children. Because it is hard for the family to survive without a stable income, she decided to engage in selling. She started a sari-sari (mini- grocery) store with capital she borrowed from Paglaum. Their primary customers are their neighbors. Successfully, she was able to manage it well, and able to finance the daily needs of her family.

Roberta became a member of Paglaum Cooperative in November 2000. She was able to avail herself of three loans and repaid them religiously. Now, she applies for a loan of PHP 5,000 to finance the purchase of additional stock for her sari-sari store. She is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari into a Mini-mart someday.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
la Sra. Blanca V. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en union libre con Marlo Rodas con quien tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos estudian en la escuela y el otro esta recien nacido, ella se dedica a la venta de lacteos y verduras desde hace 7 años, ella necesita el prestamo para la compra de quesillo, matequilla y verduras para suplir las necesidades de sus clientes, ella tiene que vender mas para tener mas ganancias ya que las necesita para poder darles todo a sus hijos, ahora todo esta bien caro para manter un hijo recien nacido y las ganancias que tiene en estos momentos no le ajustan para darles el sustento a sus hijos, 
su meta es poder comprar una casa. y que sus hijos sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Blanca V. is 29 years old and lives with her partner Marlo Rodas, with whom she has 3 children. Two of the children are at school and the other is a newborn baby. Blanca has been selling dairy products and vegetables for 7 years. She needs the loan to buy curd cheese, butter and vegetables to meet customer demand. She needs to sell more and bring in more money to ensure that her all of her children's needs are met, as taking care of a newborn baby proves very costly these days. Her current earnings are not enough to support her children properly. Her ambition is to buy a house and for her children to become good people in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy products and vegetables

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Comenzo con ventas hace 11 años, gracias a que una amiga la invito , para formar parte de las ventas por catalogo, ella requiere estos ingresos para poder pagar sus estudios, y apoyar a su madre, se encuentra estudiando actualmente estilista.

Ella comenzo con la venta con sus amistades y ahora se encuentra en una problematica ya que la clientela le pide otros productos y require de la compra de ellos , la cual no puede conseguir ya que no cuenta con suficiente dinero.

Una gran mujer de exito, un gran futuro muy prometedor, estudiante y trabajadora.
texts.en:
She started in sales 11 years ago, thanks to a friend who invited her to be involved in catalogue sales. She needs this income to pay for her studies and support her mother. Currently she is studying to be a stylist. She began selling with her friends and now has a challenge, as her customers are asking for products which she needs to purchase, but cannot since she doesn’t have the funds to do so. She is a woman of success, a promising future, studious and hard working.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia Akyeampomaa is thirty–two years old and divorced with three children, two sons and a daughter, all of whom are in primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Leticia is a trader. She trades in textiles, mainly printed and designed fabrics. She hawks to sell and also treks to other towns to sell. Leticia purchases her products in Dormaa, the district capital. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk

loans.name: Cecilio Efrain

texts.es: El señor Cecilio Efraín O., tiene la edad de 46 años, habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos, junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene tres hijos de catorce, once y seis años; ellos estudian y le apoyan con las actividades agrícolas, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace 30 años don Cecilio se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, con sus propios esfuerzos a logrado establecer parte de sus cultivos , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder vender a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Cecilio Efraín O. is 46 years old. He lives in San José de los Ríos with is wife, who helps him with the household expenses. They have three children, who are 14, 11, and 6 years old. They study and also help with the agricultural work. His plan for his family is to improve their living conditions. Cecilio has been farming for 30 years. It is through his own initiative that he has been able to establish part of his crops. The biggest difficulty he has is the lack of financing. With the loan he will buy fertilizers and other inputs to apply to his crop so he can sell it at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other inputs to improve his crop

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.ru: Мирзоев Сайфулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 31 год. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Сайфулло более 3 лет занимается пчеловодством, он производит мед и продает его на рынке. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Saifullo M. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 31 years old. He is married and has one child. Saifullo has been a beekeeper for more than three years, he produces honey and sells it on the market. The client is asking for a loan to increase his production volume.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase production volume

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn O., from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, is a 54-year-old married mother of six adult-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a food stall business whose main source of income comes from selling vegetables in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, Jocelyn earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to invest in expanding the business, Jocelyn is now requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase more vegetables to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea Y. N., 57, is a widowed woman who runs a business on her own as a food (green papaya and some other types of vegetable mixed together) and soy-milk seller living in the Battambong province; she typically makes US$6 every day and is aided by her daughter who works in a garment factory with an income of US$3 per day.

N. wants to operate another business for her family members to generate more income to cover her family’s expenses and to save more income to repair her house. That is why she has approached CREDIT with a request for a loan. N. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase clothes, a purchase that she sees as a good opportunity to resell them at a fairly profitable price to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Nicefora

texts.en:
Nicefora J. is from the village of Bunawan near Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Nicefora raises pigs for sale. She has been doing this for over 2 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP each month.

Nicefora joined PMPC in 2005 to gain access to financial services that would improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicefora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC, and is now requesting her 6th PMPC loan, in the amount of 5000 PHP,  to purchase breeding livestock.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Iris Lourdes

texts.es: Iris Lourdes P. Cliente nueva en nuestra institución  dedicada a la elaboración de tejidos como ser. chambritas (ropa de Bebe), mantillas, etc el mismo que esta ubicado  en la zona de irpavi. Ella ya es una persona mayor, ya no tiene dependientes directos, sus hijos ya formaron sus propios hogares; vive solamente con su esposo, el cual es rentista. El Credito Solicitado lo invertira en la compra de materiales.
texts.en:
Iris Lourdes P., a new customer in our institution, weaves clothing such as chambritas (baby clothing), mantillas, etc. Her business is located in the Irpavi zone. She is already a mature person and does not have direct dependents; her children have already formed their own households. She lives alone with her husband, who is an investor. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of materials.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a vegetable vendor. Improving their way of living motivated her to venture into the business. She believes that the business will be a big help to her husband, who manages their farming business. She is a mother of four: Rogelio - 12 years old, first year high school; Roda - 9 years old and Mary Grace - 8 years old, both elementary students, and Rodolfo P. Jr. - 4 months old.

Maribel really wants to help her husband provide for their needs at home. She decided to borrow 5,000 PHP that she can use for her business. She hopes that her small enterprise will continue to be productive.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en: Yawa M. is currently in the business of wholeselling charcoal in bags and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.  Yawa is 30 years old and is Married with a husband that is a fisherman. She has 1 child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to esterblish charcoal burning industry BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Helen is 25 years old, married, and six months pregnant. She rents a four room house where she lives with seven people.  Helen takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.  She owns a veterinary shop selling all kinds of chicken and animal feed in Busega. She pays for transport costs for the products she buys in Mengo Kisenyi for her shop in Busega, on the outskirts of Kampala. On average she receives about 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for two years and with MCDT for four years, servicing her tenth loan and working with the same group mates.  Helen uses public transport to and from shopping. Her challenges include customer defaults and the ever increasing price of poultry and animal feed. Helen wants to use this loan to buy more bags of animal and chicken feed. She aspires to see her business grow stronger and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more animal and chicken feed

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou V. is from Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 34 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Marilou owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Captured in the photo is a customer with her. In April 2009, Marilou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Marilou is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Delfina Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Delfina Marín es una socia activa  del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, situado en la parroquia Cumbe al suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca,  este lugar se caracteriza por los finos tejidos que se elaboran ahí,  el nombre original de esta localidad es Cumbipirca que proviene del quechua “Cumbi o Chumbi “que significa tejido fino y “ Pirca” pared, nuestra socia  tiene 51 años de edad  es madre soltera de cinco hijos de 30, 17, 14, 12  años, éstos últimos gemelos,  su primer hijo es casado y vive independientemente, sus otros hijos estudian en el colegio Técnico Cumbe, ninguno de sus hijos es reconocido por su padre y tampoco les ayuda económicamente por lo que es ella la encargada del sustento de su familia, no tienen casa propia y viven en una casa prestada donde sólo pagan los servicios básicos de luz y agua.

Delfina vende chancho hornado los martes y sábados en la plaza central de Cumbe y  los miércoles y jueves vende café, empanadas y morocho en la feria del ganado, lleva quince años en ésta actividad  y nos comenta que le va bien.

Delfina nos comenta que formó parte del banco comunal hace un año y se retiró por  situaciones de fuerza mayor, regreso y éste es su segundo ciclo, con el préstamo solicitado a ESPOIR  una parte va a invertir en la  compra de  carne de cerdo, harina, manteca, aceite, etc. para la elaboración de sus platos, y otra  parte la utilizará en la educación de sus hijos.

Su sueño  es comprar un terreno y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Delfina Marín is an active member of the Nuevo Porvenir (New Future) Community Bank, located in the parish of Cumbe, southwest of the city of Cuenca, Ecuador. This place is known for the fine craftwork that is woven there, and its original name is Cumbipirca, which comes the Quechua words meaning "finely woven." Delfina is a 51-year-old single mother of five children, ages 30, 17, 14, and 12-year-old twins. Her eldest son is married and lives on his own. Her other children are still in school. None of the children know their father, and he also doesn't help them economically, so Delfina is in charge of providing for her family. They do not have their own home and live in a borrowed house where they only pay for basic services (electricity and water). Delfina sells roasted pork Tuesdays and Saturday in Cumbe's central plaza, and Wednesdays and Friday she sells coffee and empanadas at the livestock fair. She has 15 years' experience and tells us things are going well. Delfina says she joined the community bank a year ago, had to withdraw because of situations out of her control, and then returned. She is now in her second loan cycle, and with the loan she is requesting from Kiva partner Fundacion Espoir, she plans to use a portion to purchase pork, flour, lard, oil, etc. to make her meals, and to use the other part for her children's education. Her dream is to buy some land and build a home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pork, flour, lard, oil, etc. to make her meals

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells bags of melon at both wholesale and retail prices to her customers. In Nigeria, melon is used in the preparation of egusi soup (a soup made with ground melon seeds, vegetables, seasonings and meat). The demand for her bags of melon is high. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits.

Mary is 31 years old and is married with two children. Her husband sells foodstuffs to also support the home.

Mary hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more bags of melon to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of melon to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is thirty years old and a mother of one child who is currently in school. She has been selling grocery products for seven years in the market to support her family. She says business is doing well and she therefore wants to use the loan to buy more products to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her increase her savings towards the welfare of her child.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz  tiene  21  años, vive con su esposo y su bebé de 8 meses en casa de sus suegros.Se dedica a la venta de vacas, toros y ovejas desde hace 2 años, en la actualidad posee 3 vacas que en los próximos días  venderá en la feria ganadera de su ciudad, para lograrlo debe cuidarlas mucho, además de alimentarlas adecuadamente.  Este trabajo es bien rentable a pesar de  los riesgos de todo negocio, como por ejemplo el robo de los  animales por lo que Luz esta  pensando en  el futuro mejorar la raza, además  quiere tener mas animales para tener mayor capital de trabajo.Es la tercera oportunidad que esta solicitando un crédito con  MFP, y  tiene grandes deseos de continuar adelante en el banco comunal al que pertenece y así aumentar sus ventas.Con el dinero adquirido comprará mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno  para su establo y empezará a mejorar la raza.
texts.en:
Luz, 21, lives with her husband and 8-month-old baby in her in-laws' house. She has raised cattle and sheep for the last 2 years. She currently owns 3 cows which she intends to sell in the city's cattle fair in the next few days. In order to have successful sales, she needs to care for them well and feed them properly. This work is profitable despite the pitfals inherent in all work, such as the theft of the animals. Luz is looking to improve her livestock and she wants to have more animals. This is her third loan request with MFP and her wish to continue forward in her communal bank and to increase her sales is big. With the funding she will buy more cattle for her cowshed and she will start to improve her livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of new sewing machines and improving her work site

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. Sok S. was born in 1965. He has been married for many years to Sokhim, 32, who raises a few pigs from home for a profit. They have 3 children who are living at home and they are cared for by their parents. To earn a living, Sok S. buys animals from rural people and fattens them for a while before selling them for a profit. Sok S. wants to make his ox trade more successful and increase his income. He is applying for assistance which will allow him to order additional animals to resell.

loans.use: To order additional animals to resell

loans.name: Mariano De Jesus

texts.es:
El Sr. Mariano M. tiene una granja  de cerdos  en su casa de habitación que está ubicada en Puente de hoyo, municipio del Viejo.
EL va a usar este crédito para la compra y crianza de cerdos.
El quiere engrandecer la granja de cerdos ya que piensa en poner un puesto de destace de cerdos en su casa, para tener más ingresos y así llevar el alimento a su hogar. 
El Sr. Mariano M. dice estar agradecido con CEPRODEL, ya que gracias a la ayuda que la institución le ha brindado le ha servido de mucho para obtener mejores  ingresos así como el desarrollo en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mariano M. has a pig farm in the yard of his home, which is located in Puente de Hoyo, in the municipality of Viejo. He is going to use this loan to buy and raise pigs. He wants to enlarge his pig farm, and is thinking of adding a butchering post to his home to increase his income and to provide food for his household. Mariano M. says that he is grateful to CEPRODEL, since thanks to the help he has gotten from the institution he has been able to increase his income and in this way improve his family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and then slaughter

loans.name: Toem's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for four women who live in the province of Siem Reap in Cambodia. They will use their loans for different purposes. 

Mrs. S. is a humble villager who earns her daily income by selling ice blocks in the village. She is married and has five kids who attend the local school. She has a life partner in her husband who is a motorcycle taxi driver. He operates his service around the community. S. has been trying to build her new house for a long time, but the construction is never completed. Because she doesn’t have enough money, she decided to ask for a loan from Kiva through HKL’s project. She will use her loan to buy supplies to help her finish building her new house. 

S. has three other borrowers in her loan group. S. will use her loan to enlarge her ice-selling trade. P. needs a loan to repair her old house. N. is a temporary worker who would like a loan to decorate her home.

loans.use: To buy supplies to finish building a home

loans.name: El Libertador Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario El Libertador  esta ubicado en municipio de Agua Fria, Nacaome. A continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la señora Nely G. tiene 58 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Celedonio Hernandez el se encuntra mal de salud, viven solos desde que fallecio su unico hijo, Nely tiene una pequeña pulperia en donde vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar. utilizara el credito para surtir mas su negocio.
La sra. Andrea U. V. tiene 33 años de edad, vive con el señor Juan Carlos Manzanarez, el le ayuda con los gastos de alimentacion y otros gastos del hogar, el se dedica al albañileria, Andrea tiene un negocio de
 venta de golosinas en su casa, en donde vende tacos, tajaditas, enchiladas, refrescos. utilizara el credito para comprar materia prima para elaborar sus golosinas.
