la señora Maria F. L. tiene 49 años de edad, es viuda y vive con su hija, tiene casa propia en donde tiene un pequeño taller de elaboracion de tortillas. Las vende a sus vecinos y personas aledañas al lugar, esta solicitando el credito para invertirlo en compra de maiz, leña.
texts.en:
The solitary Group, “El Libertador” (The Liberator) is located in Agua Fria Nacaome. Its members are involved in the following activities: Nely is 58 years old. She is married to Celedonio, who finds himself in poor health. They’ve been living alone since the death of their only son. Nely has a small general store where she sells a variety of pantry items. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to stock her business with a greater variety of products. Andrea is 33 years old and lives with Juan Carlos. He helps her with the food and household expenses and works as a mason. Andrea sells snacks out of her home. She sells tacos, chips, enchiladas, and soft drinks. She is requesting this loan in order to buy ingredients. Maria is 49 years old. She is a widow and lives with her daughter. She has her own home, where she runs a small tortilla making business. She sells them to her neighbors and people in the nearby regions. She is requesting this loan to buy corn and firewood.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 35-year-old single man. He runs a retail shop where he sells clothes and shoes to earn a living. He has been in the business for ten years and has one employee.  He has been saving his money with his group in Faulu Kenya. The group, named Tumaini Springs, guarantees loans to its members.  He has requested a loan of Kes 60,000 from Faulu Kenya to add more clothes and shoes for sale and to open an outlet.  He hopes to grow his business to a wholesale one in the future.

(The photo has been taken away from his business.)

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes and to open an outlet

loans.name: Daniel Adolfo

texts.es:
El  Señor.   DANIEL ADOLFO M. G., Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua
El tiene seis hijos a su cargo, y cuatro  de  ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado nueve  créditos con CEPRODEL durante nueve años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los nueve  créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, hierro, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de un baño en su casa de habitación. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor. DANIEL ADOLFO M. G., Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua El tiene seis hijos a su cargo, y cuatro de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado nueve créditos con CEPRODEL durante nueve años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los nueve créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, hierro, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de un baño en su casa de habitación. Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more red oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tea leaves to expand into wholesale business.

loans.name: Chadi

texts.en:
Chadi is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. Chadi has owned an electronics and home products shop since 2007. Chadi is proud of the high quality of his work. 

Today, Chadi, for the first time, is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise and install new stands in his shop. He hopes to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and install new stands in his shop.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis Y. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. He is 39 years old and married, with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Dennis owns and operates a store, where he sells fruit and sausages such as longanisa and chorizo. Dennis has been engaged in his business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Dennis joined HSPFI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting his first loan, for 5000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Muth

texts.en: Muth P., 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. P. grows vegetables to sell, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is employed at a local garment factory for an income of USD 2 each per day. P. is requesting a loan of USD 100 to purchase vegetable seeds to expand her farming. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. P.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Marinel

texts.en:
Marinel M. is from the village of Allinguigan 3rd. She is 34 years old. Marinel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marinel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Marinel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells her raised animals. Marinel said that the business is of big help in supporting their family's needs.

In 2009, Marinel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marinel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Marinel is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marinel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Josephen

texts.en:
Josephen is 36 years old. She is a married mother of six children aged between 7 and 22. All the children attend school. She has been practicing mixed farming for 18 years in Kisii town, western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, beans, tea leaves, millet, bananas, coffee, tomatoes, vegetables and milk, which she sells to the Kenya Tea Development Authority, the Coffee Board of Kenya and at the local market. 
 
Josephen has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 70,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand her cereal business and vegetable farming.  She says that with the profits from this loan, she will manage to educate her children and feed and clothe the family well. 

In five years time, she hopes to add two more quality dairy cows and be the main supplier in the locality. The challenges she faces in business are unstable prices, especially for vegetables, the high cost of pesticides, a lack of proper spraying gear and fluctuating weather patterns, which affect her crop production. 

She appreciates how far Juhudi has brought them and prays to manage her loan repayment well.

loans.use: To expand her cereal business and vegetable farming

loans.name: Parsinante Ole

texts.en:
Parsinante Ole P. is 27 years old. He is married to Kirotina Mpurunyuk and is the father of three children aged 6 years, 4 years and 2 years old. Parsinante is a farmer and he has been farming his own piece of land for the last eight years.

He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to spend to prepare land for planting potatoes. Potatoes have been doing well in her area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Parsinante's dream is become a large-scale farmer and buy his own vehicle to transport the farm produce to different markets. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend  Kshs.50,000 to prepare land for planting potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old, single woman living with her parents in Lebanon. She has been working as a farmer for the past 15 years. She used to go with her father to cultivate their land. Her father is not able to work alone anymore, so she has been in charge of their operation since 2000. During this period, she was able to develop her father’s business and start collaborating with large agricultural markets to deliver the harvest. She cultivates different types of fruit and vegetables, according to the season. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 to purchase agricultural supplies, such as seeds, for the coming cultivation season.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon N. O. is 43 years old and a member of Good Hope group registered under Faulu Kenya. He runs a furniture shop and also sells fruits to earn extra income. He has requested a loan of 15000 KES to buy timber and paints. He hopes to have a furniture show room in the future. Simon is a father of six children who go to school. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy timber and paints

loans.name: Bol

texts.en: Mrs. Bol P., 43, became a widow when her child was very young. She has been earning a living as a farmer, a skill she learned from her grandparents who passed away years ago. Bol P. has a 20-year-old daughter who shares the family's financial responsibilities by working in a garment factory. Her daughter is married and lives with her in the family home. Bol P. has more land where she plans to build a new house for her daughter and her son-in-law to live in, but she can’t achieve this goal because she does not have enough cash to make it possible. Therefore, Bol P. has requested a loan of 1200 USD to construct a new home. (Bol P. and her grandchild are pictured.)

loans.use: To construct a new home

loans.name: Joeralyn

texts.en:
Joeralyn S. is from the village of Don Andres Soriano, Lopez Jaena, in the province of Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old and is married. To make a living, Joeralyn owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Joeralyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Joeralyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase inventory. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina M. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Bulobito-on, Brgy. Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Cesar M., who is 53 years old, works as a welder to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business. They have three children who are aged between 22 and 26 years old.
Georgina joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Georgina has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 22,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing 24,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy stock for her general store so that she could continue to save up for future improvements to the business and savings for the future. Georgina M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Edwin Alexis

texts.es:
Edwin, es un joven trabajador y soñador, con deseos de superarse, tiene 19 años de edad, reside en Arambala departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la producción de tilapias, es soltero vive con sus padres, está estudiando y lo hace por la mañana, en las tardes trabaja juntamente con su padre en la producción de tilapias y labores agrícolas.
Desde pequeño se ha dedicado a trabajos agropecuarios y desde hace un año está produciendo tilapias, también siembra hortalizas, maíz y frijol, su padre es el principal apoyo.  Por el momento su deseo es construir un estanque para aumentar el área de producción ya que el que tiene ya queda pequeño, y quiere aprovechar para construir otro y; este préstamo le servirá para mejorar el lugar donde mantienen a los peces,  y le dará oportunidad de tener mejores ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Él sueña con terminar el bachillerato y poder iniciar una carrera universitaria para seguir ayudando a su familia y en un futuro poder contar con su propia casa.
texts.en:
Edwin is a hard-working young man and a dreamer who wishes to improve himself.  He is 19 years old and lives in Arambala, in Morazán department.  He raises tilapia.  Edwin is single and lives with his parents.  He studies in the mornings and in the afternoons he works with his father raising tilapia and doing farm work.

Edwin has been doing farming and livestock work since he was a little boy and he has been raising tilapia for one year.  He also grows vegetables, corn and beans.  His father is his main support.  At the moment, Edwin would like to build a pond to increase his tilapia production area since the pond he has now is already too small.  He would like to take advantage and build another.  This loan will also help him to improve the place where he looks after his fish and will allow him to improve his income so that he can help his family.

Edwin dreams of finishing his secondary education and starting a university course so that he can continue helping his family and, in the future, be able to own his own home.

loans.use: To build a pond to raise tilapia (fish)

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El  Sr. Victor Manuel  tiene  29 es soltero  y vive con su madre quien es madre soltera, viven en el Barrio San Isidro   de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo.
 El Sr. Victor al terminar su estudios de la Secundaria  tomo algunos Cursos  sobre Informatica luego siguio estudiando en la Universidad para Analista de Sistema pero no pudo concluir por falta de tiempo ya que como tenia muchos.
Trabajos a domicilio se dedico ya esclusivamente  su trabajado que es la Compra, Venta e Instalación de Computadoras y Programas. 
Esta actividad los viene realizando desde el año 2009 y le va muy bien. 
Su objetivo es Trabajar con Grandes Empresas a Equiparles y hacerle el mantenimientos de todos sus Equipos de Informática.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel is 29 years old.  He is single and lives with his mother who is a single mother.  They live in the San Isidro neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo.

When Victor finished his high school studies he took some IT courses, then he continued studying at university to become a systems analyst.  However, he couldn't finish his studies.  He didn't have enough time since he had a lot of work to do at home.  He started committing himself exclusively to his business buying, selling and installing computers and computer programs.  He has been in this business since 2009 and it is going very well.

Victor's goal is to work equipping large companies and providing them with maintenance for all their IT systems.

loans.use: To buy computers, accessories and spare parts

loans.name: G.s. Las Chacaras Group

texts.es: Este grupo lleva por nombre Las Chacaras, los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así se llama el municipio donde viven. Son personas que se conocen de hace muchísimo tiempo. Marcia Mercedes se dedica a una pulpería, hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio pues es una persona muy inteligente al pensar en una forma de obtener ingreso para su hogar. Doña Maria Luisa decidió iniciar con este negocio de ventas de frutas  por que tenia la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, y sacar a sus hijos adelante, ya que no tenía la solvencia económica suficiente para conseguir darles una mejor educación a sus hijos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.  Juntas se han unido para realizar mejorar en su negocio por medio del financiamiento.
texts.en: This group's name is "Las Chacaras", the members of the group decided to use this name because that is the name of the municipality where they live.  The members have known each other for a long time.  Marcia Mercedes has a general store, she's had this business for more than 10 years, she is an intelligent person that thought of a way to make income for her home.  Maria Luisa decided to start the business of selling fruit because she needed to improve her quality of live and her family's to get her children ahead because she didn't have enough solvency to provide her children with a better education and to support her husband with the home expenses.  They have united to improve their businesses through this loan.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: La Sr. Florencia, es Madre  soltera tiene dos  hijos de 2 años, ella tiene ya varios años dedicándose a la venta de comida en su domicilio y   distribuyendo en platos desechables por varios lugares de la ciudad. La Sra.  Florencia  envía su comida a varios mercados como ser Los pozos, la ramada, las 7 calles. Doña Florencia se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la demanda que se le  presenta y con el dinero comprara arroz, papa, fideo, cebolla, verduras, etc.  Viandas mesas y sillas. Ella  cuenta con un buen historial de deuda en la institución, es cliente antigua y además de aquello cuenta con domicilio propio, es una persona joven trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Florencia is a single mother of 2 two-year old children. She has been selling and distributing food in disposable containers all over the city from her home for many years. She sends her food to various markets, including Los Pozos, La Ramada, and Las 7 Calles. Florencia saw the need to request a loan from this organization for the great demand. The funds will be invested in the purchase of rice, potatoes, pasta, onions, vegetables, etc., and plastic table and chairs. She has a good loan history with the organization. She is a long time client and she also has her own home. She is a young and hardworking person. She is very grateful to the organization for their support.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients, and tables and chairs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma V. is from the village of Brgy. Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old. Vilma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2011, Vilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Vilma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Don Luis de 31 años de edad, se dedica a sembrar granos básicos y elaborar dulce de panela, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su familia, su esposa Rosa y cuatro hijos Carlos de 16 años, José de 14, René de 13 y Luis de 10 años de edad. El trabajo de Luis es la agricultura realizándola todos los días ya sean realizando labores con el cultivo de maíz, frijol, maicillo y en la temporada de trapiche de donde obtiene el dulce de panela, este oficio fue herencia de sus padres.
El necesita invertir en la actividad de la molienda, por lo que solicita un préstamo para llevar a cabo todo el proceso, ya que esta temporada necesita pagar mano de obra pues él solo no puede realizar el trabajo de la molienda.
Sueña con seguir en su trabajo pues es algo que le agrada realizar, pero espera que los frutos de este trabajo se reflejen en sus hijos, avanzando en sus estudios y siendo profesionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
Luis, 31, plants basic grains and makes “dulce de panela” (sweet made from sugar cane).   He lives in Corinto, Morazán department, with his family, his wife, Rosa, and four children: Carlos, 16, José, 14, René, 13 and Luis, 10.

Luis works in agriculture daily in chores related to corn, beans and sorghum and during the sugar cane grinding season he obtains the dulce de panela; this line of work was passed down to him by his parents.

He needs to invest in the sugar cane grinding activity.  He asked for a loan to accomplish the entire process because during this season he has to pay labor costs because he can’t manage the grinding by himself.

He dreams with staying in business because it’s something he enjoys but he hopes that the fruits of his labors will be reflected in his children as they advance in their studies becoming professionals in the future.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for the process of sugar cane grinding.

loans.name: Faamanu

texts.en:
Age:                            32
Marital Status:             Married
Children:                      5
Business:                    Catching & selling farm-raised fish 
Loan purpose:              To purchase additional fish to raise
Weekly profit:               400 Samoan talas (WST)

Overall Social Metric Score:*               1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                             1.5 out of 3
Level of Total Household Income:        1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.65 out of 3

F. owns and operates a business venture catching and selling farm-raised fish.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.  F. needs a loan of 2000 WST to purchase additional fish to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST per week) to improve and/or expand the business.

F. joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is F.'s 4th loan with SPBD. 

About  SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded South Pacific Business Development to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self esteem.  Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive updates on SPBD.

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale up to 3--the higher the number, the better off the person.  The metrics are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice K. is forty-eight years old, married, and has two children aged twenty three and fifteen. Her business is located at a busy area near a college known as Eregi in Kakamega. Kakamega is a rich agricultural land with sugarcane growing as the main farming activity. The region is in the western part of Kenya and is well known as the sugarbelt region. 

Beatrice sells fruits, vegetables, maize, beans and others to local people. She has been in this business for fifteen years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fruits and vegetables to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future and open a general store in the same area. She describes herself as focused, eversmiling and reserved.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Musso

texts.ru: Темиров Муссо житель Яванского района. Возраст, 37 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Образование-среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает крупнорогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Musso T. lives in the Yavan region. He is 37 years old. He is married and has four children. He has secondary education and does animal husbandry. Musso breeds cattle at home, he mainly feeds and sells small horned cattle. He has been in this business for eight years. The loan is to buy small horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy small horned cattle

loans.name: Sangoné

texts.fr:
Monsieur Sangoné S.  est un yoffois de 32 ans. Il habite dans la localité de Yoff. Il est marié et père  d’un enfant de 5 ans. Depuis  plus de 10ans il exerce l’activité de menuisier métallique  dans un atelier de la place. Il a choisi cette occupation sous la recommandation de ses parents. Aussi  cela constitue pour lui une source de revenus pour s’occuper de sa famille. 
	Monsieur S. est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis aout 2008. Il sollicite un crédit de 75 000 FRS  prévu pour l’achat d’un petit matériel qui va l’aider a rendre son travail plus performant. Son objectif  est d’accroitre ses gains et d’améliorer les conditions sociales de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Sangoné S. is 32 years old and lives in the town of Yoff.  He is married and the father of a 5-year-old.  He has worked for more than ten years as a metal joiner in a local workshop, an occupation he chose on the recommendation of his parents, and because it is a good source of income for him to support his family.

Mr. S. has been a member of the Yoff bank since August 2008.  He is requesting a loan of 75,000 FRS for the purchase of small equipment which will help him better perform in his work.  His goal is to increase his earnings and improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Alba Nubia

texts.es: Alba Nubia tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, por lo que siempre esa pendiente de lo que necesitan. Ella necesita sufragar los gastos del hogar, por lo que es la primera vez que recurre a los financiamientos, ya que ha sido de gran beneficio para su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, pues todos los días se levanta para vender sus productos, día a día trabaja arduamente en llevar el pan de cada día. Este financiamiento es para comprar perfumes, body, pinturas de uñas, pintura de labios, brillos, cremas entre otros. En un futuro le gustaría establecer una pulpería en su vivienda, pero hasta los momentos quisiera tener un gran inventario.
texts.en: Alba Nubia has 3 dependent children and is always alert to their needs.  She needs to cover her household expenses and this is the first time that she has taken out a loan.  It has been of great benefit to her business.  Alba sells cosmetics.  Every day she gets up to sell her products.  Every day she works hard to provide for her family.  She will use this loan to buy perfumes, body lotions, nail polish, lipsticks, gloss, creams, etc.  In the future, she would like to set up a grocery store in her home but for now she would like to have a good inventory of products.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, body lotion, nail polish, lipsticks, gloss, creams, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and is married with six children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Erlinda aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is from the village of Pokr Sepasar in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She was born in Pokr Sepasar and lives near her relatives.  The main economic activity in Ester’s village is farming.  She has been engaged as a private entrepreneur in farming for over twenty years.  Ester is married with four children – a twenty-one-year-old daughter and three sons (twenty-five, twenty-six, and twenty-eight years old).  She hopes to grow her business and save money to repair and improve the cattle shed.  Ester is looking for a loan to purchase seeds and fuel.  With this investment she expects the family income to increase by ten percent.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fuel

loans.name: Luis Bernardo

texts.es:
Luis Bernardo tiene 25 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y una casa

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Bernando is 25 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and child in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank called “Narcisa de Jesus” is located in the neighborhood of Recinto San Temistocles, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Luis is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He buys his supplies in Ventanas each month and then sells at the fair located in the same area. 

Luis is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be to acquire needed supplies. The challenges he faces include pests, crop diseases, and changes in weather.  His dream is to buy land and a house.  

Luis enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase  seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 48 años de edad, es casada, vive en su propia casa de la ciudad de Caacupe.
Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora. Ella posee una despensa en su domicilio,cuenta con clientela formada, ya que se dedica a este oficio hace muchos años.
Sueña con tener una despensa llena de una gran variedad de productos, donde pueda satisfacer todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
Solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva un crédito para la compra de carne para cumplir la demanda de su clientela y con el dinero sobrante construir un toldo que proteja del sol y la lluvia a sus clientes y así obtener más ingresos a su unidad familiar, en el futuro desea seguir trabajando con la Fundación y con Kiva para ir creciendo día a día para asegurar el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 48 years old, married, and lives in her own home in the city of Caacupe.

Ana describes herself as a very hard-working and tenacious woman.  She has a grocery store in her home and has an established customer base as she has been in this business for many years.

Ana dreams of owning a store full of a wide range of products where she can meet all her customers' needs.

Ana is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that she can buy meat with which to fulfil her customer demand.  With the remaining money, she will buy an awning that will protect her customers from the sun and the rain.  This will enable her to make more income for her family.  In the future, she would like to continue working with Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that she can continue growing every day and support her family.

loans.use: to buy meat to fulfil her customer demand.  She will use the remaining money to erect an awning that will protect her customers from the sun and the rain

loans.name: Josefina Andreina

texts.es:
Josefina de 28 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Su esposo labora en un hacienda San Juan y tienen un hijo de 8 meses. Se dedica a ayudar a los niños por medio de la ilustre municipalidad, como promotora.

Le encanta ayudar a los niños que se inspiro a ser parte de este proyecto municipal que ya tiene 4 años laborando en esta institución para servir a niños de los sectores marginales de playas. Labora de 8H30 am a 17H00 pm. También se dedica a vende colas, bonice, etc. con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción para arreglo de su vivienda y quiere terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Josefina is 28 years old and lives in a town called “Beaches” in a tourist area of Ecuador where there is a wide diversity of shellfish. Her husband works at the San Juan Hacienda and they have an eight-month-old child. She helps children in this illustrious town by working as a promoter. 
She gets great joy by helping children as part of a municipal project. This project, started four years ago, helps children that are in marginal neighborhoods in the town. She works from 8:30am until 5pm. She also sells sodas, popsicles, etc. With the proceeds from this loan she would like to buy construction materials in order to fix her house. She would like to finish her higher education.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks.
